original: rmi lam gyi ltas de rnams kyang sa las byung ba dang bar snang gi dang 'phags pa'i dang rnam pa gsum ster ba dang 'bring dang tha mar blta'o //üîΩgsum po de re re la yang /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi ltas de rnams kyang sa las byung ba dang bar snang gi dang 'phags pa'i dang rnam pa gsum ster ba dang 'bring dang tha mar blta'o // gsum po de re re la yang /
translated: These dream omens are also to be regarded as best, middling, and least, according as they are produced from the earth, from space, or from the noble ones.

original: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ste gsum du dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ste gsum du dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Each of these three is to be divided into best, middling, and least.

original: de la gtsug lag khang zhes pa nas bram ze dang zhes pa'i bar ni sa las byung ba'o//
analyzed: de la gtsug lag khang zhes pa nas bram ze dang zhes pa'i bar ni sa las byung ba'o//
translated: Among them, from ‚Äúmonastery‚Äù up to ‚Äúbrahmin‚Äù are those produced from the earth.

original: sangs rgyas dang ni rang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ni rang sangs rgyas //
translated: ‚ÄúBuddhas, pratyekabuddhas,

original: de bzhin rgyal ba'i nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid che //
analyzed: de bzhin rgyal ba'i nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid che //
translated: and likewise the Victor‚Äôs ≈õrƒÅvakas, and the great beings, the bodhisattvas,‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i'o //
translated: are those of the noble ones.

original: gal te 'bras bu thob pa dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu thob pa dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you attain the fruit‚Äù up to

original: bkra shis yid du 'ong ba'i tshig /'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar grags //
analyzed: bkra shis yid du 'ong ba'i tshig /'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar grags //
translated: ‚Äúauspicious and pleasing words, renowned for producing the desired fruit,‚Äù

original: zhes pa'i bar ni snang las byung ba'i ltas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar ni snang las byung ba'i ltas so //
translated: are the omens produced from space.

original: de la gtsug lag khang nas yang thog cas pa'i bar du tha ma'o //
analyzed: de la gtsug lag khang nas yang thog cas pa'i bar du tha ma'o //
translated: Among them, from ‚Äúmonastery‚Äù up to ‚Äúroof‚Äù are the least.

original: ral gri dang yid bzhin nor bu ni sa las byung ba'i rab bo /
analyzed: ral gri dang yid bzhin nor bu ni sa las byung ba'i rab bo /
translated: The sword and the wish-fulfilling gem are signs of earth.üîΩThe parasol, various flowers,

original: gdugs dang me tog sna tshogs dang / bud med bzang mo gos dkar can //
analyzed: gdugs dang me tog sna tshogs dang / bud med bzang mo gos dkar can //
translated: a beautiful woman wearing white clothes,üîΩlovely relatives and friends,üîΩscriptures, and likewise Brahmins,

original: sdug pa'i gnyen dang bshes dag dang // glegs bam de bzhin bram ze dang // zhes pa ni sa las byung ba'i ltas 'bring ngo //
analyzed: sdug pa'i gnyen dang bshes dag dang // glegs bam de bzhin bram ze dang // zhes pa ni sa las byung ba'i ltas 'bring ngo //
translated: are middling signs of earth.

original: @311a * // sangs rgyas ni 'phags pa'i ltas rab po //
analyzed: @311a * // sangs rgyas ni 'phags pa'i ltas rab po //
translated: The Buddha is the supreme sign of the noble ones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid che dang / rang sangs rgyas ni 'phags pa'i 'bring ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid che dang / rang sangs rgyas ni 'phags pa'i 'bring ngo //
translated: The great Bodhisattvas and Pratyekabuddhas are the middling noble signs.

original: nyan thos ni 'phags pa'i tha ma'o //
analyzed: nyan thos ni 'phags pa'i tha ma'o //
translated: The Shravakas are the lesser noble signs.

original: 'bras bu thob pa ni bar snang gi tha ma'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa ni bar snang gi tha ma'o //
translated: Those who have attained the results are the lesser signs in the sky.

original: mtsho dang rgya mtsho la brgyal zhing brgal ba ni bar snang gi 'bring ngo //
analyzed: mtsho dang rgya mtsho la brgyal zhing brgal ba ni bar snang gi 'bring ngo //
translated: Those who are drowning in and crossing the ocean and lakes are the middling signs in the sky.

original: de bzhin du bkra shis yid du 'ong ba'i tshig 'dod ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba gang las thos na bar snang gi rmi lam gyi ltas rab tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bkra shis yid du 'ong ba'i tshig 'dod ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba gang las thos na bar snang gi rmi lam gyi ltas rab tu shes par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, if one hears the auspicious and pleasing words that are the source of the results one desires, one should understand them to be the supreme signs in the sky.

original: rmi lam de rnams blta ba yang khyad par gyi slob ma rnams gang du dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa de'i nye 'khor du nyal bar rigs so //üîΩtheg pa chen po cher 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: rmi lam de rnams blta ba yang khyad par gyi slob ma rnams gang du dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa de'i nye 'khor du nyal bar rigs so // theg pa chen po cher 'byung ba'i //
translated: Moreover, those disciples who are especially qualified should sleep near the place where the mandala is to be drawn.üîΩThis supreme path of the Great Vehicle

original: lam mchog 'di ni dpal dang ldan //
analyzed: lam mchog 'di ni dpal dang ldan //
translated: is glorious.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: From here up to

original: theg pa rab kyi mchog 'di ni //
analyzed: theg pa rab kyi mchog 'di ni //
translated: This supreme vehicle

original: tshul la gnas na thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshul la gnas na thob par 'gyur //
translated: is attained by abiding in the method,

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni slob ma de rnams spro ba bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po la skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i theg pa chen po nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan gyi yang 'dir bshad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni slob ma de rnams spro ba bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po la skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i theg pa chen po nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan gyi yang 'dir bshad de /
translated: in order to inspire those disciples, the Great Vehicle, which was explained above as the one in which they will be born, is explained here as the qualities of the cause and result.

original: de lta bu'i theg pa khyed kyis thob pa yin no zhes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i theg pa khyed kyis thob pa yin no zhes pa bstan to //
translated: It is taught, You have attained such a vehicle.

original: lam mchog 'di ni dpal dang ldan //
analyzed: lam mchog 'di ni dpal dang ldan //
translated: This supreme path is glorious

original: zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba'i lam ste de yang sngags kyi tshul la spyod pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba'i lam ste de yang sngags kyi tshul la spyod pa'i lam mo //
translated: is the path that goes to unsurpassed enlightenment, and that is the path of one who practices in the manner of mantra.

original: lam mchog ces pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam las 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam mchog ces pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam las 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme path is so called because it is superior to the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas practicing the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam las ci'i phyir 'phags she na /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la spyod par 'dra yang lha rnams mnyes par bya ba'i phyir yan lag bzhi la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas pa dang mchod pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i sgo nas sbyin pa la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam las ci'i phyir 'phags she na / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la spyod par 'dra yang lha rnams mnyes par bya ba'i phyir yan lag bzhi la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas pa dang mchod pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i sgo nas sbyin pa la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Why is it superior to the path of the bodhisattva practicing the perfections?üîΩAlthough they are similar in practicing the perfections and so on, because they practice generosity and so on uninterruptedly through the door of mantra recitation, worship, fire puja, and so on in order to please the deities, they quickly attain the result.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par spyod pas 'bras bu myur du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par spyod pas 'bras bu myur du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir mchog go //
translated: Therefore it is supreme.

original: dpal dang ldan zhes pa ni mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid lha dang mi'i longs spyod kyi bde ba dang rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob pa dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rim gyis thob par 'gyur pas na dpal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpal dang ldan zhes pa ni mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid lha dang mi'i longs spyod kyi bde ba dang rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob pa dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rim gyis thob par 'gyur pas na dpal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing glory means that one will gradually attain the glory of the higher realms, which is characterized by the happiness of the enjoyments of gods and humans, and the glory of definite goodness, which is characterized by the attainment of the state of a knowledge-bearer and so forth, and the state of nirvƒÅ·πáa that is not permanently abiding.

original: theg pa chen po cher 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: theg pa chen po cher 'gyur ba'i //
translated: The Great Vehicle that leads to the Great

original: zhes pa ni @311b sngags spyod pa'i tshul gyi theg pa chen po ni bla na med pa'i byang chub 'byung ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin pas na cher 'byung ba zhes bya'o //üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni @311b sngags spyod pa'i tshul gyi theg pa chen po ni bla na med pa'i byang chub 'byung ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin pas na cher 'byung ba zhes bya'o // gang gi phyir /
translated: means that the Great Vehicle of the way of secret mantra is called the Great because it is the principal cause for the arising of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: khyed rnams der ni dong bas na //
analyzed: khyed rnams der ni dong bas na //
translated: Because of that, you all should go there,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur par 'os so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur par 'os so zhes pa ste /
translated: and you will become tathƒÅgatas.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po la zhugs na de yi 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po la zhugs na de yi 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, if one enters the Great Vehicle, one will attain the result of that, which is the dharmakƒÅya, whose nature is omniscient wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la rdo rje 'dzin pa spros pa med par gnas pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la rdo rje 'dzin pa spros pa med par gnas pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ...why is that?üîΩBodhisattvas do not take up the trainings without giving up body, speech, and mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su ma btang bar bslab pa 'dzin par mi byed do zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sngar dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sngom pa gsungs pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa ste /üîΩbcom ldan 'das dus gsum du sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes kyi sdom pa gang la byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mnyes par 'gyur bar bshad du gsol zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su ma btang bar bslab pa 'dzin par mi byed do zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sngar dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sngom pa gsungs pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa ste / bcom ldan 'das dus gsum du sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes kyi sdom pa gang la byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mnyes par 'gyur bar bshad du gsol zhes pa ni /
translated: The above passage explains in detail the previously mentioned vow of unobstructed wisdom in the three times.üîΩBhagavat, please explain the vow of unobstructed wisdom in the three times, abiding in which the buddhas and bodhisattvas are pleased.

original: dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sngom pa de la gnas na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mnyes ta /
analyzed: dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sngom pa de la gnas na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mnyes ta /
translated: If one abides in the vow of unobstructed wisdom in the three times, the buddhas and bodhisattvas are pleased.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs par thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu bshad du gsol zhas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs par thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu bshad du gsol zhas pa'o //
translated: Please explain such a vow.

original: dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sdom pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sdom pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The vow of unobstructed wisdom in the three times has already been explained.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gcig tu 'jug cing zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum dus gcig tu stong pa nyid la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gcig tu 'jug cing zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum dus gcig tu stong pa nyid la 'jug pa ste /
translated: As for engaging in body, speech, and mind as one, body, speech, and mind all engage in emptiness at the same time.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid gsum stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur cing dmigs su med pas chags par bya dang chags pa nyid dang chags par byed pa la sogs pa yang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid gsum stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur cing dmigs su med pas chags par bya dang chags pa nyid dang chags par byed pa la sogs pa yang dmigs su med de /
translated: In this way, body, speech, and mind become the nature of emptiness and are not observed. Therefore, the one who is attached, the attachment itself, and the one who causes attachment are also not observed.

original: de ltar dmigs su med pa na lus dang ngag dang yid rnams sdig pa la sogs pa mi byed pa de ni sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs su med pa na lus dang ngag dang yid rnams sdig pa la sogs pa mi byed pa de ni sdom pa'o //
translated: When they are not observed in this way, body, speech, and mind do not engage in negative actions and so forth. That is the vow.

original: chos thams cad la rtsom pa med ces pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos thams cad skye bar byed pa'i rgyu lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la rtsom pa med ces pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos thams cad skye bar byed pa'i rgyu lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis mi byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase all phenomena are unoriginated means that all phenomena, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres, are not produced by the three actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar de dag skyed pa'i rgyu ma byas pas na sdom pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag skyed pa'i rgyu ma byas pas na sdom pa yin te /
translated: Since they are not produced by those causes, they are restraints.

original: de dag gis ni don dam pa'i sdom pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni don dam pa'i sdom pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the ultimate restraint.

original: de yang gang zhe na /üîΩsangs rgyas @312a * //üîΩdang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag gis lus yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa'o zhes pa ni dus gsum sgrib pa med pa'i sngom pa de gzhan ma yin gyi bdag gi lus sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phul ba lus de sangs rgyas
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na / sangs rgyas @312a * // dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag gis lus yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa'o zhes pa ni dus gsum sgrib pa med pa'i sngom pa de gzhan ma yin gyi bdag gi lus sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phul ba lus de sangs rgyas
translated: What is that?üîΩThe phrase I offer my body to the buddhas and bodhisattvas means that the unobscured restraint of the three times is not something other than the offering of one's body to the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dbang ba yin gyi bdag la dbang med do //
analyzed: dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dbang ba yin gyi bdag la dbang med do //
translated: That body is controlled by the buddhas and bodhisattvas, not by oneself.

original: de ltar bdag la dbang med de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dbang na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ni mi dag ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar bdag la dbang med de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dbang na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ni mi dag ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi spyod do //
translated: Since I have no power over myself, if the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas had power over me, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas would not allow me to engage in the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: de bas na gang gis lus phul ba des kyang chos bzhin du bya dgos te ;
analyzed: de bas na gang gis lus phul ba des kyang chos bzhin du bya dgos te ;
translated: Therefore, whoever gives away his body must act in accordance with the Dharma.

original: lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mi spyod pas na sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mi spyod pas na sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He should not engage in the ten unwholesome courses of action through body, speech, and mind. Thus, it is called a vow.

original: de bas na de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de bas na de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis bdag gi lus yongs su gtang ba des ni dngos po gsum yongs su btang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gis bdag gi lus yongs su gtang ba des ni dngos po gsum yongs su btang ba yin te /
translated: Whoever gives away his body gives away three things.

original: dngos po gsum yongs su gtang ba de yang gang zhe na 'di lta ste lus dang ngag dang yid do //
analyzed: dngos po gsum yongs su gtang ba de yang gang zhe na 'di lta ste lus dang ngag dang yid do //
translated: What are the three things that are given away? They are body, speech, and mind.

original: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sngom pas bsdam par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sngom pas bsdam par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Son of noble family, therefore, the bodhisattva should be restrained by the vow of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBodhisattvas do not take up the precepts without giving up body, speech and mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su ma btang bar bslab pa 'dzin pa mi byed do zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lus phul bas lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char phul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid yongs su ma btang bar bslab pa 'dzin pa mi byed do zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lus phul bas lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char phul bar 'gyur te /
translated: By offering the body to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, one offers all three, body, speech and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum la bdag mi dbang na lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mi spyod pas de nyid sngom pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum la bdag mi dbang na lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mi spyod pas de nyid sngom pa ste /
translated: If one does not control one's body, speech and mind, one will not avoid the ten unwholesome courses of action through body, speech and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum lhas lhag pa'i sngom pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum lhas lhag pa'i sngom pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the vow, for there is no other vow higher than the vow of the body, speech and mind.

original: mdor na gang gis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag gi lus phul ba des lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char phul bas na gsum po de dag gi sgo nas mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi spyod pa de dag thams cad mkhyen
analyzed: mdor na gang gis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag gi lus phul ba des lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char phul bas na gsum po de dag gi sgo nas mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi spyod pa de dag thams cad mkhyen
translated: In brief, it is taught that by whom one offers one's body to the buddhas and bodhisattvas, by that one offers one's body, speech, and mind, and therefore, by means of those three, one does not engage in the paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions.

original: pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa thob par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa thob par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: All of those become the causes for attaining the unobstructed pristine consciousness of omniscience.

original: de nas phyis de nyin par bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la phyag byas te bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis @312b brlabs la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas phyis de nyin par bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la phyag byas te bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis @312b brlabs la zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, the next day, having made prostrations to the Bhagavat Vairocana, one should bless oneself as Vajrasattva, and so on, up to:üîΩThen, in order to purify the mind, one should offer pure incense water.

original: de nas sems sbyang ba'i phyir spos chu gtsang ma blud do zhes pa'i bar gyis nang bar dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i slob dpon gyi las su bya ba rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de nas sems sbyang ba'i phyir spos chu gtsang ma blud do zhes pa'i bar gyis nang bar dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i slob dpon gyi las su bya ba rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the activities of the master who draws the ma·πá·∏çala in the morning.

original: nang par nyi ma 'char kar brtags na lho byang dang shar nub la sogs pa gsal bar mngon te /
analyzed: nang par nyi ma 'char kar brtags na lho byang dang shar nub la sogs pa gsal bar mngon te /
translated: If one examines the rising sun in the morning, the south, north, east, west, and so on, will be clear.

original: de bas na nang par khrus la sogs pa byas nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa de'i dbus sa zhugs te bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yid la byas nas phyag byas la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings te chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas bdag nyidüîΩstong par byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de bas na nang par khrus la sogs pa byas nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa de'i dbus sa zhugs te bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yid la byas nas phyag byas la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings te chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas bdag nyid stong par byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Therefore, having bathed in the morning and so on, one should enter the center of the place where the ma·πá·∏çala is drawn, and having visualized BhagavƒÅn Vairocana, one should pay homage, form the mudrƒÅ of the three sacred commitments, and bless oneself with the emptiness of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings nas rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings nas rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Then, having formed the mudrƒÅ of the dharmacakra, one should bless oneself as Vajrasattva.üîΩThen, having formed the mudrƒÅ of the vajra armor, one should don the armor.

original: de nas rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya bcings nas go cha bgo ba de ni rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa ste rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni sems shin tu brtan pa rdo rje dang 'dra ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya bcings nas go cha bgo ba de ni rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa ste rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni sems shin tu brtan pa rdo rje dang 'dra ba la bya ste /
translated: That is the blessing as Vajrasattva. Vajrasattva is called ‚Äúvajra-like mind,‚Äù because the mind is extremely firm.

original: de yang gang zhe na phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub kyi snying po'i sems te /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub kyi snying po'i sems te /
translated: What is that? It is the essence of enlightenment, the mind that is characterized by the complete absence of error.

original: de nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i byang chub sems dpa'i skur byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i byang chub sems dpa'i skur byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: That is the consecration of the master as the body of the bodhisattva Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar slob dpon de rdo rje sems pa'i skur byin gyis brlabs la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i lho byang dang shar nub la sogs pa brtags te gtan la dbab pa dang lha rnams gang du 'god pa'i gnas kyang yid kyis gtan la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon de rdo rje sems pa'i skur byin gyis brlabs la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i lho byang dang shar nub la sogs pa brtags te gtan la dbab pa dang lha rnams gang du 'god pa'i gnas kyang yid kyis gtan la dbab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having consecrated the master as the body of Vajrasattva, he should mentally determine the south, north, east, west, etc. of the mandala ground, and the places where the deities are to be arranged.

original: yang bum pa spos chus bkang ba la 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal bas mngon bar bsngags te sgo dang por gzhag la mkhas pas skye bo kun la des bsang gtor bya'o zhes pa ni gzhung las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bum pa spos chus
analyzed: yang bum pa spos chus bkang ba la 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal bas mngon bar bsngags te sgo dang por gzhag la mkhas pas skye bo kun la des bsang gtor bya'o zhes pa ni gzhung las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bum pa spos chus
translated: Again, having filled a vase with perfumed water and enchanted it with the Trailokyavijaya, it should be placed at the first door, and the wise one should sprinkle it with that on all the people. This is the vase endowed with the characteristics mentioned in the scriptures, filled with perfumed water, enchanted with the Trailokyavijaya mantra, and placed at the first door.

original: bkang ba la rin po che dang sman dang / 'bru lnga rnams blugs te dkyil 'khor gyi khang ba'i sgor bzhag ste slob ma rnams nang du 'ong ba'i tshe bgegs bsal ba'i phyir gtor ro //
analyzed: bkang ba la rin po che dang sman dang / 'bru lnga rnams blugs te dkyil 'khor gyi khang ba'i sgor bzhag ste slob ma rnams nang du 'ong ba'i tshe bgegs bsal ba'i phyir gtor ro //
translated: Having filled it with jewels, medicine, and the five grains, it is placed at the door of the ma·πá·∏çala house. When the disciples enter, the bali is offered in order to remove obstacles.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i sngags kyis bum pa de la gdab pa de yang snying po'i sngags kyis gdab na brgya rtsa brgyad du gdab la /
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i sngags kyis bum pa de la gdab pa de yang snying po'i sngags kyis gdab na brgya rtsa brgyad du gdab la /
translated: The mantra of Trailokyavijaya is cast into that vase. If it is cast with the essence mantra, it is cast one hundred and eight times.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gdab na bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gdab bo //üîΩde nas sems sbyang ba'i phyir spos chu gtsang ma blud pa ni slob ma rnams kyi sngags spyod pa dang 'gal ba'i kha zas zos pa'i rnam par rtog pa med na yang spos kyi @313a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gdab na bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gdab bo // de nas sems sbyang ba'i phyir spos chu gtsang ma blud pa ni slob ma rnams kyi sngags spyod pa dang 'gal ba'i kha zas zos pa'i rnam par rtog pa med na yang spos kyi @313a * //
translated: If it is cast with the root mantra, it is cast seven or twenty-one times.

original: chu gtsang ma de blud do //
analyzed: chu gtsang ma de blud do //
translated: Then, in order to purify the mind, pure incense water is offered. If the disciples do not have the concept of eating food that is contrary to mantra conduct, they are offered pure incense water.

original: gtsang ma zhes pa ni srog chags kyi yan lag la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang ma zhes pa ni srog chags kyi yan lag la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPure‚Äù means that it is free from the limbs of living beings and so on.

original: sngags dang 'gal ba'i kha zas zos ba'i rnam par rtog pa med na yang spos kyi chu gtsang ma 'thungs pas bdag gi rgyud gtsang mar gyur to snyam pa'i 'du shes skye ste mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dogs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir spos chu blud
analyzed: sngags dang 'gal ba'i kha zas zos ba'i rnam par rtog pa med na yang spos kyi chu gtsang ma 'thungs pas bdag gi rgyud gtsang mar gyur to snyam pa'i 'du shes skye ste mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dogs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir spos chu blud
translated: If there is no thought of eating food that is contrary to mantra, by drinking pure incense water, the thought arises that one's continuum has become pure, and one becomes free from doubts such as impurity.

original: do // de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad cas gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: do // de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad cas gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: Then Vajrapani said to the Bhagavan...

original: rtag tu mtshan mo bri bar bya //üîΩzhes pa'i bar gyis dus ji tsam na dkyil 'khor dri ba zhus shing bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan mo bri bar bya // zhes pa'i bar gyis dus ji tsam na dkyil 'khor dri ba zhus shing bshad pa yin te /
translated: ...always draw at night.üîΩThis explains the question and answer about the time for drawing the mandala.

original: dus dang tshod ces pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i dus nam nyid kyi tshe na yin pa de bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang tshod ces pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i dus nam nyid kyi tshe na yin pa de bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase time and occasion means at what time is the time for drawing the mandala? Please explain.

original: kun mkhyen pa ni bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa ni bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Omniscience refers to the Bhagavan's omniscience.

original: smra ba'i mchog gis bka' stsol cig / ces pa ni smra ba thams cad kyi mchog ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: smra ba'i mchog gis bka' stsol cig / ces pa ni smra ba thams cad kyi mchog ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The best of all speakers is the Lord Buddha.üîΩWhen the master of the mandala

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni slob dpon dag / gsang sngags sgrub la 'bad pa na //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni slob dpon dag / gsang sngags sgrub la 'bad pa na //
translated: is striving to accomplish the mantra,

original: gang gi dus su dkyil 'khor du //
analyzed: gang gi dus su dkyil 'khor du //
translated: at what time

original: sems dpa' chen por byin rlob pa'i //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen por byin rlob pa'i //
translated: will the great beings bless him?

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor 'dri ba dang / sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor 'dri ba na byang chub sems dpa' rnams der gshegs nas byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ba'i dus gang la gas zhes zhus pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor 'dri ba dang / sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor 'dri ba na byang chub sems dpa' rnams der gshegs nas byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ba'i dus gang la gas zhes zhus pa ste /
translated: The master of the mandala, when drawing the pledge mandala and the accomplishment mandala, asks, At what time will the bodhisattvas come there and bless it?

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi bya'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi bya'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bya'o //
translated: The phrase great beings does not refer to the Lord Buddhas, but to the bodhisattvas who are practicing the perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni dus thams cad du byin gyis rlob pas zhu mi dgos la //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni dus thams cad du byin gyis rlob pas zhu mi dgos la //
translated: Why is this? Because the Blessed Buddhas are always in a state of contemplation and do not need to be requested.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas sems can thams cad kyi don la rtog pa sngon du btang ste gshegs bas dus thams cad du byin gyis mi rlob po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas sems can thams cad kyi don la rtog pa sngon du btang ste gshegs bas dus thams cad du byin gyis mi rlob po //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, on the other hand, having arisen from their contemplations, proceed with the thought of benefiting all beings, and are not always in a state of contemplation.

original: de bas na dkyil 'khor 'dri ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams gshegs par 'gyur ba'i dus gang yin zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dkyil 'khor 'dri ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams gshegs par 'gyur ba'i dus gang yin zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the time when the Bodhisattvas go to the drawing of the mandala?‚Äù

original: gnyis su na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sems dpa' chen po zhes nam yang mi brjod de /
analyzed: gnyis su na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sems dpa' chen po zhes nam yang mi brjod de /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed Buddhas are never called ‚Äúgreat beings‚Äù (mahƒÅsattva).

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod par grags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod par grags so //
translated: The Bodhisattvas are renowned as ‚Äúgreat beings.‚Äù

original: de bas na sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ni byang chub sems @313b dpa' chen po rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ni byang chub sems @313b dpa' chen po rnams la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúgreat being‚Äù refers to the great Bodhisattvas.

original: dkyil 'khor don du gnyer ba la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor don du gnyer ba la //
translated: For those who seek the mandala,

original: rtag tu mtshan mo bri bar bya //
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan mo bri bar bya //
translated: it should always be drawn at night.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dri bar 'dod pa rnams kyis dus thams cad du dkyil 'khor thams cad mtshan mo bri'o zhes bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor 'dri bar 'dod pa rnams kyis dus thams cad du dkyil 'khor thams cad mtshan mo bri'o zhes bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: This is a statement that those who wish to draw a mandala should draw all mandalas at night at all times.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang mtshan mo'i dus der gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang mtshan mo'i dus der gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is also said that the bodhisattvas will come at that time of night.

original: de bas na 'dis ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga yang dus thams cad du mtshan mo bri bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga yang dus thams cad du mtshan mo bri bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this indicates that both the mandala of commitment and the mandala of evocation should be drawn at night at all times.

original: de la gsang ba'i rgyud la sogs par sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad mtshan mo bri'o zhes 'byung ste de bas na sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor ni nyin par bri bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i rgyud la sogs par sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad mtshan mo bri'o zhes 'byung ste de bas na sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor ni nyin par bri bar gsungs so //
translated: In the Secret Tantra and so forth, it is said that all mandalas except the mandala of evocation should be drawn at night. Therefore, the mandala of evocation is said to be drawn during the day.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrub pa ni nam srod nas nam langs kyi bar tshan rangs par bsgrub dgos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni nam srod nas nam langs kyi bar tshan rangs par bsgrub dgos te /
translated: Evocation should be performed all night from dusk until dawn.

original: de bas na sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor mtshan mo bri ba'i skabs med de nyin par bri bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor mtshan mo bri ba'i skabs med de nyin par bri bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, there is no occasion to draw the mandala of the means of achievement at night, and it is said to be drawn during the day.

original: 'dir ni gnyi ga yang mtshan mo bri bar gsungs pas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ni de nyid kyi mtshan mo bri bar bya la /
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyi ga yang mtshan mo bri bar gsungs pas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ni de nyid kyi mtshan mo bri bar bya la /
translated: Here, since it is said that both are drawn at night, the mandala of the pledge is to be drawn on that very night.

original: sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor ni rgyud 'di las mtshan mo bri bar gsungs pas gsang ba'i rgyud las 'byung ba ltar nyin par bri ra med la /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor ni rgyud 'di las mtshan mo bri bar gsungs pas gsang ba'i rgyud las 'byung ba ltar nyin par bri ra med la /
translated: Since the mandala of the means of achievement is said to be drawn at night in this tantra, it is to be drawn during the day as it occurs in the secret tantras.

original: sgrub pa nyid kyi mtshan mo yang bri ba'i skabs med de nub de nyid la bris na mtshan mo'i mel tshe thun 'ga' dkyil 'khor bri ba la zad pas sgrub pa mtshan rangs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid kyi mtshan mo yang bri ba'i skabs med de nub de nyid la bris na mtshan mo'i mel tshe thun 'ga' dkyil 'khor bri ba la zad pas sgrub pa mtshan rangs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, there is no occasion to draw the mandala of the means of achievement on the night of the means of achievement itself, because if it is drawn on that very night, the few watches of the night will be exhausted in drawing the mandala, and the means of achievement will not be complete for the whole night.

original: de bas na snga de nub mo dkyil 'khor bris la phyi de nub mo bsgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na snga de nub mo dkyil 'khor bris la phyi de nub mo bsgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the mandala is drawn on the night before and the means of achievement is performed on the night after.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po dag nub gcig gis mi rdzogs pa yang gzhung de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po dag nub gcig gis mi rdzogs pa yang gzhung de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Also, one should understand that the great mandalas that are not completed in one night are performed in the same way.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor ba'i don du srad bu bre ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor ba'i don du srad bu bre ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the explanation of the string for the sake of the ma·πá·∏çala, and so on, will be explained.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba de yang don rnam pa drug gis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba de yang don rnam pa drug gis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That drawing of the ma·πá·∏çala is also complete in six topics.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat are the six?‚Äù

original: dkyil 'khor gyi srad bu bre ba'i ting nge 'dzin bshad pa dang / srad bu bre ba bshad pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi tshad bshad pa dang / snam bu'i rim pa dbye ba dang / sgo khyud dang rta babs rnams rnam par dbye ba dang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi srad bu bre ba'i ting nge 'dzin bshad pa dang / srad bu bre ba bshad pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi tshad bshad pa dang / snam bu'i rim pa dbye ba dang / sgo khyud dang rta babs rnams rnam par dbye ba dang /
translated: the explanation of the samƒÅdhi of the string of the ma·πá·∏çala, the explanation of the string, the explanation of the measure of the ma·πá·∏çala, the classification of the layers of cloth, the classification of the door lintel and pediments,

original: lha rnams kyi gnas kyi nges pa bshad pa'o //üîΩde la slob dpon gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag byas la tshon @314a * //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi gnas kyi nges pa bshad pa'o // de la slob dpon gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag byas la tshon @314a * //
translated: and the explanation of the certainty of the location of the deities.üîΩTherein, the master should make obeisance to all buddhas, hold the string of five colors, and bless himself as BhagavƒÅn Vairocana.

original: sna lnga'i srad bu thogs te bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad du byin gyis brlabs la zhes pa ni srang bu bre ba'i ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sna lnga'i srad bu thogs te bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad du byin gyis brlabs la zhes pa ni srang bu bre ba'i ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the samƒÅdhi of the string.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag byas la zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par byed pa na thog mar sangs rgyas rjes su dran zhing phyag bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag byas la zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par byed pa na thog mar sangs rgyas rjes su dran zhing phyag bya bar rigs so //
translated: The phrase having bowed to all the Buddhas means that when one enters into meditative concentration, it is proper to first recollect the Buddha and bow to him.

original: tshon sna lnga'i srad bu zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du bsam pa ste bdag rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku ye shes lnga po de dag dang ldan par byin gyis brlab po /
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i srad bu zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du bsam pa ste bdag rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku ye shes lnga po de dag dang ldan par byin gyis brlab po /
translated: The phrase five-colored thread means that one should imagine it to be the nature of the five gnoses, and one should bless oneself as having the body of Vairocana and endowed with those five gnoses.

original: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad du byin gyis brlabs la zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum la ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa yang bye brag rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad du byin gyis brlabs la zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum la ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa yang bye brag rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The phrase having blessed oneself as the Bhagavat Vairocana means that the meditative concentration on the three kinds of ma·πá·∏çala also has three kinds of distinctions.

original: snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor la slob dpon rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur byin gyis brlabs nas srad bu bre ba la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor la slob dpon rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur byin gyis brlabs nas srad bu bre ba la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya'o //
translated: On the ma·πá·∏çala of great compassion, having blessed the master as having the body of Vairocana, one should perform the ma·πá·∏çala activities such as laying out the thread and so forth.

original: yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor la chos kyi skur byin gyis brlabs nas dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor la chos kyi skur byin gyis brlabs nas dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya'o //
translated: Having consecrated the wheel of letters ma·πá·∏çala as the dharmakƒÅya, one should perform the ma·πá·∏çala rites.

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor la dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga dang ldan pa'i skur byin gyis brlabs nas dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor la dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga dang ldan pa'i skur byin gyis brlabs nas dkyil 'khor gyi las rnams bya ste /
translated: Having consecrated the secret ma·πá·∏çala as the body endowed with the five ma·πá·∏çalas such as the great ma·πá·∏çala, one should perform the ma·πá·∏çala rites.

original: de dag kyang zhib tu ni bsdus pa'i don las bshad cing rgyud nyid las kyang so so'i skabs su 'chad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhib tu ni bsdus pa'i don las bshad cing rgyud nyid las kyang so so'i skabs su 'chad do //
translated: Those are explained in detail in the Summary, and in the tantra itself in each section.

original: tshon sna lnga'i skud pa rnams ye shes lngar bsam pa ni 'og nas rdul tshon sna lnga la sangs rgyas lngar bsam pa ngang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i skud pa rnams ye shes lngar bsam pa ni 'og nas rdul tshon sna lnga la sangs rgyas lngar bsam pa ngang sbyar ro //
translated: The five colored threads are to be imagined as the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: shar du srad bu bre ba ni //
analyzed: shar du srad bu bre ba ni //
translated: The thread is to be measured in the east.

original: lte ba'i thad kar bzung nas su //
analyzed: lte ba'i thad kar bzung nas su //
translated: Having held it at the level of the navel,

original: bar snang la ni gzung bar bya //
analyzed: bar snang la ni gzung bar bya //
translated: it is to be held in space.

original: de nas lho phyogs song nas su //
analyzed: de nas lho phyogs song nas su //
translated: Then, having gone to the south,

original: byang phyogs su ni bre bar bya //
analyzed: byang phyogs su ni bre bar bya //
translated: it is to be measured to the north.

original: zhes pa ni thog mar slob dpon de dkyil 'khor gyi nub phyogs su gnas nas kha shar phyogs su bltas te 'grengs la nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor dmigs pa'i tshul bcom ldan 'das rnams par snang mdzad kyi sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan
analyzed: zhes pa ni thog mar slob dpon de dkyil 'khor gyi nub phyogs su gnas nas kha shar phyogs su bltas te 'grengs la nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor dmigs pa'i tshul bcom ldan 'das rnams par snang mdzad kyi sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rgyan
translated: This is the way the master first stands in the west of the mandala, facing east, and imagines the natural mandala in the sky, the Bhagavat Vairocana together with the inexhaustible array wheel,

original: gyi 'khor lo dang bcas pa mngon du bsams te srad bu'i thog ma grogs kyis 'dzin du bcug la shar phyogs su brkyang ngo //
analyzed: gyi 'khor lo dang bcas pa mngon du bsams te srad bu'i thog ma grogs kyis 'dzin du bcug la shar phyogs su brkyang ngo //

analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs nas byang phyogs su brkyang ste de ni nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor bsam pa'o //
translated: In the same way, he extends it from the south to the north. This is the way to imagine the natural mandala in the sky.

original: de ltar nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor sems kyis bsams nas phyis sal @314b dkyil 'khor bri ba na rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de'i gzugs brnyan lta bur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor sems kyis bsams nas phyis sal @314b dkyil 'khor bri ba na rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de'i gzugs brnyan lta bur shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having imagined the natural mandala in the sky with the mind, later when the mandala is drawn, one should understand it to be like a reflection of that natural mandala.

original: de ltar nam mkha' la dkyil 'khor sems kyis bsams pa la srad bu bre cing gos she na /
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' la dkyil 'khor sems kyis bsams pa la srad bu bre cing gos she na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúIn that way, the mind imagines the ma·πá·∏çala in space, and how can one measure it with a string?‚Äù

original: nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor bsam pa'i mtshan mar brtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor bsam pa'i mtshan mar brtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: [It is done] in order to examine the sign of the imagined natural ma·πá·∏çala in space.

original: de nas srad bu gnyis pa ni ;
analyzed: de nas srad bu gnyis pa ni ;
translated: Then, the second stringüîΩmeans that after one has taken up the string, since the first string is not the measure of the previous ma·πá·∏çala, it is suitable to measure [the second ma·πá·∏çala].

original: rang gis blangs nas zhes pa ni srad du dang po de dkyil 'khor snga ma'i dman ma yin pas brer mi rung ba'i phyir tshon sna lnga'i skud pa gzhan zhig blangs nas dkyil 'khor phyi ma bri ba'i don to //üîΩde nyid du /
analyzed: rang gis blangs nas zhes pa ni srad du dang po de dkyil 'khor snga ma'i dman ma yin pas brer mi rung ba'i phyir tshon sna lnga'i skud pa gzhan zhig blangs nas dkyil 'khor phyi ma bri ba'i don to // de nyid du /
translated: The meaning is that one should take up another string of five colors and draw the outer ma·πá·∏çala.üîΩIn that very [tantra] it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes dran zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes dran zhing //
translated: Recalling the tathƒÅgatas,

original: shar phyogs bltas te bre bar bya //
analyzed: shar phyogs bltas te bre bar bya //
translated: one should measure it while facing east.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor mi 'khrul bar gtan la dbab pa'i phyir dbus nas rgya gram du thig btab ste dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bab par phur bus btsugs la de nas srad bu de blta ba ste dbus kyi phur bu la brtod la grva bzhi gtan laüîΩdbab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor mi 'khrul bar gtan la dbab pa'i phyir dbus nas rgya gram du thig btab ste dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bab par phur bus btsugs la de nas srad bu de blta ba ste dbus kyi phur bu la brtod la grva bzhi gtan la dbab par bya'o //
translated: This is for the purpose of determining the mandala without error. Having placed a cross-wise line from the center, one should plant a dagger in the center of the mandala. Then, one should look at that thread, that is, having fastened it to the dagger in the center, one should determine the four corners.

original: de ltar gtan la phab nas grva bzhi'i mtshan mar yang phur bu bzhi gzugs srad bu yang mdud pa mi por bar skud pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtan la phab nas grva bzhi'i mtshan mar yang phur bu bzhi gzugs srad bu yang mdud pa mi por bar skud pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gdags par bya'o //
translated: Having thus determined, one should also place four daggers at the signs of the four corners, and one should also place signs of thread, etc., without loosening the knots.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes dran zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes dran zhing //
translated: One should recall the Tathagatas.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yid la byas nas zhas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yid la byas nas zhas pa'o //
translated: This means that one should bring to mind the Tathagatas.

original: de nas lho phyogs song nas ni //
analyzed: de nas lho phyogs song nas ni //
translated: Then, having gone to the south,

original: byang phyogs su ni bre bar bya //
analyzed: byang phyogs su ni bre bar bya //
translated: one should draw from the north.

original: zhes pa yang rgya gram nyid gdab pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa yang rgya gram nyid gdab pa la bya'o //

original: blo can de nas slar log nas //
analyzed: blo can de nas slar log nas //
translated: The wise one, having returned from there,

analyzed: bden bral phyogs su gnas nas ni //
translated: having gone to the direction of the rakshasa,

original: byang phyogs su ni bre bar bya //
analyzed: byang phyogs su ni bre bar bya //

analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon de lho nub kyi mtshams su 'dug nas kha byang phyogs su bltas te nub kyi ngos su thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: The master, sitting in the southwest, facing north, should lay out the thread on the western side.

analyzed: de nas g-yas su bsgyur bar bya //

analyzed: bsgyur te de ru 'dug nas ni //

analyzed: lho phyogs su ni bre bar bya //

analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon lho nub kyi mtshams de nyid du 'dug cing kha byang phyogs su bltas pa las kha shar phyogs su bsgyur te srad bu 'dzin pa'i grogs po dkyil 'khor bskor nas shar lho'i mtshams su song ste lho phyogs kyi ngos su thig gdab par
translated: The master, sitting in that very southwest, facing north, turning his face to the east, the friend holding the thread, having gone around the ma·πá·∏çala, should go to the southeast, and lay out the thread on the southern side.

original: bya'o // de nas gnas de btang nas su //
analyzed: bya'o // de nas gnas de btang nas su //
translated: Then, having left that place,

original: me yi phyogs su gnas nas ni //
analyzed: me yi phyogs su gnas nas ni //
translated: sitting in the direction of Agni,

original: sngags pa gsang sngags cho gar gnas //
analyzed: sngags pa gsang sngags cho gar gnas //
translated: the mantrin, abiding in the rite of mantra,

original: shar du srad bu bre bar bya //
analyzed: shar du srad bu bre bar bya //
translated: should measure the thread to the east.

original: zhes pa ni slob dpon des lho nub kyi mtshams de bor nas shar lho mtshams su 'dug ste shar phyogs kyi ngos thig gdab par @315a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon des lho nub kyi mtshams de bor nas shar lho mtshams su 'dug ste shar phyogs kyi ngos thig gdab par @315a * //
translated: This means that the master should give up the southwest corner and stay in the southeast corner, and should draw the line on the eastern side.

original: bya'o ; / sngags pa gsang sngags cho gar gnas //
analyzed: bya'o ; / sngags pa gsang sngags cho gar gnas //
translated: The mantrin abiding in the mantra method

analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas zhes pa'i don to // de nas de bzhin dbang ldan phyogs //
translated: means abiding in the samadhi of Vairocana.üîΩThen, in the same way, he should go to the northeast

analyzed: song nas nub tu kha bltas te // rlung gi phyogs kyi bar du ni //

analyzed: byang gi phyogs su bre bar bya //

analyzed: zhes pa na slob dpon byang shar gyi mtshams su 'dug nas byang phyogs kyi ngos thig gdab bar bya'o //
translated: The master, staying in the northeast corner, should draw the line on the northern side.

original: sngags pa yis ni de lta bur //
analyzed: sngags pa yis ni de lta bur //
translated: The mantrin should thus

analyzed: kun nas grva bzhi lham par bya //
translated: make the four corners equal all around.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gong du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dkyil 'khor de kun nas gru bzhir bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gong du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dkyil 'khor de kun nas gru bzhir bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the ma·πá·∏çala should be made square all around according to the characteristics stated above.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa na thog mar nub phyogs dang de nas lho phyogs dang / de'i 'og tu shar phyogs dang de nas byang phyogs su bya ba ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa na thog mar nub phyogs dang de nas lho phyogs dang / de'i 'og tu shar phyogs dang de nas byang phyogs su bya ba ci las yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, when the ma·πá·∏çala is measured, why is the west side measured first, then the south side, then the east side, and then the north side?

original: nub phyogs kyi ngos ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su brtags la /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi ngos ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su brtags la /
translated: The west side is designated as the individually discerning gnosis.üîΩThe south side is designated as the gnosis of uniformity. The east side is designated as the mirror-like gnosis, and the north side is designated as the gnosis that accomplishes activities.

original: lho phyogs ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su brtags shing shar phyogs ni me long lta bu'i ye shes su brtags la byang phyogs ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes su brtags te de bas na thog mar so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur la deüîΩrdzogs pa las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rdzogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lho phyogs ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su brtags shing shar phyogs ni me long lta bu'i ye shes su brtags la byang phyogs ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes su brtags te de bas na thog mar so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur la de rdzogs pa las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rdzogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, the individually discerning gnosis is first.üîΩFrom that being complete, the gnosis of uniformity is complete.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes las me long lta bu'i ye shes rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes las me long lta bu'i ye shes rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: From the gnosis of uniformity, the mirror-like gnosis is complete.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes las lus dang longs spyod dang gnas kyi mtshan nyid bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes 'byung ste de bas na rim pa de ltar smos so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes las lus dang longs spyod dang gnas kyi mtshan nyid bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes 'byung ste de bas na rim pa de ltar smos so //
translated: The gnosis of accomplishing activities arises from the mirror-like gnosis, and therefore the sequence is mentioned in that order.

original: ye shes bzhi'i dmigs pa'i yul yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes bzhi'i dmigs pa'i yul yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The object of observation of the four gnoses is the pure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de bas na srad bu rgya gram du bres pa'i ri mo ngos bzhi nas re re 'byung ba ni chos kyi dbyings la 'du ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na srad bu rgya gram du bres pa'i ri mo ngos bzhi nas re re 'byung ba ni chos kyi dbyings la 'du ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the lines of the crossed vajra are drawn from each of the four sides, meeting in the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: rgya gram gcig tu 'dus pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgya gram gcig tu 'dus pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The vajra cross is a single unit, the characteristic of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de ltar thig btab ste sa bcad nas tshon sna gcig pa'i skud pa gcig chal la bsgres te ngos kyi ri mo ma byi bar gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gdab po /
analyzed: de ltar thig btab ste sa bcad nas tshon sna gcig pa'i skud pa gcig chal la bsgres te ngos kyi ri mo ma byi bar gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gdab po /
translated: Having thus set the chalk line and divided the ground, one should draw the lines of the single-colored thread cross without blurring the lines on the sides in order to make them clear.

original: de nas dbus su zhugs nas su //
analyzed: de nas dbus su zhugs nas su //
translated: Then, having entered into the center,üîΩone should divide it into three parts.

analyzed: de la cha ni gsum du btag / ces pa ni slob dpon dkyil 'khor de'i nang du zhugs nas snam bu gsum du bcad de /
translated: The master, having entered into the center of the ma·πá·∏çala, divides the cloth into three sections.

analyzed: snam bu gsum pa de las cha bzhir bgos te cha re re yang ngos re rer sbyar ba'o //
translated: The third band is divided into four parts, and each part is joined to each side.

original: de bzhin du snam bu gnyis la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snam bu gnyis la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it in the same way for the two bands.

original: snam bu gsum @315b du bya ba ni //
analyzed: snam bu gsum @315b du bya ba ni //
translated: The third band is made in three parts.

original: sa rnams thams cad kun du yang //
analyzed: sa rnams thams cad kun du yang //
translated: All the levels are completely

original: cha gsum dag tu brtags nas ni //
analyzed: cha gsum dag tu brtags nas ni //

analyzed: zhes pas de ltar dkyil 'khor de kho ra khor yug tu rim pa gsum du bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, that ma·πá·∏çala is made in three stages all around.

original: cha rnams kyang ni re re la //
analyzed: cha rnams kyang ni re re la //
translated: And each of the partsüîΩis well examined in three parts.

original: cha gsum du ni rab tu brtag / ces pa ni snam bu gsum pa re re la yang cha gsum du bgos pa la cha gcig ni bskor ba'i snam bur bzhag cha gnyis ni lha rnams kyi gnas su bya ba ste de bas na /
analyzed: cha gsum du ni rab tu brtag / ces pa ni snam bu gsum pa re re la yang cha gsum du bgos pa la cha gcig ni bskor ba'i snam bur bzhag cha gnyis ni lha rnams kyi gnas su bya ba ste de bas na /
translated: Each of the three bands is divided into three parts. One part is set aside for the surrounding band. Two parts are made into the abode of the deities. Therefore,

original: cha gcig gis ni bskor ba yis //
analyzed: cha gcig gis ni bskor ba yis //
translated: one part is made into

original: 'khor sar byas te lhag pa yi //üîΩcha gnyis po ni lha nyid yi //
analyzed: 'khor sar byas te lhag pa yi // cha gnyis po ni lha nyid yi //
translated: the surrounding area. The remainingüîΩtwo parts are definitely made

original: gnas su nges par bya ba yin //
analyzed: gnas su nges par bya ba yin //
translated: into the abode of the deities.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te de dag ni snam bu'i dbye ba'o //üîΩblo dang ldan pas phyogs bzhi ru //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te de dag ni snam bu'i dbye ba'o // blo dang ldan pas phyogs bzhi ru //
translated: These are the divisions of the cloth.üîΩThe wise one should makeüîΩthe door-posts in the four directions

original: so so'i phyogs char sgo khyud ni //
analyzed: so so'i phyogs char sgo khyud ni //
translated: in the respective directions,

original: sdom brtson can gyis nan tan du //
analyzed: sdom brtson can gyis nan tan du //
translated: the diligent one should make
