analyzed: lha rnams gtso bo'i gnas su bya //
translated: the abodes of the chief gods.

original: zhes pa ni sgo khyud rnams rnam par dbye ba ste sgo khyud de rnams kyi tshad kyang dkyil 'khor snam bu'i dgu cha gcig tu brtag go /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgo khyud rnams rnam par dbye ba ste sgo khyud de rnams kyi tshad kyang dkyil 'khor snam bu'i dgu cha gcig tu brtag go /
translated: This is the division of the door-posts. The measure of those door-posts should be considered as one ninth of the mandala cloth.

original: nang gi snying po'i dkyil gyi sgo khyud rnams las shar phyogs kyi sgo khyud kyi nang du chos kyi sku'i phyag rgya gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi snying po'i dkyil gyi sgo khyud rnams las shar phyogs kyi sgo khyud kyi nang du chos kyi sku'i phyag rgya gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the inner heart, in the middle of the mandala, in the door-post of the eastern direction, one should place the seal of the Dharma body.

original: byang phyogs kyi nang du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po bzhag la lho phyogs kyi nang du phyag na rdo rje gzhag go //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi nang du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po bzhag la lho phyogs kyi nang du phyag na rdo rje gzhag go //
translated: In the northern direction, one should place Avalokite≈õvara, and in the southern direction, one should place VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: de'i phyir rim gyi sgo khyud rnams las shar phyogs kyi sgo khyud kyi nang du sh'akya thub pa sprul pa'i sku bzhag cing lho phyogs kyi nang du gshin rje bzhag la byang phyogs kyi nang du dbang po bzhag ste gshin rje dang dbang po la sogs pa de
analyzed: de'i phyir rim gyi sgo khyud rnams las shar phyogs kyi sgo khyud kyi nang du sh'akya thub pa sprul pa'i sku bzhag cing lho phyogs kyi nang du gshin rje bzhag la byang phyogs kyi nang du dbang po bzhag ste gshin rje dang dbang po la sogs pa de
translated: Therefore, in the sequence of the door panels, ≈öƒÅkyamuni, the emanation body, is placed inside the eastern door panel, Yama is placed inside the southern door panel, and Indra is placed inside the northern door panel.

original: rnams kyang dkyil 'khor bar ma'i snam bu la sgo khyud kyi nang du 'dug pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku nyid du rig par bya ste /üîΩgshin rje la sogs pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir yi dags rnams kyi rgyal po gshin rje'i gzugs gtso bor byas nas sgo khyud na gnas so //
analyzed: rnams kyang dkyil 'khor bar ma'i snam bu la sgo khyud kyi nang du 'dug pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku nyid du rig par bya ste / gshin rje la sogs pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir yi dags rnams kyi rgyal po gshin rje'i gzugs gtso bor byas nas sgo khyud na gnas so //
translated: Those such as Yama and Indra should be known as emanation bodies of the Bhagavat, who resides in the center of the mandala.üîΩThey are placed inside the door panels of the intermediate mandala in order to tame those beings who are to be tamed by Yama and Indra.

original: dbang po yang lha rnams kyi rgyal po ste gtso bor bya zhing sgo khyud na gnas so //
analyzed: dbang po yang lha rnams kyi rgyal po ste gtso bor bya zhing sgo khyud na gnas so //
translated: Indra is the king of the gods, who is placed inside the door panel in order to tame those beings who are to be tamed by Indra.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yang mi rnams kyi gtso bor gyur cing sgo khyud na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yang mi rnams kyi gtso bor gyur cing sgo khyud na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One ≈öƒÅkyamuni is the chief of humans and is located in the door-panel.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gzhugs  pa'i gtso bo rnams ni ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin du shes par bya ste bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid dbus na bzhugs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //üîΩchos @316a * //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gzhugs  pa'i gtso bo rnams ni ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin du shes par bya ste bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid dbus na bzhugs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no // chos @316a * //
translated: The chief ones who reside in the mandala of the essence should be known to have the nature of the four knowledges: the Blessed One Vairocana, who has the characteristic of manifest complete enlightenment, is located in the center and has the nature of the knowledge of equality.

original: kyi sku'i phyag rgya shar na gnas pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kyi sku'i phyag rgya shar na gnas pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma Body Seal is located in the east and has the nature of mirror-like knowledge.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po byang phyogs na gnas pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po byang phyogs na gnas pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Avalokite≈õvara is located in the north and has the nature of the knowledge of individual discernment.

original: phyag na rdo rje lho phyogs na gnas pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje lho phyogs na gnas pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: VajrapƒÅ·πái is located in the south and should be known to have the nature of the knowledge of accomplishing activities.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi snam bu gsum pa la shar phyogs kyi sgo khyud kyi nang na 'phags pa 'jam dbyangs gtso bo'i gzugs su bzhugs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snam bu gsum pa la shar phyogs kyi sgo khyud kyi nang na 'phags pa 'jam dbyangs gtso bo'i gzugs su bzhugs so //
translated: On the third platform of the ma·πá·∏çala, inside the eastern gateway, is Noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, residing in the form of the principal deity.

original: lho phyogs kyi sgo khyud na byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba bzhugs te /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi sgo khyud na byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba bzhugs te /
translated: In the southern gateway is the bodhisattva Sarvanƒ´vara·πáavi·π£kambhin.

original: de bzhin du nub dang byar na yang nam mkha'i snying po dang sa'i snying po dag gtso bo'i gzugs kyis sgo khyud na bzhugs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub dang byar na yang nam mkha'i snying po dang sa'i snying po dag gtso bo'i gzugs kyis sgo khyud na bzhugs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the west and north, one should understand that ƒÄkƒÅ≈õagarbha and K·π£itigarbha reside in the gateways in the form of the principal deity.

original: de ltar rim par legs phye ba //
analyzed: de ltar rim par legs phye ba //
translated: Thus, in sequence, well distinguished,

original: 'di dag thams cad byas nas ni //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad byas nas ni //
translated: having done all of this,üîΩas stated, the ma·πá·∏çala platforms are divided, and the gateways are distinguished.üîΩThe principal deities are arranged

original: zhes pa gang du smos pa ltar dkyil 'khor gyi snam bu bgo ba dang / sgo khyud rnams rnam par dbye ba dang sgo khyud rnams su lha gtso bo rnams /
analyzed: zhes pa gang du smos pa ltar dkyil 'khor gyi snam bu bgo ba dang / sgo khyud rnams rnam par dbye ba dang sgo khyud rnams su lha gtso bo rnams /
translated: in the gateways,

original: shin du bye brag phyed pas dgod //
analyzed: shin du bye brag phyed pas dgod //
translated: very distinctly.üîΩIn the center, the supreme white lotus,

original: ces pa'o // dbus su padma dkar po mchog / de ni snying po zhes su bsgrags //
analyzed: ces pa'o // dbus su padma dkar po mchog / de ni snying po zhes su bsgrags //
translated: is proclaimed to be the essence.

original: dkyil 'khor snying rje 'byung ba kun //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor snying rje 'byung ba kun //
translated: The mandala is the source of compassion.

original: des ni snying po can du byas //
analyzed: des ni snying po can du byas //
translated: It is made to have an essence.

original: zhes pa ni dbus kyi padma dkar po ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbus kyi padma dkar po ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs la bya ste /
translated: The white lotus in the center is the cause of Bhagavat Vairocana, which is the accumulation of merit.

original: dkar ba ni tshogs de nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dkar ba ni tshogs de nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: White means that the accumulation is pure.

original: snying po ni 'byung ba'i gnas te bsod nams kyi tshogs de bcom ldan 'das kyi snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid 'byung ba'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: snying po ni 'byung ba'i gnas te bsod nams kyi tshogs de bcom ldan 'das kyi snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid 'byung ba'i gnas yin la /
translated: The essence is the source, and that accumulation of merit is the source of the essence of the Bhagavat's great compassion.

original: snying rje chen po de las dkyil 'khor 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po de las dkyil 'khor 'di 'byung ste /
translated: This mandala arises from that great compassion.

original: des ni snying po can du byas //
analyzed: des ni snying po can du byas //
translated: It is made to have an essence.

original: zhes pa'o // de yi tshad kyang sor bcu drug / yan chad du ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de yi tshad kyang sor bcu drug / yan chad du ni bshad pa yin //
translated: Its measure is explained as sixteen finger breadths and more.

original: zhes pa ni dbus kyi padma'i tshad sor bcu drug ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbus kyi padma'i tshad sor bcu drug ste /
translated: The measure of the central lotus is sixteen finger breadths.

original: yan chad du zhes pa ni de las lhag par byas kyang rung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yan chad du zhes pa ni de las lhag par byas kyang rung zhes pa'o //
translated: More means that it is also suitable to make it larger than that.

original: de'i dgos pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i dgos pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The purpose of that is as follows.

original: bcu drug ni sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: bcu drug ni sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The sixteen petals are endowed with the ten stages and the six perfections.üîΩBeyond that means that it is endowed with the stages of Samantabhadra and so on.

original: yan chad du ni zhes pa de dag las lhag pa kun du bzang po'i sa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa ste mdor na padma de bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshon @316b par byed pa ltaüîΩbur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan chad du ni zhes pa de dag las lhag pa kun du bzang po'i sa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa ste mdor na padma de bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshon @316b par byed pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: In brief, that lotus should be seen as an illustration of the nature of the accumulation of merit and wisdom, which is the cause of the Bhagavat.

original: 'dab ma brgyad pa legs par rdzogs //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa legs par rdzogs //
translated: The eight petals are fully complete.

original: zhes pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs de ye shes brgyad dang ldan pas 'dab ma brgyad du gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs de ye shes brgyad dang ldan pas 'dab ma brgyad du gsungs so //
translated: This is saying that the accumulation of merit is said to have eight petals because it is endowed with the eight wisdoms.

original: de la ye shes brgyad ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang // mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa lngar 'gyur pas rnam pa lngar phye ste ye shes rnam pa de brgyad dang ldan pas 'dab ma brgyad du gyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes brgyad ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang // mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa lngar 'gyur pas rnam pa lngar phye ste ye shes rnam pa de brgyad dang ldan pas 'dab ma brgyad du gyes pa'o //
translated: The eight gnoses are the mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, the gnosis of individual differentiation, and the gnosis of accomplishing activities. Since these are the five sense consciousnesses, they are divided into five aspects. Since it is endowed with these eight aspects of gnosis, it is divided into eight petals.

original: ye shes rnams kyang chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa ste de ltar thams cad dmigs su med par rtogs pas sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa'i dngos po dang sbyin par byed pa gsum char yang dmigs su med par rtogs so //
analyzed: ye shes rnams kyang chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa ste de ltar thams cad dmigs su med par rtogs pas sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa'i dngos po dang sbyin par byed pa gsum char yang dmigs su med par rtogs so //
translated: The gnoses are the realization that all phenomena are of the nature of non-apprehension. Thus, by realizing that everything is non-apprehensible, one realizes that the three spheres‚Äîthat which is given, the thing given, and the giver‚Äîare all non-apprehensible.

original: de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs ni ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs ni ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the accumulation of merit such as generosity, which is endowed with such gnosis, should be understood to be of the nature of the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: ze bar ldan la shin tu bzang //
analyzed: ze bar ldan la shin tu bzang //
translated: Endowed with stamens, it is extremely beautiful.

original: zhes pa ze ba rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu'i yon tan ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang rnam par thar pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar brtags pa yin la bsod nams kyi tshogs de yon tan de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ze ba rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu'i yon tan ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang rnam par thar pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar brtags pa yin la bsod nams kyi tshogs de yon tan de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The stamens are the signs of the qualities of the Buddha Bhagavat, which are the concentrations, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s, the liberations, the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on. The accumulation of merit is endowed with those qualities.

original: 'dab ma'i bar ni thams cad du //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i bar ni thams cad du //
translated: All around the petals,

original: kun nas rdo rje bri bar bya //
analyzed: kun nas rdo rje bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw vajras.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje ni ye shes kyi mtshan ma ste gong du bshad pa'i ye shes brgyad po de dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje ni ye shes kyi mtshan ma ste gong du bshad pa'i ye shes brgyad po de dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The vajra is the sign of knowledge. It is said that one should be endowed with those eight knowledges explained above.

original: de yi snying po'i dbus su ni //
analyzed: de yi snying po'i dbus su ni //
translated: In the middle of its heart,

original: rgyal mchog gtso bo zhes pa bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin padma'i snying po'i steng du bri ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal mchog gtso bo zhes pa bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin padma'i snying po'i steng du bri ba'o //
translated: one should draw the supreme king, the chief. The Bhagavat, who is of the nature of manifest enlightenment, should be drawn on top of the heart of the lotus.

original: rgyal mchog gtso bo zhes pa ni bdud rnams las rgyal ba ste de rnams kyi nang na yang mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal mchog gtso bo zhes pa ni bdud rnams las rgyal ba ste de rnams kyi nang na yang mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The supreme king, the chief, is victorious over the mƒÅras. He is said to be supreme among them.

original: gser gyi mdog /'bar bcas thor tshugs dbu rgyan can //
analyzed: gser gyi mdog /'bar bcas thor tshugs dbu rgyan can //
translated: Golden-colored, with a topknot and crown,

original: 'od zer dag gis kun nas bskor //
analyzed: 'od zer dag gis kun nas bskor //
translated: surrounded by light rays.

original: mgon po nad dang bral ba ni //üîΩting nge 'dzin du gnas par bri //
analyzed: mgon po nad dang bral ba ni // ting nge 'dzin du gnas par bri //
translated: The Lord, free from illness,

original: zhes pa la 'bar bcas ni 'bar zhing sreg pa'i rang bzhin te /üîΩnyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa sreg pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'o //üîΩgser gyi mdog ni rgyas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa la 'bar bcas ni 'bar zhing sreg pa'i rang bzhin te / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa sreg pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'o // gser gyi mdog ni rgyas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: is to be painted abiding in meditative concentration.

original: thor tshugs ni 'og min gyi @317a * //üîΩgnas na bzhugs pa yin te 'og min gyi lha rnams ni thor tshugs dang bcas pa yin la /üîΩde dag dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir thor tshugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thor tshugs ni 'og min gyi @317a * // gnas na bzhugs pa yin te 'og min gyi lha rnams ni thor tshugs dang bcas pa yin la / de dag dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir thor tshugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúwith a topknot‚Äù means having a topknot.

original: dbu rgyan can zhes pa ni chos kyi rgyal po'am dbang por dbang bskur bas rin po che'i cod pan gsol ba'o //
analyzed: dbu rgyan can zhes pa ni chos kyi rgyal po'am dbang por dbang bskur bas rin po che'i cod pan gsol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith a crown‚Äù means wearing a jeweled crown, having been consecrated as a Dharma king or lord.

original: 'od zer dag gis kun nas bskor //
analyzed: 'od zer dag gis kun nas bskor //
translated: ‚ÄúSurrounded by light rays‚Äù means

original: zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'phro ba rnams kyis bskor zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'phro ba rnams kyis bskor zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the light and the mandalas of light, which are the nature of the completely pure gnosis, surround it.

original: nad dang bral ba zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gdon dang bral ba'o /
analyzed: nad dang bral ba zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gdon dang bral ba'o /
translated: Free from disease means free from the demons of the afflictive and knowledge obscurations.

original: ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa zhes pa ni so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes las mi g-yo zhing rtse gcig tu gnas la gzugs kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa zhes pa ni so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes las mi g-yo zhing rtse gcig tu gnas la gzugs kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in samƒÅdhi means not wavering from the gnosis of individual knowledge, abiding in one-pointedness, and the form also abiding in the manner of samƒÅdhi.

original: de yi shar du blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: de yi shar du blo ldan gyis //
translated: In the east of that, the wise one

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi phyag rgya ne //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi phyag rgya ne //
translated: should draw the mudrƒÅ of the buddhas.

original: gru gsum thams cad dkar po nyid //
analyzed: gru gsum thams cad dkar po nyid //
translated: All three corners are white,

original: padma'i steng gnas khor yug tu //
analyzed: padma'i steng gnas khor yug tu //
translated: abiding on a lotus,

original: 'od zer dkar pos yongs bskor ba //
analyzed: 'od zer dkar pos yongs bskor ba //
translated: surrounded by white light.

original: rab tu bsgrims te bri bar bya //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrims te bri bar bya //
translated: It should be drawn with great care.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi shar phyogs su sngon mngon par sangs rgyas pa 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phyag rgya gru gsum pa'i mtshan nyid du bri ste shar phyogs su gzhag pa ni rgya gar gyi skad du shar la p'uüîΩrba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi shar phyogs su sngon mngon par sangs rgyas pa 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phyag rgya gru gsum pa'i mtshan nyid du bri ste shar phyogs su gzhag pa ni rgya gar gyi skad du shar la p'u rba zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the past thus-gone ones who were fully enlightened to the east of the transcendent lord Vairocana. They are to be drawn in the form of a triangle and placed in the east. In the Indian language, east is called p≈´rvƒÅ.

original: 'das pa la yang p'urba zhes bya ste de bas na sngon 'das pa'o zhes gleng ba'i phyir shar phyogs su gzhag go //
analyzed: 'das pa la yang p'urba zhes bya ste de bas na sngon 'das pa'o zhes gleng ba'i phyir shar phyogs su gzhag go //
translated: Past is also called p≈´rvƒÅ, and therefore it is placed in the east because it is said to be past.

original: padma'i steng du gru gsum bri ba ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: padma'i steng du gru gsum bri ba ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Drawing a triangle on a lotus is the characteristic of the complete perfection of the three doors of liberation: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: phyag rgya de'i dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa dgod pa dang grva gnyis nas 'od gnyis 'byung bar bya'o zhes gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas 'byung ba la rdo rje rtse lnga pa dgod pa ni ye shes lnga'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya de'i dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa dgod pa dang grva gnyis nas 'od gnyis 'byung bar bya'o zhes gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas 'byung ba la rdo rje rtse lnga pa dgod pa ni ye shes lnga'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The placement of the five-pronged vajra in the secret mandala is the sign of the five intuitions.

original: 'od gnyis 'byung ba bya ba ni phyag rgya de chos sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gnyis 'byung ba bya ba ni phyag rgya de chos sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The performance of emitting two lights is the characteristic of the reality body of that seal.

original: chos kyi sku las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: From the reality body, the two bodies of perfect enjoyment and emanation are emitted.

original: padma ni sngar bshad la dkar po ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa ste padmo nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: padma ni sngar bshad la dkar po ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa ste padmo nyid la bya'o //
translated: The lotus has been explained above. White means the purity of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: 'od zer gyis bskor ba ni ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyis bskor ba ni ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bas bskor ba'o //
translated: Surrounded by light rays means surrounded by the light of intuition.

original: thams cad dkar po nyid ces pa ni phyag @317b rgya de nyid dkar por bya ste yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dkar po nyid ces pa ni phyag @317b rgya de nyid dkar por bya ste yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All white means that very seal should be made white, because it is completely pure.

original: de'i byang du mkhas rnams kyis //
analyzed: de'i byang du mkhas rnams kyis //
translated: To the north of that, the wise

original: skyob pa dag ni kun gyi yum //
analyzed: skyob pa dag ni kun gyi yum //
translated: should draw the mother of all the protectors.

original: gser gyi mdog can 'bar dang bcas //
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can 'bar dang bcas //
translated: golden-colored, blazing,

original: na bza' dag ni dkar po mnabs //
analyzed: na bza' dag ni dkar po mnabs //
translated: wearing a white garment,

original: kun du rnam par snang mdzad pa //
analyzed: kun du rnam par snang mdzad pa //
translated: illuminating all around,

original: ting nge 'dzin du gnas par bri //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du gnas par bri //
translated: she is to be painted abiding in meditative concentration.

original: zhes pa ni phyag rgya gru gsum pa'i byang phyogs su bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i spyan bri ba ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin mngon par byang chub pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag rgya gru gsum pa'i byang phyogs su bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i spyan bri ba ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin mngon par byang chub pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab po //
translated: This is the painting of the Blessed Lady Akasha-garbha in the northern direction of the triangular ma·πá·∏çala. She is the wisdom that has the nature of the perfection of wisdom and is endowed with manifest enlightenment.

original: skyob pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te shes rab de las byung bas na de skyob pa rnams kyi yum mo //
analyzed: skyob pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te shes rab de las byung bas na de skyob pa rnams kyi yum mo //
translated: The protectors are the Blessed Buddhas, and since she has arisen from that wisdom, she is the mother of the protectors.

original: 'bar dang bcas ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sreg pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bar ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar dang bcas ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sreg pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bar ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Blazing means having a nature that burns away the obscurations of knowables and afflictions.

original: gser mdog can ni rgyas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gser mdog can ni rgyas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Golden-colored means having a nature of expansion.

original: na bza' dkar po mnabs pa ni na bza' ni g-yogs par byed pa ste de nyid dag pas dkar po'o //
analyzed: na bza' dkar po mnabs pa ni na bza' ni g-yogs par byed pa ste de nyid dag pas dkar po'o //
translated: Wearing a white garment means covering with a garment, and that itself is pure, so it is white.

original: de bas na shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i g-yogs ma dag pa'i mtshan ma ni na bza' dkar po'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i g-yogs ma dag pa'i mtshan ma ni na bza' dkar po'o //
translated: The sign of the purity of the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions is the white robe.

original: kun du rnam par snang mdzad pa ni shin tu dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kun du rnam par snang mdzad pa ni shin tu dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: The all-pervading light is the pervasion by the nature of wisdom, which is extremely pure and naturally luminous.

original: ting nge 'dzin du gnas zhes pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i gzugs su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du gnas zhes pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i gzugs su gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in samƒÅdhi means abiding in an unmoving form.

original: mgon po yi ni byang phyogs su //
analyzed: mgon po yi ni byang phyogs su //
translated: In the north of the lord,

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang dpa' bo ni //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang dpa' bo ni //
translated: the heroic Avalokite≈õvara,üîΩsitting on a white lotus seat,

original: padma dkar po'i stan la 'dug / dung dang kun da zla ba 'dra //
analyzed: padma dkar po'i stan la 'dug / dung dang kun da zla ba 'dra //
translated: the color of a conch, jasmine, or moon,

original: dbul 'od dpag med bzhugs pa //
analyzed: dbul 'od dpag med bzhugs pa //
translated: with AmitƒÅbha on his crown,

original: bzhin ni bag tsam 'dzum par bri //
analyzed: bzhin ni bag tsam 'dzum par bri //
translated: his face painted with a slight smile.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi g-yas rol byang phyogs kyi ngos su padma'i rigs kyi bdag po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po bri ba ste spyan ras gzigs zhes pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis sems
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi g-yas rol byang phyogs kyi ngos su padma'i rigs kyi bdag po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po bri ba ste spyan ras gzigs zhes pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis sems
translated: This is Avalokite≈õvara, the lord of the lotus family, who should be painted on the northern side to the right of the Blessed One Vairocana.

original: can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar bya ba'i phyir gzigs pa dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar bya ba'i phyir gzigs pa dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la gzigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAvalokita‚Äù means that he looks with the nature of the discriminating awareness to liberate and bring to full maturity all sentient beings, and he looks at the purity of the realm of reality.

original: dpa' bo ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i chom rkun 'joms pa la dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i chom rkun 'joms pa la dpa' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHero‚Äù means that he is a hero in destroying the thieves of the obscurations of the knowable and of the afflictions.

original: padma dkar po'i stan la 'dug pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: padma dkar po'i stan la 'dug pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSeated on a white lotus seat‚Äù means that he has the nature of the completely pure accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las padma dmar por gsungs la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las padma dmar por gsungs la /
translated: In the Yoga Tantra, he is said to be on a red lotus.

original: 'dir dkar por gsungs pa de @318a * //
analyzed: 'dir dkar por gsungs pa de @318a * //
translated: Here, he is said to be on a white lotus.

original: yang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni thabs gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni thabs gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: The Yoga Tantra emphasizes method.

original: thabs kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar bya ba'i don la zhen bar bstan pa'i phyir dmar por bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar bya ba'i don la zhen bar bstan pa'i phyir dmar por bstan pa'o //
translated: It is shown as red in order to demonstrate the attachment to the purpose of completely ripening and liberating sentient beings by means of skillful means.

original: rgyud 'di ni shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyis chos thams cad shin tu dag par rtogs pa'i mtshon byed du dkar por bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud 'di ni shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyis chos thams cad shin tu dag par rtogs pa'i mtshon byed du dkar por bstan to //
translated: This tantra is shown as white in order to symbolize the realization of all phenomena as completely pure by means of wisdom, which is the principal [factor] of wisdom.

original: dung dang kun da zla ba 'dra //
analyzed: dung dang kun da zla ba 'dra //
translated: Like a conch, jasmine, or the moon.

original: zhes pa ni sku'i kha dog dung dang me tog kun da dang zla ba ltar dkar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku'i kha dog dung dang me tog kun da dang zla ba ltar dkar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the color of the body, like a conch, jasmine flower, or the moon.

original: dbu la 'od dpag med bzhugs pa //
analyzed: dbu la 'od dpag med bzhugs pa //
translated: AmitƒÅbha resides on the head.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas de'i mtshan mar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas de'i mtshan mar bstan pa'o //
translated: Since AmitƒÅbha is the nature of the wisdom of discernment, it is taught as its symbol.

original: gnyis su ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las rigs so so las dbang bskur ba so so ste /
analyzed: gnyis su ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las rigs so so las dbang bskur ba so so ste /
translated: In two [ways], in the Yoga Tantra, the individual initiations are from the individual families.

original: padma'i rigs la snang ba mtha' yas kyis dbang bskur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma'i rigs la snang ba mtha' yas kyis dbang bskur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the lotus family, it is because AmitƒÅbha confers the initiation.

original: bzhin ni bag tsam 'dzum pa zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la mi gnas par sems can chos bshad pa la sogs pa'i phyir du 'dzum zhing zhal ma btsums pa'i don to //
analyzed: bzhin ni bag tsam 'dzum pa zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la mi gnas par sems can chos bshad pa la sogs pa'i phyir du 'dzum zhing zhal ma btsums pa'i don to //
translated: The line her face is smiling slightly means that, in order to explain the Dharma to sentient beings and so forth, she is smiling and not frowning.

original: de yi g-yas su lha mo ni //
analyzed: de yi g-yas su lha mo ni //
translated: To the right of him is the goddess

original: sgrol ma grags pa chen mo de //
analyzed: sgrol ma grags pa chen mo de //
translated: TƒÅrƒÅ, the great renowned one,

original: dge zhing 'jigs pa sel ba ste //
analyzed: dge zhing 'jigs pa sel ba ste //
translated: virtuous and dispelling fear,

original: sngo bsangs ma la sna tshogs gzugs //
analyzed: sngo bsangs ma la sna tshogs gzugs //
translated: dark blue, with a variegated form.

original: bud med dar la bab pa'i tshad //
analyzed: bud med dar la bab pa'i tshad //
translated: She is the measure of a young woman,

original: thal sbyar me tog autpala thogs //
analyzed: thal sbyar me tog autpala thogs //
translated: with palms joined, holding an utpala flower,

original: 'od zer dag gis kun bskor zhing //
analyzed: 'od zer dag gis kun bskor zhing //
translated: surrounded by light rays,

original: gos ni dkar po gyon par bri //
analyzed: gos ni dkar po gyon par bri //
translated: and drawn wearing white garments.

original: zhes pa ni spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos sems can gyi khams la gzigs nas bdag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa thams cad mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don du bsngos te bsgral kyang sems can de dag ma lus par
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos sems can gyi khams la gzigs nas bdag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa thams cad mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don du bsngos te bsgral kyang sems can de dag ma lus par
translated: This is Avalokite≈õvara looking at the realm of sentient beings and dedicating all his accumulations of merit and wisdom and so forth for the sake of all infinite sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba las rgal bar ma gyur pa gzigs nas thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis byung ba'i spyan chab las sgrol ma'i lha mo mang po byung nas sems can thams cad sgrol bar byed ba'i gzugs su gyur pa ste de bas na lha mo sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las rgal bar ma gyur pa gzigs nas thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis byung ba'i spyan chab las sgrol ma'i lha mo mang po byung nas sems can thams cad sgrol bar byed ba'i gzugs su gyur pa ste de bas na lha mo sgrol ma'o //
translated: Having seen that they have not crossed over from cyclic existence, she is born from the tears of compassion, and many goddesses of Tara appear, taking the form of those who liberate all sentient beings. Therefore, she is the goddess Tara.

original: gzhan rnam pa du ma yang rgyud gzhan las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnam pa du ma yang rgyud gzhan las shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know her many other aspects from other tantras.

original: grags chen ni yon tan gyi tshig go //
analyzed: grags chen ni yon tan gyi tshig go //
translated: Greatly renowned is a word for her good qualities.

original: dge zhing 'jigs pa sel ba zhes pa ni rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa brgyad sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge zhing 'jigs pa sel ba zhes pa ni rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa brgyad sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Beneficent and dispelling fear means she dispels the eight fears of kings, thieves, and so on.

original: sngo bsangs ni kha dog dkar @318b po dang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa bsdus pa las ljang gur 'gyur te kha dog dkar po dang ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod kyi las kyi mtshan ma
analyzed: sngo bsangs ni kha dog dkar @318b po dang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa bsdus pa las ljang gur 'gyur te kha dog dkar po dang ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod kyi las kyi mtshan ma
translated: Green is a color that comes from combining white, blue, yellow, and so on. White, yellow, blue, and so on are the signs of the activities of pacifying, increasing, and destroying.

original: ste de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni las thams cad byed pa'o //
analyzed: ste de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni las thams cad byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is all of these is the one who performs all actions.

original: sna tshogs gzugs zhes pa ni sems can rnam pa mang po'i don du res 'ga' ni pho'i gzugs dang / res 'ga' ni mo'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbud med dar la bab ba'i tshad //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs zhes pa ni sems can rnam pa mang po'i don du res 'ga' ni pho'i gzugs dang / res 'ga' ni mo'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // bud med dar la bab ba'i tshad //
translated: The one who has various forms is the one who, for the sake of many kinds of sentient beings, sometimes takes on the form of a man, sometimes the form of a woman, and so on.

original: ces pa ni gzhon te yon tan rdzogs pa yang ma yin /üîΩyon tan rnams las 'das pa'i byang chub kyi mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rgas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ces pa ni gzhon te yon tan rdzogs pa yang ma yin / yon tan rnams las 'das pa'i byang chub kyi mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rgas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The one who is in the prime of youth is the one who is neither too young, that is, not fully developed in good qualities,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad la bab pa'o //üîΩthal sbyar me tog autpala thogs //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad la bab pa'o // thal sbyar me tog autpala thogs //
translated: nor too old, that is, not beyond the stage of the perfection of good qualities, but is in the prime of life, having reached the measure of the perfection of the accumulation of merit and knowledge.üîΩ The one who has joined palms and holds an utpala flower is the one who holds the door of various liberations. Therefore, the sword-like utpala leaf should be understood as the door of the liberation of wisdom.üîΩ The one who has a smiling face is the one who has a face that is always smiling, that is, is never without the joy of meditative concentration.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo sna tshogs 'dzin pa ste de bas na autpala'i 'dab ma ral gri lta bu ni shes rab kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo lta bur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo sna tshogs 'dzin pa ste de bas na autpala'i 'dab ma ral gri lta bu ni shes rab kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo lta bur shes par bya'o //
translated: The one who is adorned with all ornaments is the one who is adorned with the major and minor marks, which are the ornaments of a Buddha.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the three secrets is the one who is the essence of the three secrets of body, speech, and mind.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five exalted wisdoms is the one who is the essence of the five exalted wisdoms of mirror-like exalted wisdom and so on.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five gnoses is the one who is the essence of the five gnoses of the gnosis of the sphere of reality and so on.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five buddhas is the one who is the essence of the five buddhas of Vairochana and so on.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five families is the one who is the essence of the five families of the Tathagata family and so on.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five aggregates is the one who is the essence of the five aggregates of form and so on.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five elements is the one who is the essence of the five elements of earth and so on.üîΩ The one who is the essence of the five poisons is the one who is the essence of the five poisons of

analyzed: 'od zer dag gis kun bskor zhing //
translated: Surrounded by rays of light.

analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bas bskor ba'o //
translated: This means that he is surrounded by the light of pristine awareness.

analyzed: gos ni dkar po gyon pa ni ngo tsha dang ldan pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: He wears white garments, which is a sign of modesty.

original: ji ltar gos kyis g-yogs shing mi snang bar bya ba bzhin du ngo tsha ba yang 'chab cing sba ba'i mtshan ma ste ngo tsha de dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: dkar po ni ngo tsha nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan ma'o //

analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo tsha dang ldan zhe na /

analyzed: ngo tsha ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan de de ltar ni 'og nas 'chad do //

translated: The phrase surrounded by white, yellow, and red light rays indicates the possession of the light of pristine consciousness. The light itself has the colors of white, yellow, and red, which are the signs of performing all activities such as pacifying and increasing.

translated: should quickly go to the northern directionüîΩand draw the king of godsüîΩsitting on Mount Meru,

original: 'dug cing lha rnams kyis bskor ba //
analyzed: 'dug cing lha rnams kyis bskor ba //
translated: surrounded by gods,

original: lag na rdo rje cod pan can //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje cod pan can //
translated: with Vajrapani as his crown.

original: rgyan kun gyis ni brgyan par bri //
analyzed: rgyan kun gyis ni brgyan par bri //
translated: He is drawn adorned with all ornaments.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i lha rnams gdul ba'i phyir sku mi zad pa'i rgyan de nyid lha rnams kyi rgyal po dbang po dbang po'i gzugs su gyur pa ste de yang byang phyogs kyi ngos sgo khyud @324a * //üîΩkyi nang du bri'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i lha rnams gdul ba'i phyir sku mi zad pa'i rgyan de nyid lha rnams kyi rgyal po dbang po dbang po'i gzugs su gyur pa ste de yang byang phyogs kyi ngos sgo khyud @324a * // kyi nang du bri'o //
translated: This is the same inexhaustible ornament of body for the purpose of subduing the desire gods, in the form of Indra, king of the gods. He is drawn inside the gateway in the northern direction.

original: de yang ri rab kyi rtse mo la gnas shing 'khor lha rnams kyis bskor ba bri ste cod ban ni rgyal po'i tshul 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: de yang ri rab kyi rtse mo la gnas shing 'khor lha rnams kyis bskor ba bri ste cod ban ni rgyal po'i tshul 'dzin pas so //
translated: He is drawn on the peak of Mt. Meru, surrounded by a retinue of gods, because Candra is the king of the gods.

original: rdo rje ni de'i ye shes kyi mtshan ma ste gnyis su na lag cha'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de'i ye shes kyi mtshan ma ste gnyis su na lag cha'o //
translated: The vajra is the sign of his gnosis, and in another way it is his weapon.

original: de nas de yi shar du ni //
analyzed: de nas de yi shar du ni //
translated: Then to his east

original: chu lha lag na zhags thogs bri //
analyzed: chu lha lag na zhags thogs bri //
translated: one should draw Varuna, the holder of the noose.

original: zhes pa ni shar phyogs su chu'i dbang po bri ba ste zhags pa ni de nyid kyi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shar phyogs su chu'i dbang po bri ba ste zhags pa ni de nyid kyi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the drawing of the lord of the water element in the eastern direction. The noose is the nature of his path.

original: shar phyogs su bri ba ni pur ba zhes ba sngon gyi tshig ste bskal ba 'byung ba'i 'og tu chu'i dkyil 'khor gyis thog mar gzhi btsugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shar phyogs su bri ba ni pur ba zhes ba sngon gyi tshig ste bskal ba 'byung ba'i 'og tu chu'i dkyil 'khor gyis thog mar gzhi btsugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the east, Pura is an ancient word, because after the formation of the eon, the water mandala first established the ground.

original: nyi ma shing rta'i steng 'dug bri //
analyzed: nyi ma shing rta'i steng 'dug bri //
translated: The sun is drawn sitting on a chariot.

original: zhes pa ni chu'i rgyal po'i shar phyogs su nyi ma bri ste shing rta ni nyi ma'i bzhon pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chu'i rgyal po'i shar phyogs su nyi ma bri ste shing rta ni nyi ma'i bzhon pa'o //
translated: In the east of the king of waters, the sun is drawn. The chariot is the mount of the sun.

original: shar phyogs su bri ba ni sngon gyi tshig ste bskal pa 'byung ba'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa rnams kyi nang na nyi ma dang zla ba dang por byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shar phyogs su bri ba ni sngon gyi tshig ste bskal pa 'byung ba'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa rnams kyi nang na nyi ma dang zla ba dang por byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word east is an ancient word, because after the formation of the eon, among worldly beings, the sun and moon first appeared.

original: de yi g-yas dang g-yon du ni //
analyzed: de yi g-yas dang g-yon du ni //
translated: To its right and left,

original: rgyal dang rnam par rgyal ba bri //
analyzed: rgyal dang rnam par rgyal ba bri //
translated: Jaya and Vijaya are drawn.

original: zhes pa ni nyi ma'i chung ma gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyi ma'i chung ma gnyis so //
translated: These are the two wives of the sun.

original: de'i g-yas su tshangs pa ni //
analyzed: de'i g-yas su tshangs pa ni //
translated: To its right, Brahma,

original: gdong bzhi pa la thor tshugs can //
analyzed: gdong bzhi pa la thor tshugs can //
translated: with four faces and matted hair,

original: aom zhes bya ba lhur len pa //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba lhur len pa //
translated: reciting Om,

original: ngang pa padma'i stan 'dug bri //
analyzed: ngang pa padma'i stan 'dug bri //
translated: is drawn sitting on a lotus seat with a goose.

original: zhes pa ni dbang po'i g-yas logs su nub kyi phyogs su tshangs pa bri ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang po'i g-yas logs su nub kyi phyogs su tshangs pa bri ba ste /
translated: This is Brahma, who is drawn on the right side of the door, in the west.

original: gdong bzhi ba ni rig byed bzhi'i so so nas 'byung ba'o //üîΩngang pa padma'i stan 'dug bri //
analyzed: gdong bzhi ba ni rig byed bzhi'i so so nas 'byung ba'o // ngang pa padma'i stan 'dug bri //
translated: He has four faces, because he is the source of the four Vedas.üîΩHe is drawn sitting on a lotus seat, with a goose.

original: zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i bzhon pa ngang pa'i ste ngang pa'i steng du padmo gzhag pa la 'dug par bri'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i bzhon pa ngang pa'i ste ngang pa'i steng du padmo gzhag pa la 'dug par bri'o //
translated: The goose is Brahma's vehicle. He is drawn sitting on a goose, with a lotus placed on top of the goose.

original: aom gyi sgra 'byin pa'i tshul dang phyag rgya ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa dang sbyar ro //üîΩde yi nub tu bri ba ni //
analyzed: aom gyi sgra 'byin pa'i tshul dang phyag rgya ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa dang sbyar ro // de yi nub tu bri ba ni //
translated: The mudra and the way of uttering the syllable Om are to be applied as explained in the secret mandala.

original: sa yi lha dang dbyangs can dang // khyab 'jug skem byed de bzhin rlung //
analyzed: sa yi lha dang dbyangs can dang // khyab 'jug skem byed de bzhin rlung //
translated: Next, in the west, one should draw the earth goddess, Sarasvati, Vishnu, Varuna, the wind god,

original: bde byed de bzhin zla ba ste ;
analyzed: bde byed de bzhin zla ba ste ;
translated: the moon, and likewise Bhava.

original: / nub kyi phyogs su gnas nas ni //
analyzed: / nub kyi phyogs su gnas nas ni //
translated: They should be drawn in the west,

original: rab tu nan tan byas te bri //
analyzed: rab tu nan tan byas te bri //
translated: in the proper order, with great care.

original: zhes pa ni nub phyogs kyi ngos su khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i lha de dag lho phyogs nas brtsams te rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nub phyogs kyi ngos su khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i lha de dag lho phyogs nas brtsams te rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
translated: This means that the gods Vishnu and so forth should be drawn on the western side, beginning from the south, in the proper order.

original: nub phyogs su bri ba ni sgo nub tu btod pas sgo gar bri ba ste dbang po dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i lha de rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du 'jug pa'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nub phyogs su bri ba ni sgo nub tu btod pas sgo gar bri ba ste dbang po dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i lha de rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du 'jug pa'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The drawing in the west is the drawing in the direction of the western door, because the gods such as Indra and Vishnu are the door to entering the supramundane path.

original: de rnams kyang sku mi zad pa'i rgyan de nyid de lha de dag 'dul ba'i phyir de dag nyid kyi gzugs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sku mi zad pa'i rgyan de nyid de lha de dag 'dul ba'i phyir de dag nyid kyi gzugs su gyur pa'o //
translated: And those are the very same inexhaustible ornament of body, because they become the forms of those gods in order to tame those gods.

original: sku mi zad rgyan de dbang po la sogs pa de dag gi gzugs su gyur pa yang cha lugs de dag @324b dang 'dra mod kyi de dag 'dul ba'i phyir mthu dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa de dag las lhag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sku mi zad rgyan de dbang po la sogs pa de dag gi gzugs su gyur pa yang cha lugs de dag @324b dang 'dra mod kyi de dag 'dul ba'i phyir mthu dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa de dag las lhag par shes par bya'o //
translated: And those inexhaustible ornament of body that become the forms of those Indra and so forth are similar in appearance to those, but in order to tame them, one should understand that they have greater power, miracles, and so forth than those.

original: de bzhin du gshin rje la sogs pa gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gshin rje la sogs pa gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, one should apply this to other gods such as Yama.

original: bris nas bsngags pas de nas ni //
analyzed: bris nas bsngags pas de nas ni //
translated: Having drawn, then by praising

original: yid la 'khrul ba med pa ru //
analyzed: yid la 'khrul ba med pa ru //
translated: without error in the mind,

original: gsang sngags mgon po'i 'og logs su //
analyzed: gsang sngags mgon po'i 'og logs su //
translated: below the lord of mantra

original: khro chen gzhan gyis mi thub ces //
analyzed: khro chen gzhan gyis mi thub ces //
translated: is the great wrathful one called Aparajita.

original: bya ba nyid dang lha mo ni //
analyzed: bya ba nyid dang lha mo ni //
translated: The Action, the Goddess,

original: gzhan gyis mi thub ma dang ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub ma dang ni //
translated: Aparajita,

original: sa bdag lag na bum pa thogs //
analyzed: sa bdag lag na bum pa thogs //
translated: the Earth Goddess, holding a vase in her hand,

original: gus par yang dag gnas par bri //
analyzed: gus par yang dag gnas par bri //
translated: should be painted, respectfully abiding.

original: zhes pa la khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa la khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Here, the wrathful Aparajita is the nature of the uninterrupted path of Bhagavat Shakyamuni.

original: lha mo gzhan gyis mi thub ma ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i mthu brtan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo gzhan gyis mi thub ma ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i mthu brtan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Goddess Aparajita is the firm power of Bhagavat Shakyamuni.

original: sa'i lha mo lag na bum pa thogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du gyur pa ste de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i spyan sngar 'og ma zad bu pri'o //
analyzed: sa'i lha mo lag na bum pa thogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du gyur pa ste de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i spyan sngar 'og ma zad bu pri'o //
translated: The Earth Goddess holding a vase in her hand is under the control of the Bhagavat. They are all painted in front of Bhagavat Shakyamuni.

original: klu chen dga' bo bsnyen dga' dang // sh'akya seng ge skyob pa yi //
analyzed: klu chen dga' bo bsnyen dga' dang // sh'akya seng ge skyob pa yi //
translated: The great Nagas Nanda and Upananda,üîΩat the two doors,

original: sgo drung gnyis su mngon phyogs par //
analyzed: sgo drung gnyis su mngon phyogs par //
translated: facing outward,

original: rab tu bsgrims te bri bar bya //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrims te bri bar bya //
translated: should be painted, very attentive.

original: zhes pa ni sgo'i pha rol tshu rol nas phan tshun gdong phyogs par bri ste chab sgo bar shes bar bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang sh'akya thub pa yi //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgo'i pha rol tshu rol nas phan tshun gdong phyogs par bri ste chab sgo bar shes bar bya'o // gzhan yang sh'akya thub pa yi //
translated: This means that one should draw them facing each other across from the door, and one should understand that this is the gate of the water.üîΩMoreover, in all the tantras of Shakyamuni,

original: rgyud rnams kun las dkyil 'khor du //
analyzed: rgyud rnams kun las dkyil 'khor du //
translated: the ma·πá·∏çalas

original: sngags dang phyag rgya gang bshad pa //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya gang bshad pa //
translated: and the mantras and mudrƒÅs that are explained,

original: de dag kyang ni mkhas pas bri //
analyzed: de dag kyang ni mkhas pas bri //
translated: those also should be drawn by the wise.üîΩThis means that one should draw the mudrƒÅs of Lord Shakyamuni, such as the begging bowl, the kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga, and so on, as they occur in the tantras.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i phyag rgya lhung bzed dang 'khar gsil la sogs pa rgyud las 'byung ba rnams ji ltar rig par bya'o zhes glod ni 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams chos nyan pa'i tshulüîΩdu bzhugs par bri ba bshad de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i phyag rgya lhung bzed dang 'khar gsil la sogs pa rgyud las 'byung ba rnams ji ltar rig par bya'o zhes glod ni 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams chos nyan pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bri ba bshad de /
translated: One should draw the great bodhisattvas, such as ƒÄrya Ma√±jugho·π£a, in the manner of listening to the Dharma.

original: de la chos nyan pa ni lung gi chos dang rtogs pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de la chos nyan pa ni lung gi chos dang rtogs pa'i chos te /
translated: Listening to the Dharma is the Dharma of transmission and the Dharma of realization.

original: lung gi chos zhal nas gsungs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lung gi chos zhal nas gsungs pa rnams so //
translated: The Dharma of transmission is the teachings spoken by the Buddha.

original: rtogs pa'i chos ni sku mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor nang ma gnyis kyi nang na sku bzhi po 'khor dang bcas pa ste de bas na de dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du byas pa'iüîΩtshul du bri bar bstan te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos ni sku mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor nang ma gnyis kyi nang na sku bzhi po 'khor dang bcas pa ste de bas na de dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du byas pa'i tshul du bri bar bstan te /
translated: Therefore, in order to realize those, the bodhisattvas are taught to be drawn surrounding and in front of them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa las skyes pa sha stag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa las skyes pa sha stag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Those bodhisattvas should be understood to be born from the perfections.

original: sngags pa de nas phyir byung nas //
analyzed: sngags pa de nas phyir byung nas //
translated: The mantra practitioner, having emerged from that,

original: cha gsum pa ni nges pa la /
analyzed: cha gsum pa ni nges pa la /
translated: in the definite three sections,

original: @325a * // rdo rje dam pa sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: @325a * // rdo rje dam pa sbyin pa ni /
translated: the bestowal of the sublime vajra,

original: zhes pa nas /üîΩ'od zer mtshan nyid bzang po yis //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / 'od zer mtshan nyid bzang po yis //
translated: and so forth,üîΩup to

original: kun du 'khor bar sngags pas bri //
analyzed: kun du 'khor bar sngags pas bri //
translated: the mantra practitioner should draw the good characteristics of light rays all around.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni shar phyogs kyi ngos kyi sgo khyud nang du 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni shar phyogs kyi ngos kyi sgo khyud nang du 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs bri bar bya ste /
translated: This passage teaches that ƒÄrya Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ should be drawn inside the gateway of the eastern side.

original: de yang sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid blos brtags shing dpyad nas rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid blos brtags shing dpyad nas rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, by the nature of the wisdom that follows the sound, all dharmas are realized by the mind after investigating and analyzing the general and specific characteristics.

original: de bas na de ltar rtogs nas sgrib pa thams cad spod bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyi nas lho phyogs su bri'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar rtogs nas sgrib pa thams cad spod bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyi nas lho phyogs su bri'o //
translated: Therefore, having realized in that way, the bodhisattva who removes all obscurations should be drawn later in the south.

original: de ltar sgrib pa spangs nas bzod pa dang dga' bar ldan pa'i rang bzhin sa'i snying po byang phyogs su bri'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa spangs nas bzod pa dang dga' bar ldan pa'i rang bzhin sa'i snying po byang phyogs su bri'o //
translated: Having thus abandoned the obscurations, the nature endowed with patience and joy, K·π£itigarbha, should be drawn in the north.

original: de ltar bzod pa dang dga' ba dang ldan pa thob nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bur rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nam mkha'i snying po nub phyogs su bri'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa dang dga' ba dang ldan pa thob nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bur rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nam mkha'i snying po nub phyogs su bri'o //
translated: Having thus attained patience and joy, the nature that realizes all dharmas as empty like space, ƒÄkƒÅ≈õagarbha, should be drawn in the west.

original: rnam par thar pa'i rim pa de lta bas na dang po nyid du shar phyogs su shes rab kyi rang bzhin 'phags ba 'jam dpal bri'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rim pa de lta bas na dang po nyid du shar phyogs su shes rab kyi rang bzhin 'phags ba 'jam dpal bri'o //
translated: Since the stages of liberation are like that, first of all, the nature of wisdom, ƒÄrya Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, should be drawn in the east.

original: rdo rje dam pa sbyin pa ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag na rdo rjes sngags kyi rgyud 'chad par dbang bskur te /
analyzed: rdo rje dam pa sbyin pa ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag na rdo rjes sngags kyi rgyud 'chad par dbang bskur te /
translated: The bestowal of the holy vajra is the empowerment of Vajrapani to explain the tantra of the holy Manjusri.

original: de ltar na rdo rjes dam pa sbyin pas rdo rje dam pa sbyin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rdo rjes dam pa sbyin pas rdo rje dam pa sbyin zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, because he bestows the holy vajra, he is called the bestower of the holy vajra.

original: zur phud lnga dang ldan zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zur phud lnga dang ldan zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Endowed with five locks of hair means that he has the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: byis pa gzhon nu'i gzugs can ni gzhon nu'i sa la gnas pa ste chos kyi rgyal bo'i sras kyi gzugs su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa gzhon nu'i gzugs can ni gzhon nu'i sa la gnas pa ste chos kyi rgyal bo'i sras kyi gzugs su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Having the form of a youthful boy means that he abides on the stage of youth, the form of the son of the king of Dharma.

original: autpala sngon po rdo rje can //
analyzed: autpala sngon po rdo rje can //
translated: The vajra-holder with a blue lotus

original: lag pa g-yon na thogs pa ste //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon na thogs pa ste //
translated: is held in his left hand.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i mtshan ma'i rdo rje autpala'i steng du bzhag pa lag pa g-yon na thogs pa ste rdo rje ni mchog sbyin pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i mtshan ma'i rdo rje autpala'i steng du bzhag pa lag pa g-yon na thogs pa ste rdo rje ni mchog sbyin pa'o ;
translated: The vajra, which is the symbol of the five wisdoms, is placed on top of the lotus and held in his left hand. The vajra is the symbol of generosity.

original: / autpala ni shes rab kyi ral gri'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: / autpala ni shes rab kyi ral gri'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The lotus is the symbol of the sword of wisdom.

original: rab tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin du gnas //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin du gnas //
translated: He abides with a smiling face.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab kyis chos ston pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab kyis chos ston pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: This is the symbol of teaching the Dharma with wisdom.

original: 'od zer mtshan nyid bzang po yis //
analyzed: 'od zer mtshan nyid bzang po yis //
translated: With excellent characteristics of light.

original: zhes pa ni ser po dang dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'od 'phro ba ste nag bo la sogs pa'i 'od med pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni ser po dang dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'od 'phro ba ste nag bo la sogs pa'i 'od med pa'o ;
translated: This means that he emits light endowed with yellow, white, and so forth, but not black and so forth.

original: / de yi byang du gzhon nu ni //
analyzed: / de yi byang du gzhon nu ni //
translated: To his north, the youth

original: dra ba'i 'od can lag pa na //
analyzed: dra ba'i 'od can lag pa na //
translated: with a net of light in his hand,

original: rin chen dra ba thogs pa ste //
analyzed: rin chen dra ba thogs pa ste //
translated: holding a jewel net,

original: sna tshogs pa yi rgyan gyis brgyan //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa yi rgyan gyis brgyan //
translated: adorned with various ornaments,

original: padma dkar po'i stan la 'dug //
analyzed: padma dkar po'i stan la 'dug //
translated: seated on a white lotus seat,

original: rgyal ba'i sras la blta bar bri //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras la blta bar bri //
translated: should be painted looking at the Bodhisattva.

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi 'khor ba'i 'od ces bya ba de g-yas rol byang phyogs @325b su bri ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi 'khor ba'i 'od ces bya ba de g-yas rol byang phyogs @325b su bri ste /
