translated: He looked at Bhagavat Vairocana for a long time with unblinking eyes means that with the force of faith he looked at Bhagavat for a long time with a satisfied heart.

original: ched du gleng pa 'di ched du gleng zhing tshig tu smras pa zhes pa ni gzhan gyis ma bris par bdag nyid kyis sems dang ba'i shugs kyis tshig tu bton te smras pa'o //
analyzed: ched du gleng pa 'di ched du gleng zhing tshig tu smras pa zhes pa ni gzhan gyis ma bris par bdag nyid kyis sems dang ba'i shugs kyis tshig tu bton te smras pa'o //
translated: This is the proclamation, the proclamation and speech, means that without being written by others, he himself spoke with the force of a satisfied mind.

original: 'jig rten du ni kun mkhyen rnams //
analyzed: 'jig rten du ni kun mkhyen rnams //
translated: Omniscient ones in the world

original: au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin //
translated: are like the udumbara flower.üîΩSometimes they appear,

original: brgya lam na ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung 'gyur yang na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brgya lam na ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung 'gyur yang na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and sometimes they do not.

original: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba //
translated: The way of practicing mantra

original: de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste //
analyzed: de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste //
translated: is even more rare than that.

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi spyod pa shin tu dkon par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi spyod pa shin tu dkon par bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that the practice of mantra is extremely rare.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba yang au dum w'a ra'i me tog dang 'dra bar dkon la //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba yang au dum w'a ra'i me tog dang 'dra bar dkon la //
translated: The appearance of a Tathagata in the world is as rare as the udumbara flower.

original: brgya la de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung na yang sngags kyi tshul gsungs pa ni sngags spyod pa'i snod du gyur pa'i gdul ba gzigs nas gzod sngags kyi tshul ston pas na brgya lam brgya lam na sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung bas na dkon no zhes
analyzed: brgya la de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung na yang sngags kyi tshul gsungs pa ni sngags spyod pa'i snod du gyur pa'i gdul ba gzigs nas gzod sngags kyi tshul ston pas na brgya lam brgya lam na sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung bas na dkon no zhes
translated: Even if a Tathagata appears in the world, when he sees disciples who are vessels for the practice of mantra, he then teaches the way of mantra. Since the way of practicing mantra appears only after a long time, it is said to be rare.

original: pa ste / tshig de skad du smras pa yang phyag na rdo rje nyid de ltar thugs su chud nas sems dang ba'i shugs kyis smras pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams la sngags kyi tshul de ltar dkon zhing mthu che bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste / tshig de skad du smras pa yang phyag na rdo rje nyid de ltar thugs su chud nas sems dang ba'i shugs kyis smras pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams la sngags kyi tshul de ltar dkon zhing mthu che bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who spoke those words is VajrapƒÅ·πái himself, who spoke thus with the force of a joyful mind, and in order to show that in the future the way of mantra will be rare and very powerful for beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten du skye zhing 'byung ba'i dus nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par sangs rgyas te 'jig rten du byung nas kyang bskal pa dang lo grangs la sogs pa ji tsam
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten du skye zhing 'byung ba'i dus nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par sangs rgyas te 'jig rten du byung nas kyang bskal pa dang lo grangs la sogs pa ji tsam
translated: The definite time for the birth and appearance of an omniscient one in the world is when the BhagavƒÅn ≈öƒÅkyamuni and others attain full enlightenment at the foot of the Bodhi tree, appear in the world, and then explain how many eons, years, and so on have passed,

original: lon pa dang 'phags pa byams pa 'jig rten du gdod 'byung pa yang dus 'di tsam na 'byung nge zhes nges par bshad na /
analyzed: lon pa dang 'phags pa byams pa 'jig rten du gdod 'byung pa yang dus 'di tsam na 'byung nge zhes nges par bshad na /
translated: and also when it is definitely explained that the noble Maitreya will appear in the world at such and such a time.

original: ci'i phyir brgya lam brgya lam na zhes pa nges par brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brgya lam brgya lam na zhes pa nges par brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said, after a hundred eons, after a hundred eons, with such certainty?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba'i dus des kyang @327b de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i tshe sems can rnams skal ba dang mi ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par 'byung ba ni brgya lam brgya lam na ste dus nges pa med
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba'i dus des kyang @327b de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i tshe sems can rnams skal ba dang mi ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par 'byung ba ni brgya lam brgya lam na ste dus nges pa med
translated: The time when a Tathagata appears in the world is also the time when sentient beings are fortunate. When a Tathagata appears in the world, sentient beings are fortunate. But a Tathagata's appearance is not a matter of certainty.

original: do // de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba 'ba' zhig la 'jig rten du 'byung zhes mi bya'i /üîΩsems can rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur cing mthong ba la yang bya bas na brgyas lam na zhes smos so //
analyzed: do // de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba 'ba' zhig la 'jig rten du 'byung zhes mi bya'i / sems can rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur cing mthong ba la yang bya bas na brgyas lam na zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is not only when a Tathagata appears in the world that a Tathagata appears in the world.

original: bskal ba bye ba du ma ru //
analyzed: bskal ba bye ba du ma ru //
translated: It is also when sentient beings become the field of experience and see [the Tathagata]. Therefore, it is said that [a Tathagata appears] once in a hundred [eons].

original: sdig pa bgyis par gyur pa gang //üîΩde kun dkyil 'khor 'di 'dra ba //
analyzed: sdig pa bgyis par gyur pa gang // de kun dkyil 'khor 'di 'dra ba //
translated: Even if one has committed evilüîΩfor many millions of eons,üîΩall of that will be eliminated

original: mthong bas 'byung bar 'gyur lags na //
analyzed: mthong bas 'byung bar 'gyur lags na //
translated: by seeing this mandala.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor mthong ba shin tu mthu che bar bstan pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi zad pa'i rgyan la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dkyil 'khor 'di mthong bas bskal ba du mar mi dge ba bcu la spyad pa'i sdig ba bsags paüîΩde thams cad 'byang bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor mthong ba shin tu mthu che bar bstan pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mi zad pa'i rgyan la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dkyil 'khor 'di mthong bas bskal ba du mar mi dge ba bcu la spyad pa'i sdig ba bsags pa de thams cad 'byang bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: By the blessing of the inexhaustible ornament of the body of the Tathagata and so forth, all the sins accumulated by engaging in the ten non-virtues for many eonsüîΩare purified by seeing this mandala.

original: de 'byang bar 'gyur pa yang dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam 'ba' zhig gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'byang bar 'gyur pa yang dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam 'ba' zhig gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, they are purified not just by the mere seeing of the mandala.

original: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes gsum dang ldan na 'byang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes gsum dang ldan na 'byang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They are purified if one has the three: the preparation, the actual [rite], and the conclusion.

original: de la sbyor ba ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i phyir sdig pa bshags pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sdom pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i phyir sdig pa bshags pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dus gsum du sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sdom pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The preparation is the confession of sins, going for refuge to the Three [Jewels], and taking the vow of unobstructed wisdom of the three times, in order to enter the mandala.

original: dngos gzhi ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa nyid kyi tshe na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gzugs dang phyag rgya la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan dang lda ldi la sogs pa mthong nas sems dang ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa nyid kyi tshe na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gzugs dang phyag rgya la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan dang lda ldi la sogs pa mthong nas sems dang ba skyes pa'o //
translated: The main part is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment at the very time of entering the mandala, and the faith in the mind which arises when one has entered the mandala and has seen the images of the body of the Buddha and Bodhisattvas, etc., and the emblems, etc., and the ornaments and decorations of the mandala.

original: rjes ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos dang byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig mnos pa'o //
analyzed: rjes ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos dang byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig mnos pa'o //
translated: The conclusion is the taking of the vows of the commitments, such as not to abandon the holy Dharma and the Thought of Enlightenment, etc., after one has entered the mandala.

original: rnam pa de dag dang ldan par dkyil 'khor mthong na bskal pa du mar bsags pa'i sdig yang 'byang bar 'gyur ba ni dper na lo du mar 'dug pa'i mun nag sgron ma lan cig byung bas med pa dang 'dra'o //üîΩgrags ba mtha' yas sngags spyod pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag dang ldan par dkyil 'khor mthong na bskal pa du mar bsags pa'i sdig yang 'byang bar 'gyur ba ni dper na lo du mar 'dug pa'i mun nag sgron ma lan cig byung bas med pa dang 'dra'o // grags ba mtha' yas sngags spyod pa'i //
translated: If one sees the mandala endowed with those aspects, even the sins accumulated during many eons will be purified, just as the darkness which has been present for many years is removed by the light of a lamp.üîΩWhat need is there to mention one who abides in the way of

original: tshul la gnas na smos ci 'tshal //
analyzed: tshul la gnas na smos ci 'tshal //
translated: mantra conduct, O Boundless Fame!

original: skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni //
analyzed: skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni //
translated: If one recites the secret mantra of the protector,

original: go 'phang bla na med par 'gyur //
analyzed: go 'phang bla na med par 'gyur //
translated: one will attain the unsurpassed stage.

original: @328a * // zhes pa ni sngags zlos pa mthu che bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @328a * // zhes pa ni sngags zlos pa mthu che bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the great power of mantra recitation.

original: dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam gyis kyang bskal pa du mar bsags pa'i sdig pa 'byang bar 'gyur na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sngags yon tan mtha' yas par grags pa ji skad du gsungs pa'i chog dang / ldan par bzlas shing goms par byas na bla na med pa'i gnas thob pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //üîΩgang dag spyad pa mchog 'di la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam gyis kyang bskal pa du mar bsags pa'i sdig pa 'byang bar 'gyur na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sngags yon tan mtha' yas par grags pa ji skad du gsungs pa'i chog dang / ldan par bzlas shing goms par byas na bla na med pa'i gnas thob pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o // gang dag spyad pa mchog 'di la //
translated: If the mere sight of the mandala purifies misdeeds accumulated over many eons, what need is there to mention that if one recites and practices the mantras of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, renowned for their infinite qualities, in accordance with the prescribed methods, one will attain the unsurpassed stage.üîΩThose whose minds are utterly unwavering

original: blo gros shin tu mi g-yo ba //üîΩde dag gis ni ngan 'gro'i rgyun //
analyzed: blo gros shin tu mi g-yo ba // de dag gis ni ngan 'gro'i rgyun //
translated: in this supreme practiceüîΩcompletely sever the stream of lower rebirths

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung rab tu bcad //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung rab tu bcad //
translated: and all the sources of suffering.

original: ces pa ni sngags spyod pa'i tshul nyan zhing sems dpa'i sgo nas dad pa mthu che bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni sngags spyod pa'i tshul nyan zhing sems dpa'i sgo nas dad pa mthu che bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the great power of faith through listening and contemplation in the way of mantra practice.

original: sngags spyod pa'i tshul mchog 'di la nyan pa dang bsams pa 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no snyam nas blo gzhan du mi g-yo bar mos na sdug bsngal can gyi ngan song du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngags spyod pa'i tshul mchog 'di la nyan pa dang bsams pa 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no snyam nas blo gzhan du mi g-yo bar mos na sdug bsngal can gyi ngan song du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: If one thinks, This is the supreme way of mantra practice, not anything else, and one's mind does not waver elsewhere, one will not be born in the lower realms that are full of suffering.

original: sngags spyad pa dang sngags spyod pa'i tshul zhes pa dang mchog ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni sngar lan mi nyung bar bshad zin pas na 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: sngags spyad pa dang sngags spyod pa'i tshul zhes pa dang mchog ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni sngar lan mi nyung bar bshad zin pas na 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The words mantra practice, way of mantra practice, supreme, and so on have been explained many times before, so they are not explained here.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyang phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis don 'di lta bur thugs su chud pas sems dang ba'i shugs kyis smras la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyang phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis don 'di lta bur thugs su chud pas sems dang ba'i shugs kyis smras la /
translated: Since Vajrapani himself understood this meaning in this way, he spoke with the force of a joyful mind.

original: zhar la ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir smras so //
analyzed: zhar la ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir smras so //
translated: And he spoke in order to inspire sentient beings of the future.

original: de'i tshe thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag dang rdo rje 'dzin de dag gis mgrin gcig tu mthun par tshig smras pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag dang rdo rje 'dzin de dag gis mgrin gcig tu mthun par tshig smras pa zhes pa nas /
translated: At that time, the entire assembly and those Vajra holders spoke with one voice in unison, from Thus have I heard...

original: sngags spyad 'bras bu la gnas pa //
analyzed: sngags spyad 'bras bu la gnas pa //
translated: And those who abide in the result of the mantra conduct.üîΩ

original: bdag cag thams cad dpang du 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag cag thams cad dpang du 'gyur //
translated: All of us will be the witnessesüîΩFor those abiding in the result of mantra practice.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad gsol pa dang byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i 'khor de rnams dang rdo rje 'dzin pa de rnams kyis phyag ni rdo rje'i dgongs pa 'di ltar
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad gsol pa dang byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i 'khor de rnams dang rdo rje 'dzin pa de rnams kyis phyag ni rdo rje'i dgongs pa 'di ltar
translated: With these verses, VajrapƒÅ·πái made a request to the BhagavƒÅn. The retinue, such as the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, and the vajra holders understood the intention of VajrapƒÅ·πái in this way:

original: rig ste / dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa la dkyil 'khor gyi thig bre pa dang lha rnams so sor dgod pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin na tshon byin gyis rlob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang tshon so so la sangs rgyas kyi sku bsam zhing byin gyis rlob
analyzed: rig ste / dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa la dkyil 'khor gyi thig bre pa dang lha rnams so sor dgod pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin na tshon byin gyis rlob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang tshon so so la sangs rgyas kyi sku bsam zhing byin gyis rlob
translated: ‚ÄúThe section on explaining the ma·πá·∏çala has been completed. The lines of the ma·πá·∏çala, the placement of the individual deities, and so on have been explained. The samƒÅdhi of consecrating the colors and the consecration of the individual colors by imagining the form of the buddhas

original: ba dang / tshon gang yin pa dang / tshon 'gyes pa'i thabs dang / tshon gang sngon du gtang ba dang / rta babs dang sgo khyud kyi tshad la sogs @328b pa ma bshad pas de dag bri ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rjes tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smra'o snyam du rig nas tshig 'di skad smras pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / tshon gang yin pa dang / tshon 'gyes pa'i thabs dang / tshon gang sngon du gtang ba dang / rta babs dang sgo khyud kyi tshad la sogs @328b pa ma bshad pas de dag bri ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rjes tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smra'o snyam du rig nas tshig 'di skad smras pa'o //
translated: Since the colors, the method of mixing the colors, which color should be used first, the measurements of the pediments and door-frames, and so forth have not been explained, in order to draw those, VajrapƒÅ·πái thought, I will speak these verses. Knowing that, he spoke these words.

original: de'i tshe thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag dang rdo rje 'dzin de dag gis mgrin gcig tu mthun par tshig smas pa zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyi na pa la spyod pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po dang 'jam dpal
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag dang rdo rje 'dzin de dag gis mgrin gcig tu mthun par tshig smas pa zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyi na pa la spyod pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po dang 'jam dpal
translated: At that time, the entire assembly and those Vajra-holders spoke with one voice in unison, saying, This refers to the Bodhisattvas who have arisen from the practice of the perfections, such as Samantabhadra, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,

original: la sogs pa dang sngags kyi spyod pa las byung pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag dgongs pa mthun pas tshig dang don mthun par smras pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa dang sngags kyi spyod pa las byung pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag dgongs pa mthun pas tshig dang don mthun par smras pa'o //
translated: and so forth, and the Bodhisattvas who have arisen from the practice of mantra, the Vajra-holders. With a concordant intention, they spoke words and meanings in agreement.

original: legs so legs zhes pa ni phyag na rdo rje don de lta bur sems shing bcom ldan 'das la 'dri bas phyag na rdo rje de nyid legs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: legs so legs zhes pa ni phyag na rdo rje don de lta bur sems shing bcom ldan 'das la 'dri bas phyag na rdo rje de nyid legs so zhes pa'o //
translated: Well said, well said means that since Vajrapani was thinking of that matter and was asking the Lord, Vajrapani himself is well said.

original: legs zhes pa gnyis pa ni dri bar bya ba'i don bzang bas legs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: legs zhes pa gnyis pa ni dri bar bya ba'i don bzang bas legs zhes pa'o //
translated: The second well said means well said because the matter to be asked about is good.

original: gsang sngags spyod pa'i dbang gyur pa //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod pa'i dbang gyur pa //
translated: One who is a master of the practice of mantra

original: dpa' bo chen po dang sngags kyi spyod pa las byung pa'i byang chub sems dpa' pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po dang sngags kyi spyod pa las byung pa'i byang chub sems dpa' pa'o //
translated: is a great hero and a Bodhisattva who has arisen from the practice of mantra.

original: khyod kyis yid la gang bsams pa ;
analyzed: khyod kyis yid la gang bsams pa ;
translated: What you have in mind,

original: / mnyam med thams cad mkhyen la zhus //
analyzed: / mnyam med thams cad mkhyen la zhus //
translated: ask the peerless Omniscient One.

original: zhes pa ni bri bar bya ba'i dngos po ste legs so legs zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bri bar bya ba'i dngos po ste legs so legs zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the matter to be written, and it is connected with the two well said [statements].

original: tshig tu ma smras na phyag na rdo rje'i yid la bsams ba de byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis ji ltar rig ce na //
analyzed: tshig tu ma smras na phyag na rdo rje'i yid la bsams ba de byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis ji ltar rig ce na //
translated: If it is not spoken in words, how do those Bodhisattvas know what Vajrapani is thinking?

original: kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mthu chen po sha stag pas pha rol gyi sems rig pa dang 'dra bar phyag na rdo rjes ci bsams pa rnams shes so //
analyzed: kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mthu chen po sha stag pas pha rol gyi sems rig pa dang 'dra bar phyag na rdo rjes ci bsams pa rnams shes so //
translated: The bodhisattvas, Samantabhadra and so forth, are all of great power, and so they know what Vajrapani is thinking, as if it were something obvious to them.

original: gnyis su na de lta bur dri ba'i skabs yin pas phyag na rdo rjes tshigs su bcad pa la gzhan glengs kyang bri bra bya ba'i dngos po 'di dag yin par shes so //
analyzed: gnyis su na de lta bur dri ba'i skabs yin pas phyag na rdo rjes tshigs su bcad pa la gzhan glengs kyang bri bra bya ba'i dngos po 'di dag yin par shes so //
translated: On the other hand, since it is a matter of asking such questions, even though Vajrapani is singing the praises of others in his verses, he knows that these are the things that should be asked about.

original: de ltar phyag na rdo rje'i dgongs pa shes pas na bdag cag thams cad de dpang du gyur pa zhes pa ste /

analyzed: yid gcig bsdus la mnyan par gyis // zhes pa nas /
translated: is explained in the lines from ‚ÄúGreat being, listen with a one-pointed mind‚Äù

original: de bas rnam par thams cad du //
analyzed: de bas rnam par thams cad du //
translated: up to ‚ÄúTherefore, in all ways,

original: stong nyid rtag tu dran par bya'o //
analyzed: stong nyid rtag tu dran par bya'o //
translated: emptiness should always be remembered.‚Äù

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bshad pa yin te de sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin dang kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bshad pa yin te de sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin dang kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The samƒÅdhi of the buddhas and the samƒÅdhi of complete buddhahood are the samƒÅdhi of the ultimate.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The samƒÅdhi of the buddhas

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi ting 'dzin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi ting 'dzin no //
translated: is the samƒÅdhi of all buddhas.

original: stong pa nyid ces rgyas bas gsungs //üîΩzhes pa ste de la stong pa nyid ces pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos gdod ma nas ma skyes ma byung ba'i tshul gyis bshig gam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces rgyas bas gsungs // zhes pa ste de la stong pa nyid ces pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos gdod ma nas ma skyes ma byung ba'i tshul gyis bshig gam /
translated: It is called emptiness.

original: rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bshig na yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bshig na yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù means that when phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are destroyed either by being dissolved into their most subtle parts or by being destroyed from the beginning in the manner of being unborn and unarisen, they do not exist.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par snang ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par snang ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of their aspects also does not exist.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med par rtogs pa ni stong @330b ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med par rtogs pa ni stong @330b ba nyid do //
translated: The realization that there is no such characteristic of apprehended object and apprehending subject is emptiness.

original: de ltar chos rnams rang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnag bzhin du rtogs te stong pa'i rang bzhin de las sems gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing de nyid la rtse gcig par gyur pa ni sa bcu rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ting nge
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams rang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnag bzhin du rtogs te stong pa'i rang bzhin de las sems gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing de nyid la rtse gcig par gyur pa ni sa bcu rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ting nge
translated: Thus, phenomena are realized to be empty of their own characteristics. The mind does not move from that nature of emptiness, and it becomes one-pointed on that itself. This is the meditative stabilization called ‚Äúheroic valor.‚Äù

original: 'dzin de thob ste da'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin de thob ste da'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas on the tenth level who have completed the bodhisattva path attain this meditative stabilization, and at that time they are called buddhas.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha yongs su spangs pa'i stong pa nyid ni sa rab tu dga' ba'i tshe na yang ma thob pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha yongs su spangs pa'i stong pa nyid ni sa rab tu dga' ba'i tshe na yang ma thob pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Thus, emptiness, which is the complete abandonment of the aspects of the apprehended and the apprehender, is not something that is not attained even at the time of the Joyful Ground.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba nas sa brgyad pa'i bar du log pa'i gnyen po yongs sum spangs pas lhun gyis grub pa nyid du mi 'jug pa'i phyir de dag la mi bya la /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba nas sa brgyad pa'i bar du log pa'i gnyen po yongs sum spangs pas lhun gyis grub pa nyid du mi 'jug pa'i phyir de dag la mi bya la /
translated: However, it is not applied to the grounds from the Joyful Ground up to the eighth ground because the antidotes to error have not been completely abandoned and so it does not engage spontaneously.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad log pa'i gnyen po rnams spangs te lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas na sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa rnams dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad log pa'i gnyen po rnams spangs te lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas na sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa rnams dang 'brel lo //
translated: But it is applied to the eighth ground, the ninth ground, and the tenth ground because on the eighth ground and above, the antidotes to error have been abandoned and it engages spontaneously.

original: sa bcu yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe ting nga 'dzin 'di rab tu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa bcu yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe ting nga 'dzin 'di rab tu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the ten grounds are completely perfected, this meditative absorption is attained.

original: ting nge 'dzin de rab tu thob pa yang gzhan gyis thob pa ma yin gyi rang gi sems yongs su shes pa las thob pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de rab tu thob pa yang gzhan gyis thob pa ma yin gyi rang gi sems yongs su shes pa las thob pa yin no //
translated: And the attainment of that meditative absorption is not attained by others but is attained from the thorough knowledge of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,üîΩit is said:

original: de'i sems yongs su shes pa las //
analyzed: de'i sems yongs su shes pa las //
translated: From the thorough knowledge of one‚Äôs own mind,

original: thob par 'gyur gyi gzhan las min //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur gyi gzhan las min // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is attained from oneself, not from another.

original: de la sems yongs su shes pa yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po sems ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur te sngon por ma yin /
analyzed: de la sems yongs su shes pa yang gsang ba pa'i bdag po sems ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur te sngon por ma yin /
translated: As for the thorough knowledge of mind, the Lord of Secrets, the mind is not seen by the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones. It is not seen as blue,

original: ser por ma yin zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du yongs su btsal kyang mi dmigs pa yin te zhes pa'i bar sngar byang chub kyi sems bshad pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: ser por ma yin zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du yongs su btsal kyang mi dmigs pa yin te zhes pa'i bar sngar byang chub kyi sems bshad pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: not seen as yellow, and so on up to not seen in any way. It is not apprehended when thoroughly sought. This was already explained in the section on the explanation of the thought of awakening.

original: de gnyis yongs su spangs pa ni //
analyzed: de gnyis yongs su spangs pa ni //
translated: The thorough abandonment of those two

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi yin par 'dod //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi yin par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be that of the perfect Buddha.

original: stong pa chen po zhes bya ste //
analyzed: stong pa chen po zhes bya ste //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúgreat emptiness,‚Äù

original: kun mkhyen ye shes rdzogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes rdzogs byed pa'o //
translated: and it perfects the wisdom of omniscience.

original: zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: This is the samadhi of universal awakening.

original: de gnyis yongs su spangs pa zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'jig pa sngags pa dang stong pa'i rang bzhin du 'du zhes pa gnyis po spangs pa ste sa bcu gcig pa kun du bzang po'i sa la gnas pa'i tshe chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin no
analyzed: de gnyis yongs su spangs pa zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'jig pa sngags pa dang stong pa'i rang bzhin du 'du zhes pa gnyis po spangs pa ste sa bcu gcig pa kun du bzang po'i sa la gnas pa'i tshe chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin no
translated: When one is abiding on the eleventh ground, the ground of Universal Radiance, one thinks, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are empty by nature.‚Äù

original: snyam nas stong par 'du shes pa de yang spangs te stong pa'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes cam la gnas so //üîΩde bas na stong par 'du shes pa yang spangs @331a * //
analyzed: snyam nas stong par 'du shes pa de yang spangs te stong pa'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes cam la gnas so // de bas na stong par 'du shes pa yang spangs @331a * //
translated: Even that perception of emptiness is abandoned, and one abides in the mere perception that thinks, ‚ÄúThey do not exist even as the nature of emptiness.‚Äù

original: pas stong pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pas stong pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the perception of emptiness is also abandoned, it is called ‚Äúgreat emptiness.‚Äù

original: kun mkhyen ye shes rdzogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes rdzogs byed pa'o //

original: zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i de ma thag tu 'du shes tsam yang spangs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i de ma thag tu 'du shes tsam yang spangs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately after the complete enlightenment, the mere perception is also abandoned. One attains the omniscient wisdom that has the characteristic of being free from all perceptions.

analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sbyor par byed pas na //

original: kun mkhyen ye shes rdzogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes rdzogs byed pa'o //
translated: it perfects the gnosis of omniscience.

original: zhes so // de bas rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: Therefore, in every way,

original: stong nyid rtag tu dran par bya'o //
analyzed: stong nyid rtag tu dran par bya'o //
translated: one should always be mindful of emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin des thams cad mkhyen pa rdzogs par byed pas na yan lag bzhi'i bzlas brjod dang bdag gi lhar sbyor ba dang / dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa thams cad la 'di lta bu'i stong pa nyid rtag tu goms par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin des thams cad mkhyen pa rdzogs par byed pas na yan lag bzhi'i bzlas brjod dang bdag gi lhar sbyor ba dang / dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa thams cad la 'di lta bu'i stong pa nyid rtag tu goms par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Since that concentration on emptiness perfects omniscience, one should always be familiar with that kind of emptiness in all the practices of the four-branched recitation, the union with one's deity, the concentrations on the ma·πá·∏çala of great earth and the ma·πá·∏çala of water, and so forth.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sang rgyas rnams kyi so so'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sang rgyas rnams kyi so so'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the individual concentrations of the bodhisattvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas, it is said:

translated: The BhagavƒÅn entered into samƒÅdhi, and having arisen from that samƒÅdhi, he explained the occasion of the bodhisattvas‚Äô samƒÅdhi and so on.

original: de nas bcom lnga 'das rnam par snang mdzad sangs rgya thams cad thabs cig yang dag par mol nas shes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom lnga 'das rnam par snang mdzad sangs rgya thams cad thabs cig yang dag par mol nas shes pa nas /
translated: Then the BhagavƒÅn Vairocana, having conversed with all the buddhas, knew that‚Ä¶

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse'i phyir //
translated: ‚Ä¶in order to have compassion for sentient beings,

original: ngas ni thams cad rab tu bshad //
analyzed: ngas ni thams cad rab tu bshad //
translated: I will explain everything.‚ÄùüîΩUp to this point, the bodhisattvas‚Äô samƒÅdhi is explained to have the characteristic of the sameness of all buddhas.

original: ces pa'i bar gyis byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin kun du sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dpa' bo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bdud bzhi bcom pa'i rang bzhin 'chad de /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyis byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin kun du sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dpa' bo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bdud bzhi bcom pa'i rang bzhin 'chad de /
translated: Abiding in the samƒÅdhi of the great hero, the nature of conquering the four mƒÅras is explained.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang thabs cig yang dag par mol nas shes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dgongs pa mthun pas bya ba gcig tu bstan pa ste bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang sems can gyi don byed par mnyam pa nyidüîΩkyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang thabs cig yang dag par mol nas shes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dgongs pa mthun pas bya ba gcig tu bstan pa ste bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang sems can gyi don byed par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the same in terms of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, the dharmakƒÅya, and the benefit they bring to sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud gcig pa'i stobs kyi shugs zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud gcig pa'i stobs kyi shugs zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni /
translated: He entered the meditative absorption called the force of the power of the continuum of all buddhas being one.

original: ting nge 'dzin de'i ming ste sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud gcig pa zhes pa ni sems can gyi don du spyod pa sna tshogs 'byung yang sangs rgyas thams cad rgyud gcig pa las @331b 'byung zhing chos kyi skur ro gcig pa las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'i ming ste sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud gcig pa zhes pa ni sems can gyi don du spyod pa sna tshogs 'byung yang sangs rgyas thams cad rgyud gcig pa las @331b 'byung zhing chos kyi skur ro gcig pa las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This is the name of that meditative absorption. The phrase ‚Äúthe continuum of all buddhas being one‚Äù means that although various kinds of conduct arise for the benefit of sentient beings, they all arise from the single continuum of all buddhas and arise from the single taste of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: dpe na mar me mang po 'od 'dres par gyur na gcig ste dbyer med pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dpe na mar me mang po 'od 'dres par gyur na gcig ste dbyer med pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the light of many lamps merging into one, becoming a single light that cannot be separated.

original: stobs zhes pa ni thogs pa med pa'i mthu'o /
analyzed: stobs zhes pa ni thogs pa med pa'i mthu'o /
translated: Power is the unobstructed might.

original: shugs zhes pa ni mthu ste sems can gyi don la myur ba'o //
analyzed: shugs zhes pa ni mthu ste sems can gyi don la myur ba'o //
translated: Force is the swiftness of the power to benefit sentient beings.

original: byang chub snying por 'dug nas su //
analyzed: byang chub snying por 'dug nas su //
translated: Seated at the site of enlightenment,

original: bdud ni rnam pa bzhi bcom pas /
analyzed: bdud ni rnam pa bzhi bcom pas /
translated: he conquered the four demons.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse'i phyir //
translated: Out of compassion for sentient beings,

original: ngas ni thams cad rab tu bshad //
analyzed: ngas ni thams cad rab tu bshad //
translated: I will explain everything.

original: ces pa'i bar gyis kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gong du bshad de /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyis kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gong du bshad de /
translated: The above passage explains the universal enlightenment samadhi.

original: nyid dpa' bo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas stong pa yid kyi ting nge 'dzin des bdud bzhi bcom par bstan pa ste de la /üîΩbdud ni rnam pa bzhi bcom pas //
analyzed: nyid dpa' bo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas stong pa yid kyi ting nge 'dzin des bdud bzhi bcom par bstan pa ste de la / bdud ni rnam pa bzhi bcom pas //
translated: Having remained in the samadhi of the great hero, he demonstrated the conquest of the four demons with the emptiness mental samadhi.

original: zhes pa ni phung po'i bdud dang // nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud rnams bcom pa ste de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su ring par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phung po'i bdud dang // nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud rnams bcom pa ste de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su ring par bya'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúhe conquered the four demons‚Äù refers to the conquest of the demon of the aggregates, the demon of afflictions, the demon of the lord of death, and the demon of the son of the gods. This should be extended to the conventional and ultimate.

original: de la kun rdzob tu bdud bzhi bcom pa ni byang chub chen por lha'i bu'i bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud gnyis ka bcom la /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu bdud bzhi bcom pa ni byang chub chen por lha'i bu'i bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud gnyis ka bcom la /
translated: In the relative, the four demons are conquered: the two demons of the son of the gods and of the afflictions are conquered in great enlightenment.

original: phug po'i bdud dang 'chi bdag gi bdud gnyis ni de'i zhar la bcom pa ste theg pa chung du'i lugs las grags pa'o //
analyzed: phug po'i bdud dang 'chi bdag gi bdud gnyis ni de'i zhar la bcom pa ste theg pa chung du'i lugs las grags pa'o //
translated: The two demons of the lord of the dead and of the aggregates are conquered as a matter of course. This is known in the system of the lesser vehicle.

original: skabs 'dir chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes par rtogs nas bdud rnam pa bzhi char yang dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis bcom ste /üîΩskye ba med par gnas rtogs pa //
analyzed: skabs 'dir chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes par rtogs nas bdud rnam pa bzhi char yang dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis bcom ste / skye ba med par gnas rtogs pa //
translated: In this context, having realized that all phenomena are unarisen and unborn, the four kinds of demons are conquered in a manner of not observing them.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThe one who realizes the abode of non-arising‚Äù and so on is applied.

original: de nad dpa' bo chen po zhes //
analyzed: de nad dpa' bo chen po zhes //
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThe one who is called a great hero‚Äù

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: dpa' po zhes su grags //
analyzed: dpa' po zhes su grags //
translated: ‚Äúis known as a hero.‚Äù

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis de ltar bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom nas tshangs pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams bcom ldan 'das la khyod ni dpa' po chen po 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o zhes dga' bzhin du tshig tu 'don pas nang ni dpa' po chen po
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis de ltar bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom nas tshangs pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams bcom ldan 'das la khyod ni dpa' po chen po 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o zhes dga' bzhin du tshig tu 'don pas nang ni dpa' po chen po
translated: Up to this point, having thus conquered the four demons, the worldly gods such as Brahma, etc., say with joy, ‚ÄúYou are a great hero, free from fear,‚Äù to the Bhagavat.

original: yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúI am a great hero.‚Äù

original: skye ba med par gnas rtogs pa //
analyzed: skye ba med par gnas rtogs pa //
translated: Having realized the non-arisen,

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pas bcom pa ma yin gyi chos thams cad ma skyes ma byung ba rngas thugs su chud nas dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis bcom mo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pas bcom pa ma yin gyi chos thams cad ma skyes ma byung ba rngas thugs su chud nas dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis bcom mo zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is connected as follows. It is not that the conquest of the four demons in that way is a conquest with reference to an object, but rather that the Bhagavat has realized that all phenomena are non-arisen and non-occurring, and has conquered the demons in a manner that is without reference to an object.

original: skye ba med par ngas rtogs pa //
analyzed: skye ba med par ngas rtogs pa //
translated: I have realized the non-arisen,

original: zhes pa ni dngos sun chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pas phung po yang @332a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos sun chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pas phung po yang @332a * //
translated: This is the explicit teaching. Since he has realized that all phenomena are primordially non-arisen,

original: dmigs su med pa'i phyir phung po'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i phyir phung po'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: the aggregates are also not observed. Therefore, he has conquered the demon of the aggregates.

original: tshig gi sbyor yul rnam spangs shig //
analyzed: tshig gi sbyor yul rnam spangs shig //
translated: And is free from the domain of words.

original: zhes pa ni rma par rtog ba dang bral zhes pa ste rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das pas dngos su lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rma par rtog ba dang bral zhes pa ste rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das pas dngos su lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: This is the freedom from the conception of a wound. Since it is beyond the domain of thought, it directly conquers the demon of the son of gods.

original: nyes pa thams cad med pa ste //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad med pa ste //
translated: It is free from all faults.

original: zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol pas na dngos su nyon mo sogs pa'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol pas na dngos su nyon mo sogs pa'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: This is the freedom from the afflictions. Therefore, it directly conquers the demon of the afflictions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang bral ba yin //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang bral ba yin //
translated: It is free from causes and conditions.

original: zhes pa ni rgyu dang rkyan med pa snam skyes pa ste ma skyes pa sna 'chi ba med de dngos su 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyu dang rkyan med pa snam skyes pa ste ma skyes pa sna 'chi ba med de dngos su 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: This is the freedom from birth and death. Since it is free from causes and conditions, it is unborn. Since it is unborn, it is deathless. Therefore, it directly conquers the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: stong pa'i ye shes mkha' 'dra ba //
analyzed: stong pa'i ye shes mkha' 'dra ba //
translated: The wisdom of emptiness is like space.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar rnam pa bzhi char las grol bas na rnam pa med pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba stong pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ma skyes pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar rnam pa bzhi char las grol bas na rnam pa med pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba stong pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ma skyes pa shes pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from those four aspects, it is the wisdom free from aspects. Since it is naturally luminous, it is the wisdom of the characteristic of emptiness, which is like space. It is unborn.

original: ji ltar byung ba nga la byung //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar byung ba nga la byung //üîΩzhes pa ni /
translated: Whatever arises arises in me.

original: ji ltar gyur pa nga la byung //
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa nga la byung //
translated: How it came to be, that has happened to me.

original: zhes bton te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes de ltar bur phyin ci ma log pa nyid du ngas thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bton te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes de ltar bur phyin ci ma log pa nyid du ngas thob ces pa'o //
translated: Thus, I have attained the unmistaken, just as it is, pristine wisdom of emptiness.

original: shin tu dri med ces pa ni ye shes de shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su spangs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dri med ces pa ni ye shes de shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su spangs pa shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExtremely pure‚Äù means that pristine wisdom is known to be completely free of the obstructions to omniscience and the afflictive obstructions.

original: de kho na zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su gru pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas rigs pa dang lung gis sun dbyung par mi nus pas na ston pa nyid kyi ye shes la de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su gru pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas rigs pa dang lung gis sun dbyung par mi nus pas na ston pa nyid kyi ye shes la de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúReality‚Äù means that it is the characteristic of the unmistaken, completely perfect, and therefore it cannot be refuted by reasoning or scripture. Thus, it is called ‚Äúreality‚Äù in the pristine wisdom of the Teacher.

original: kun mkhyen tsam gyi tshul du gnas //
analyzed: kun mkhyen tsam gyi tshul du gnas //
translated: It abides in the manner of mere omniscience.

original: kun mkhyen sangs rgyas mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun mkhyen sangs rgyas mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of omniscience is buddhahood.

original: zhes pa ni kun du sang rgyas pa zhes bya ba de stong pa'i rang bzhin du 'du shes pa yang spangs nas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin par shes pa de tsam la gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun du sang rgyas pa zhes bya ba de stong pa'i rang bzhin du 'du shes pa yang spangs nas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin par shes pa de tsam la gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscience‚Äù means that, having abandoned the conception that the so-called omniscience is the nature of emptiness, one knows that it does not exist even as the nature of emptiness. Abiding in that mere knowledge is called ‚Äúabiding in omniscience.‚Äù

original: da yi de nyid dam pa 'di ;
analyzed: da yi de nyid dam pa 'di ;
translated: Now, this sublime reality

original: /'jig rten snang bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: /'jig rten snang bar byed pa ste //
translated: illuminates the world.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyis ni //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs kyis ni //
translated: By the power of consecration,

original: yig 'bru rnams su bstan nas su //
analyzed: yig 'bru rnams su bstan nas su //
translated: having revealed the syllables,

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse'i phyir //
translated: out of compassion for sentient beings,

original: ngas ni thams cad rab tu bshad //
analyzed: ngas ni thams cad rab tu bshad //
translated: I have explained everything.

original: ces pa ni de ltar ngas thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes ma byung bar rtogs kyang sems can rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir yang dag pa nyid chos de tshig tu brjod pa'i phyir yi ge'i 'bru rnams su byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar ngas thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes ma byung bar rtogs kyang sems can rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir yang dag pa nyid chos de tshig tu brjod pa'i phyir yi ge'i 'bru rnams su byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Thus, although I have realized that everything is primordially unborn and non-arisen, out of compassion for sentient beings, in order to express that reality in words, I have consecrated the syllables.

original: yi ge'i 'bru rnams kyang dpa' po chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi skabs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru rnams kyang dpa' po chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi skabs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The syllables should be seen in the context of the samadhi of the great hero.

original: 'di rnams kyi rim pa yang bsdus pa'i don gyi nang du bshad pas shin tu ma @332b bshad do //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rim pa yang bsdus pa'i don gyi nang du bshad pas shin tu ma @332b bshad do //
translated: Their sequence is explained in the summary meaning, so it is not explained here.

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: Then, the glorious Vajra Holder,

original: ngo mtshar gyur nas mig gdangs te //
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyur nas mig gdangs te //
translated: amazed, with eyes wide open,

original: thams cad mkhyen la mgo po yis //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen la mgo po yis //
translated: with his head to the Omniscient One,

original: phyag 'tshal nas ni tshig 'di smras //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas ni tshig 'di smras //
translated: Having bowed down, he spoke these words:

original: zhes pa ni gong du sangs rgyas dang kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid spros pa med pa'i chos sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs su chud nas yig 'bru la sogs pa'i sgo nas spros pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams bstan zhing bshad pa de
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du sangs rgyas dang kun du sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid spros pa med pa'i chos sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs su chud nas yig 'bru la sogs pa'i sgo nas spros pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams bstan zhing bshad pa de
translated: This is saying that the buddhas have realized the emptiness that is the samadhi of complete buddhahood, the dharma free of elaborations, and then they have taught and explained the dharmas with elaborations, such as the letters and so forth.

original: ngo mtshar che bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: That is truly amazing.

original: de bas na /üîΩsangs rgyas kun gyi thabs dang ni //
analyzed: de bas na / sangs rgyas kun gyi thabs dang ni //
translated: Therefore:

original: shes rab bsam yas ngo mtshar che /
analyzed: shes rab bsam yas ngo mtshar che /
translated: The method and wisdom of all the buddhas are inconceivable and amazing.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: This is saying that from the above quote up to:

original: 'jig rten gyi ni mchod gnas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni mchod gnas 'gyur //
translated: They become objects of worship in the world.

original: zhes pa'i ba rdu gsungs pa yin te //
analyzed: zhes pa'i ba rdu gsungs pa yin te //
translated: This is the request.

original: de la sangs rgyas kun gyi ngo mtshar che zhes spyar te sangs rgyas dang kun du sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun kyang spros pa med pa'i chos thugs su chud nas spros pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'chad pa ni ngo mtshar che'o //üîΩthabs dang shes rab bsam yas zhes pa la shes rab ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa dang thabs ni stong pa nyid kyi chos de yi ge'i 'bru la sogs par bstan nas grub pa rab 'bring tha ma la sogs pa dang zhi ba la
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kun gyi ngo mtshar che zhes spyar te sangs rgyas dang kun du sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun kyang spros pa med pa'i chos thugs su chud nas spros pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'chad pa ni ngo mtshar che'o // thabs dang shes rab bsam yas zhes pa la shes rab ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa dang thabs ni stong pa nyid kyi chos de yi ge'i 'bru la sogs par bstan nas grub pa rab 'bring tha ma la sogs pa dang zhi ba la
translated: The phrase the marvel of all the Buddhas is to be supplied in each case. The Buddhas, the fully enlightened ones, the perfectly enlightened ones, are marvelous in that, having realized the Dharma free of conceptual elaboration, they teach the Dharma that is full of conceptual elaboration.üîΩWisdom and skillful means are inconceivable means that wisdom is the realization that all phenomena are emptiness, and skillful means is the teaching of the Dharma of emptiness in the form of syllables and so on, and the guiding of sentient beings to the three kinds of enlightenment, highest, medium, and lower, and to the performance of the activities of pacifying,

original: sogs pa'i las rnams bye dpa'i sgo nas sems can rnams 'dzud par byed pa de ni thabs dang shes rab bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //üîΩspros ba kun dang bal ba yi //
analyzed: sogs pa'i las rnams bye dpa'i sgo nas sems can rnams 'dzud par byed pa de ni thabs dang shes rab bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o // spros ba kun dang bal ba yi //
translated: and so on. That is wisdom and skillful means, which are inconceivable.üîΩHaving realized the DharmaüîΩfree of all conceptual elaboration,

original: chos rtogs nas ni rab byung rnams //
analyzed: chos rtogs nas ni rab byung rnams //
translated: the renunciates

original: zhes pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyis spros pa med pa'i chos thugs su chud nas sangs rgyas pas te rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyis spros pa med pa'i chos thugs su chud nas sangs rgyas pas te rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the realization of the Buddhas, since they have realized the Dharma free from conceptual elaboration and have become Buddhas.üîΩThus,

original: de ltar / spros pa med pa'i don rtogs nas //üîΩ'jig rten gyi ni re ba kun //
analyzed: de ltar / spros pa med pa'i don rtogs nas // 'jig rten gyi ni re ba kun //
translated: having realized the meaning free from conceptual elaboration,üîΩthey teach the fulfillment of all

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ston //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ston //
translated: the hopes of the world.

original: pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes spyar ro //
analyzed: pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes spyar ro //
translated: This is their great wonder.

original: rang byung rnams zhes pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi byad chub sems dpa' rnams te gzhan gyis mi dkri ba'i phyir rang bung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang byung rnams zhes pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi byad chub sems dpa' rnams te gzhan gyis mi dkri ba'i phyir rang bung zhes bya'o //
translated: The self-originated ones are the Bodhisattvas from the eighth level onward, because they are not led by others, they are called self-originated.

original: sngags kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu //
analyzed: sngags kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu //
translated: Such is the definition of mantra.

original: zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i chos rtogs nas spros pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'chad pa de lta bu ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i chos rtogs nas spros pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'chad pa de lta bu ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Having realized the Dharma free from conceptual elaboration, they teach the Dharma with conceptual elaboration. Such is the definition of mantra.

original: sngags kyi mtshan nyid 'di yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyi ga la legs par gnas pas te /
analyzed: sngags kyi mtshan nyid 'di yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyi ga la legs par gnas pas te /
translated: Moreover, this definition of mantra is well-founded in both the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang kun rdzob kyi bden @333a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang kun rdzob kyi bden @333a * //
translated: Ultimate truth is the nature of emptiness.üîΩ

original: pa ni grub pa mchog la sogs pa dang zhi ba la sog pa'i las rnams byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni grub pa mchog la sogs pa dang zhi ba la sog pa'i las rnams byed pa'o //
translated: Ultimate truth is the nature of emptiness, and conventional truth is the performance of actions such as the supreme attainment and peace.

original: sems can kun gyis shes nas ni //
analyzed: sems can kun gyis shes nas ni //
translated: Having understood this, all sentient beings

original: 'jig rten gyi ni mchod gnas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni mchod gnas 'gyur //
translated: will become objects of worship in the world.

original: zhes pa ni grub pa la sogs par ma gyur kyang sngags kyi tshul de lta bu sems can rnams kyis thos pa dang bsam pa'i sgo nas shes pa tsam gyis kyang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni grub pa la sogs par ma gyur kyang sngags kyi tshul de lta bu sems can rnams kyis thos pa dang bsam pa'i sgo nas shes pa tsam gyis kyang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Even if one does not attain the supreme attainment and so forth, merely by sentient beings hearing and contemplating such a way of mantra, they will become objects of worship in the world.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs par zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs par zhes pa nas /
translated: Lord of Secrets, moreover, bodhisattvas who are impeded by a single birth...

original: dgos pa'i sa la gnas de rnams //
analyzed: dgos pa'i sa la gnas de rnams //
translated: ...those abiding on the stage of need

original: sangs rgyas sa la gnas pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa la gnas pa yin //
translated: are abiding on the stage of buddhahood.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sa bcu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sang rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa de rnams ma skyes shing ma byung ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs nas sems can gyi don du thabs kyi 'khor los 'bras bu yod
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni sa bcu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sang rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa de rnams ma skyes shing ma byung ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs nas sems can gyi don du thabs kyi 'khor los 'bras bu yod
translated: This verse shows that the bodhisattvas who have completed the ten levels and are on the level of buddhahood, having realized that they are unborn and unoriginated, the nature of emptiness, abide on the level of fruitful existence through the wheel of skillful means for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: pa'i sa la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i sa la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the concentration of those who abide on the level of fruition.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa zhes pa ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste chos kyi rgyal tshab bo //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa zhes pa ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste chos kyi rgyal tshab bo //
translated: Those who are impeded by a single birth are the bodhisattvas on the tenth level who are impeded by a single birth from the level of the tathiigatatas, the regent of the Dharma.

original: gnyis su na sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu pa nyid du ris mthun par gyur pas nas bcu pa rnams rigs gcig pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu pa nyid du ris mthun par gyur pas nas bcu pa rnams rigs gcig pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Or else, the bodhisattvas on the tenth level are of the same type as those on the tenth level, and so the bodhisattvas on the tenth level are of the same type.

original: dgos pa dang ni bral ba ru //
analyzed: dgos pa dang ni bral ba ru //
translated: They are devoid of purpose.

original: 'jig rten mtshan nyid shes nas ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtshan nyid shes nas ni //
translated: Having understood the characteristics of the world,

original: dgos pa'i la gnas de rnams //
analyzed: dgos pa'i la gnas de rnams //
translated: they abide in the purpose

original: sangs rgyas la gnas pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la gnas pa yin //
translated: and they abide in buddhahood.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten rnams ni gang gi yang 'bras bu ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten rnams ni gang gi yang 'bras bu ma yin la /
translated: This verse means that worldly beings are not the effect of anything.

original: rgyur gang las kyang ma byung bas gdod ma nas skye ba med par rtogs kyang 'bras bu'i sa la gnas te sems can gyi don du sgyor zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa la sogs pa mdzad pas na sangs rgyas kyis la gnas
analyzed: rgyur gang las kyang ma byung bas gdod ma nas skye ba med par rtogs kyang 'bras bu'i sa la gnas te sems can gyi don du sgyor zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa la sogs pa mdzad pas na sangs rgyas kyis la gnas
translated: Since they do not arise from any cause, they are understood to be primordially unborn. Nevertheless, they abide on the resultant stage and, for the sake of sentient beings, they display and create various buddha realms and so forth.

original: pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams 'bras bu'i sa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams 'bras bu'i sa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, those bodhisattvas who abide on the resultant stage are called ‚Äúbodhisattvas who abide on the buddha stage.‚Äù

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa sangs rgyas kyis la gnas pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul lo //üîΩgsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa'i zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa sangs rgyas kyis la gnas pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul lo // gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa'i zhes pa nas /
translated: This is the way of samƒÅdhi for bodhisattvas on the tenth stage who abide on the buddha stage.

original: 'jig rten sgyu ma ltar shes nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgyu ma ltar shes nas //
translated: Guhyapati, furthermore, bodhisattvas on the eighth stage, having understood the world to be like an illusion,

original: 'jig rten @333b 'jig rten dbang du 'dod //
analyzed: 'jig rten @333b 'jig rten dbang du 'dod //
translated: are said to be masters of the world.

original: ces pa'i bar gyis ni sa brgya dpa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste de la /üîΩchos rnams thams cad ma dmigs shing //
analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyis ni sa brgya dpa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa ste de la / chos rnams thams cad ma dmigs shing //
translated: This passage explains the samadhi of the bodhisattvas on the eighth level.

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dngos med cing dmigs su med par rtogs ba'o //üîΩchos rnams dngos po med pa ste sngon du yod pa las zhig cing med par gyur te dngos spo med pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dngos med cing dmigs su med par rtogs ba'o // chos rnams dngos po med pa ste sngon du yod pa las zhig cing med par gyur te dngos spo med pa'am /
translated: The line ‚Äúall phenomena are unobservable‚Äù refers to the realization that all phenomena are by nature unreal and unobservable.

original: 'on te gdod ma nas ma byung ma skyes pas dngos po med pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /üîΩsrid dang skye ba rnam spangs pa'i //
analyzed: 'on te gdod ma nas ma byung ma skyes pas dngos po med pa yin zhe na de'i phyir / srid dang skye ba rnam spangs pa'i //
translated: Are phenomena unreal because they existed before but have since disintegrated and become nonexistent, or are they unreal because they have never arisen or occurred from the beginning?üîΩThe line ‚Äúfree from existence and birth‚Äù answers this.

original: zhes bya ba gsung ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pas slar 'byung bar yag mi 'gyur te gdod ma nas ma byung ma skyas pas dngos po med par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsung ste gdod ma nas ma skyes pas slar 'byung bar yag mi 'gyur te gdod ma nas ma byung ma skyas pas dngos po med par shes pa yin no //
translated: Since they have never arisen from the beginning, they will not occur again.

original: 'jig rten sgyu ma ltar shes nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgyu ma ltar shes nas //
translated: Knowing the world to be like an illusion,

original: zhes pa ni chos rnams de ltar dngos po med par rtogs pas 'jig rten gyi chos sa kun rdzob tu snang bar 'gyur pa yang dngos po med pa las snang pa ste ji ltar sgyu ma dngos po med pa las snang ba ltar shes so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos rnams de ltar dngos po med par rtogs pas 'jig rten gyi chos sa kun rdzob tu snang bar 'gyur pa yang dngos po med pa las snang pa ste ji ltar sgyu ma dngos po med pa las snang ba ltar shes so zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that by realizing that things are thus unreal, one understands that the appearance of all mundane things in the relative is an appearance from the unreal, just as the appearance of an illusion is from the unreal.

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten dbang du 'dong //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten dbang du 'dong //
translated: One goes to the world as a lord of the world.

original: ces pa ni de ltar chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes pas byang chub sems dpa' 'de 'jig rten pa'i nang na gtso bo dam par 'gyur pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes pas byang chub sems dpa' 'de 'jig rten pa'i nang na gtso bo dam par 'gyur pa zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that by understanding all things to be like illusions, the bodhisattva becomes the highest lord in the world.üîΩMoreover, Guhyapati, the ≈õrƒÅvakas do not engage in the wisdom of the nonexistence of things, and so on, up to the wisdom of the utter nonexistence of things. This is the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äô method of samƒÅdhi.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang nyan thos zhes pa nas shin tu dngos po med pa'i ye shes mi spyod de 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul la zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang nyan thos zhes pa nas shin tu dngos po med pa'i ye shes mi spyod de 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul la zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bshad pa
translated: This explains the samƒÅdhi of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: ste / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo skye ba dang 'jig par lta ste dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: ste / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo skye ba dang 'jig par lta ste dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvakas see the dharmas of the aggregates, etc., as having the nature of cause and effect, as arising and passing away, and they have a reference point.

original: de ltar skye pa dang 'jig pa yod pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis bshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar skye pa dang 'jig pa yod pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis bshig ste /
translated: Thus, because arising and passing away exist, they destroy the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: skye pa yong par mthong pas ni chad pa'i mtha' bshig la 'jig pa yod par mthong pas rtag pa'i mtha' bshig go //
analyzed: skye pa yong par mthong pas ni chad pa'i mtha' bshig la 'jig pa yod par mthong pas rtag pa'i mtha' bshig go //
translated: Because they see that there is arising, they destroy the extreme of nihilism. Because they see that there is passing away, they destroy the extreme of eternalism.

original: de ltar skye pa dang 'jig pa yod par mthong pas chos rnams shin tu dngos po med par mthong pa'i ye shes mi skye ste shin tu dngos po med na ye shes skye ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar skye pa dang 'jig pa yod par mthong pas chos rnams shin tu dngos po med par mthong pa'i ye shes mi skye ste shin tu dngos po med na ye shes skye ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because they see that arising and passing away exist, the wisdom that sees that dharmas are utterly unreal does not arise. Because if they were utterly unreal, the cause for the arising of wisdom would not be observed.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati!

original: rang sangs rgyas zhes pa nas 'di ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul lo zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas zhes pa nas 'di ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul lo zhes pa'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul bshad pa ste /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúsolitary realizers‚Äù to ‚Äúthis is the way of the samadhi of solitary realizers‚Äù explains the way of the samadhi of solitary realizer aryas.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par bshig @334a * //üîΩnas zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu sun 'byin pa'i tshul gyis rnam par bshig ces pa ste chos rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi ngo bo skad cig ma'i cha mi rtag pa gnas pa ni khab kyi rten la yungs kar gyi 'bras bu mi chags pa
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par bshig @334a * // nas zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu sun 'byin pa'i tshul gyis rnam par bshig ces pa ste chos rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi ngo bo skad cig ma'i cha mi rtag pa gnas pa ni khab kyi rten la yungs kar gyi 'bras bu mi chags pa
translated: Having destroyed cause and effect

original: dang 'dra ste brtag mi bzod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po med par rtogs so //
analyzed: dang 'dra ste brtag mi bzod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po med par rtogs so //
translated: means that having destroyed cause and effect by way of refuting them, one realizes that things and their causes and conditions are not existent cause and effect because the essence of the momentary parts of impermanent abiding is like mustard seeds not sticking to the point of a needle.

original: brjod du med pa'i chos kyi tshul la gnas pa rnams ni chos thams cad brjod du med do snyam pa'i ye shes 'jug ste zhes pa ni de ltar chos rnams yod pa ma yi pas tshig gi brjod du med par mthong pa'i ye shes skyes nas tshig tu
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos kyi tshul la gnas pa rnams ni chos thams cad brjod du med do snyam pa'i ye shes 'jug ste zhes pa ni de ltar chos rnams yod pa ma yi pas tshig gi brjod du med par mthong pa'i ye shes skyes nas tshig tu
translated: This is saying that since phenomena do not exist, the wisdom that sees them as inexpressible in words is born and stops the expression of words.

original: brjod pa yag 'gog par byed de de bas na chod thams cad brjod du med do snyam pa'i ye shes 'jug ste dag shin tu 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par reg par byed ce gsung pa yin no //üîΩmdor na 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bshig nas rang bzhin med par mthong bas chos la bdag med par rtogs kyang ngag dgag pa tsam la gnas pas byang chub sems dpa' ltar rnam pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba la
analyzed: brjod pa yag 'gog par byed de de bas na chod thams cad brjod du med do snyam pa'i ye shes 'jug ste dag shin tu 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par reg par byed ce gsung pa yin no // mdor na 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bshig nas rang bzhin med par mthong bas chos la bdag med par rtogs kyang ngag dgag pa tsam la gnas pas byang chub sems dpa' ltar rnam pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba la
translated: Therefore the wisdom that thinks all phenomena are inexpressible engages and it is said that it touches the samƒÅdhi of complete cessation.

original: mi gnas la /
analyzed: mi gnas la /
translated: In brief, the noble pratyekabuddhas destroy the things of cause and effect and see them as lacking any nature. Therefore they realize the selflessness of phenomena, but because they abide in mere verbal cessation, unlike bodhisattvas, they do not abide in the appearance of nonaspected wisdom.

original: nyan thos ltar gnag zag la bdag med par rtogs pa tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos ltar gnag zag la bdag med par rtogs pa tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the Listeners' Vehicle, which is merely the realization of the selflessness of the corruptible components.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang 'jig rten pa rnams rgyu las 'bras bu dang las 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang 'jig rten pa rnams rgyu las 'bras bu dang las 'byung ba'am /
translated: Moreover, Lord of the Secret Ones, worldly people realize that effects arise from causes and that they cease due to causes.üîΩThe meditative absorption of emptiness arises in them, and this is the method of meditative absorption for worldly people.

original: ldog par rtogs shing gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin kun du skye par 'gyur te 'di ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul lo zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul te 'jig rten pa
analyzed: ldog par rtogs shing gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin kun du skye par 'gyur te 'di ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul lo zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul te 'jig rten pa
translated: This is the method of meditative absorption for worldly people.

original: rnams ni las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rgyu las skyes kyang ded kyi bdag ces bya ba dbang po dang tshangs pa la sogs pas bskyed par rtogs la /
analyzed: rnams ni las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rgyu las skyes kyang ded kyi bdag ces bya ba dbang po dang tshangs pa la sogs pas bskyed par rtogs la /
translated: Worldly people think that although effects such as actions and their results are produced from causes, they are produced by a self, by Ishvara, by Brahma, and so forth.

original: chos rnams dngos po med de stong pa nyid du mthong pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin gyi dbang po la sogs pas stong par byas so snyam nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas par byed do //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po med de stong pa nyid du mthong pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin gyi dbang po la sogs pas stong par byas so snyam nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas par byed do //
translated: One might think, Since phenomena are not entities, they are seen as emptiness, but that emptiness is not empty by nature; it is made empty by the faculties and so forth. One then abides in the samadhi of emptiness.

original: gnas ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul yin te zhes pa nas //
analyzed: gnas ba pa'i bdag po 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul yin te zhes pa nas //

original: 'jig rten pa yi lha gang yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi lha gang yin //

original: gsang sngags spyad pa'i cho ga'i tshul //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyad pa'i cho ga'i tshul //

original: sems can rnam la phan 'dogs pas //
analyzed: sems can rnam la phan 'dogs pas //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings,

original: dpa' po de tshe 'chad par byed //
analyzed: dpa' po de tshe 'chad par byed //

original: ces pa'i bar gyis ni sngar bshad pa rnams bsdus nas bshad pa yin te de dag gis so so'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid @334b kyi tshul du rtogs pa'i stong pa de la gnas te stong pa'i chos da nyid tshig dang yig 'bru la sogs pa sa
analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyis ni sngar bshad pa rnams bsdus nas bshad pa yin te de dag gis so so'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid @334b kyi tshul du rtogs pa'i stong pa de la gnas te stong pa'i chos da nyid tshig dang yig 'bru la sogs pa sa
translated: This summarizes and explains what was previously explained. Those who realize their individual samadhis as the way of emptiness abide in that emptiness and teach and explain the very phenomena of emptiness, such as words, syllables, and so forth,

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du ston cing 'chad do zhes pa'o //
translated: for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then, the bhagavƒÅn again spoke to the lord of secrets VajrapƒÅ·πái:

analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid nyon cig ces pa nas /
