analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis de bzhi gshegs pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyon thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so'i sngags kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the characteristics of the individual mantras of the tathƒÅgatas, the completely enlightened buddhas, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: sngags kyi mtshan nyid de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /

analyzed: song rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor du rigs gsum bkod pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //

analyzed: de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su shes par bya'o // don dam pa ni rnam @335a * //

analyzed: par thar pa'i sgo stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate is the nature of emptiness, the door of liberation.

original: kun rdzob ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni /
translated: The conventional isüîΩthe stages of the purpose, such as

analyzed: dgos pa'i sa la gnas de rnams //
translated: the bodhisattvas abiding on the stages,

analyzed: sngags kyi rang bzhin rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste tshig dang 'bru dang dbyangs dang yul gyi skad rnams so //
translated: The nature of mantra should be understood as fourfold: words, syllables, tones, and local languages.

analyzed: de la tshig ni yi ge'i 'bru mang po 'dus pa las tshig tu longs par smra ba'o //

original: dbyangs ni aa dang ai la sogs pa gug skyed kyi rigs su gtogs ba'o ;
analyzed: dbyangs ni aa dang ai la sogs pa gug skyed kyi rigs su gtogs ba'o ;

analyzed: / yul gyi skad ni yul so so na skad gang gis spyod pa de nyid dang mthun par gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: gsang sngags mtshan nyid ji 'dra lags //

translated: Having thus requested the BhagavƒÅn, ‚ÄúListen now to what I will explain‚Äù means that since the characteristics of mantras, the mantra deities, and the meaning of mantras have been explained above, here the characteristics of mantras are said to be secret.üîΩ

original: ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshig rnams nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshig rnams nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, I will explain the characteristics of the mantras. Therefore, here it means listen to the words of the nature of the secret speech of the characteristics of the mantras.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gsang sngags ni //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gsang sngags ni //

translated: is characterized by words, names, and symbols.

original: zhes pa dzin dzik ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig smos pas 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi ming gi mtshan ma ste sangs rgyas kyi sngags su byed par shes pa'o //

analyzed: tshig de dbang du gyur pas na //

analyzed: gsang sngags don rnams thams cad sgrub //

original: ces pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sngags kyi tshig smos pa yang dbang chen gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma ste rgyas pa'i don thams cad 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa'o //

translated: The TathƒÅgata said, ‚ÄúBy this power, this purpose will be accomplished.‚ÄùüîΩIf one does it oneself,

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la byed du bcug gam / gzhan byed pa la rjes su yi rang na yang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mtshan ma dang bral bas byas pa'am byed du bcug pa 'am /

analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: sngags kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad par gyur na ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pas na sgrub par brtsams pa thams cad kyis nges par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngags kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad par gyur na ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pas na sgrub par brtsams pa thams cad kyis nges par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of the mantra were created by the TathƒÅgata, then since the TathƒÅgata acts for the benefit of all sentient beings, all who undertake the practice would certainly accomplish it.

original: de ltar sgrub po thams cad kyis 'grub pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub po thams cad kyis 'grub pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa ma yin no //
translated: Since not all practitioners achieve this, it is not the work of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ste sngags kyi mthu'i don dang @336b mthu gnyis rtag tu phan tshun 'grel pa yin tshig brjod pa tsam gyis don de nyid 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste sngags kyi mthu'i don dang @336b mthu gnyis rtag tu phan tshun 'grel pa yin tshig brjod pa tsam gyis don de nyid 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning and power of the mantra are always mutually dependent, then the mere utterance of the words would accomplish that meaning.

original: dper na me zhes tshig tu brjod pa na me'i rang bzhin sred par byed pa yin yang tshig tu brjod pas kha tshig par mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na me zhes tshig tu brjod pa na me'i rang bzhin sred par byed pa yin yang tshig tu brjod pas kha tshig par mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when the word ‚Äúfire‚Äù is uttered, although it has the nature of burning, the mere utterance of the word does not burn the mouth.

analyzed: de bas na sngags kyi mthu ni de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa yang ma yin /

original: gzhan byed du bcug pa'am /

analyzed: gzhan byed pa la rjes su yi rang ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not something that he rejoiced in others doing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa ste /
translated: Whether the TathƒÅgatas appear or not, this intrinsic nature has always been present.

original: de yang 'di ltar gsang sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags kyi chos nyid do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar gsang sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags kyi chos nyid do zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase this is the intrinsic nature of the secret mantra of all secret mantras

original: ming dang tshig dang brdas mtshan pa'i sngags de bskul ba la sogs pa'i tshig dang don du ldan na gang bskul ba'i don de nyid sus kyang byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang brdas mtshan pa'i sngags de bskul ba la sogs pa'i tshig dang don du ldan na gang bskul ba'i don de nyid sus kyang byas pa ma yin te /
translated: means that when a mantra that is signified by a name, word, or symbol is endowed with the meaning of the words of invocation and so forth, then the very meaning that is invoked is not created by anyone.

analyzed: rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par chos de de ltar ye nas gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on any other cause, and that phenomenon abides primordially in that way.

original: dper na bu ram gyi ro mngar ba dang lan tshva'i ro bro ba'i rang bzhin rnams rgyu gang gis kyang 'dus ma byas par mngar ba'i rang bzhin du ye nas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na bu ram gyi ro mngar ba dang lan tshva'i ro bro ba'i rang bzhin rnams rgyu gang gis kyang 'dus ma byas par mngar ba'i rang bzhin du ye nas gnas pa yin no //
translated: For example, the sweet taste of molasses and the salty taste of salt are not created by any cause, and they abide primordially as sweet and salty.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byas pa yin na de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba na sngags kyi rang bzhin de yang yod la /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byas pa yin na de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba na sngags kyi rang bzhin de yang yod la /
translated: If it were created by the tathƒÅgatas, then when the tathƒÅgatas appear, the nature of the mantra would exist.

original: ma byung na ni med par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ma byung na ni med par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa ste /
translated: If it did not exist, it would be nonexistent, but since that is not the case, whether the tathƒÅgatas appear or not, the intrinsic nature of phenomena has always existed.

original: de yang 'di ltar gsang sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags kyi chos nyid do zhes pa'o //üîΩgsang ba pa'i bdag po de la gang gi tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad gzigs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba de'i tshe zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar gsang sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags kyi chos nyid do zhes pa'o // gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la gang gi tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad gzigs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba de'i tshe zhes pa nas /
translated: Moreover, it is like this: the intrinsic nature of the secret mantra.

original: dbyangs sna tshogs su go ba rnams su byin gyis brlabs te de ltar gsang sngags kyi tshul 'chad do zhes pa'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dbyangs sna tshogs su go ba rnams su byin gyis brlabs te de ltar gsang sngags kyi tshul 'chad do zhes pa'i bar gyis ni /
translated: O Lord of Secrets, when the perfect, complete buddhas, the all-seeing ones, appear in the world, they bless the various sounds of the world, such as the sounds of elephants, conches, drums, lutes, flutes, kettledrums, cymbals, and so on, and the sounds of singing and various musical instruments, and they teach the way of the secret mantra in that way.

original: gsang sngags kyi chos nyid ye nas de ltar gnas pa la /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi chos nyid ye nas de ltar gnas pa la /
translated: The intrinsic nature of the secret mantra has always existed in that way.

original: tshig dang yig 'bru dang dbyangs rnams su ji ltar rigs par rnam par dgod pa tsam zhig de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig dang yig 'bru dang dbyangs rnams su ji ltar rigs par rnam par dgod pa tsam zhig de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad par bstan pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata is shown to have merely set forth the words, syllables, and tones in whatever way is appropriate.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis phyin ci ma log pa nyid du mngon par byang chub pa'o //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i zhes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i @337a * //üîΩye shes kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis phyin ci ma log pa nyid du mngon par byang chub pa'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i zhes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i @337a * // ye shes kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPerfect Buddha‚Äù refers to manifest enlightenment without error through the gnosis of equality.üîΩ‚ÄúOmniscient‚Äù refers to omniscience through the conventional and ultimate modes by the gnosis of discernment.

original: thams cad gzigs pa zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi yul du gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi yul du gzigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll-seeing‚Äù refers to seeing as an object through the mirror-like gnosis and the gnosis accomplishing activities.

original: de lta bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten du byung ba na tshul sna tshogs dang zhes ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i tshul rnam pa mang po dang rjes su mthun
analyzed: de lta bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'jig rten du byung ba na tshul sna tshogs dang zhes ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i tshul rnam pa mang po dang rjes su mthun
translated: When such omniscience itself appears in the world, it is in accord with the various ways, which is to say, in accord with the many aspects of the ways of buddhas, bodhisattvas, hearers, solitary realizers, worldly beings, and so forth.

original: par gsang sngags kyi chos nyid ye nas gnas pa de yig 'bru rnams su 'chad pa ni tshig dang yig 'bru rnams dang dbyangs rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: par gsang sngags kyi chos nyid ye nas gnas pa de yig 'bru rnams su 'chad pa ni tshig dang yig 'bru rnams dang dbyangs rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa'o //
translated: The reality of secret mantra, which has always been present, is explained in the letters, which are the various words, letters, and melodies.

original: gnyis su na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang padma'i rigs dang / rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa'i tshul sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang padma'i rigs dang / rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa'i tshul sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: In another way, it is the various ways of the tathƒÅgata family, the lotus family, the vajra family, and so forth.

original: dgongs pa sna tshogs shes pa ni sngags kyi tshig de rnams kyang la la ni sgra ji bzhin par 'chad /
analyzed: dgongs pa sna tshogs shes pa ni sngags kyi tshig de rnams kyang la la ni sgra ji bzhin par 'chad /
translated: Knowing the various intentions is to know that some of those mantra words are explained literally,

original: la la ni ldem po ngag tu ston pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: la la ni ldem po ngag tu ston pa zhes pa'o //
translated: and some are taught as indirect speech.

original: sems can bsam pa sna tshogs pa rnams la zhes pa ni sems can la la zhi bar 'dod /
analyzed: sems can bsam pa sna tshogs pa rnams la zhes pa ni sems can la la zhi bar 'dod /
translated: For sentient beings with various thoughts means that some sentient beings desire peace,

original: la la rgyas par 'dod /
analyzed: la la rgyas par 'dod /
translated: some desire increase,

original: la la grub pa mchog 'dod /
analyzed: la la grub pa mchog 'dod /
translated: some desire the supreme attainment,

original: la la 'bring 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi ji ltar 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //üîΩtshig sna tshogs dang yig 'bru sna tshogs dang yul gyi nges pa'i tshig tu brjod pa sna tshogs shes pa ni gsang sngags kyi chos nyid de dzin dzin la sogs pa'i tshig rnam pa du ma dang / dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i skad du smra ba rnam pa du ma'i mchan mar bkod de ston zhes pa'o //üîΩdbyangs sna tshogs su go ba rnams su byin gyis brlabs te zhes pa ni aa ai la sogs pa'i gug skyed kyi tshul rnam pa du ma'am /
analyzed: la la 'bring 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi ji ltar 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o // tshig sna tshogs dang yig 'bru sna tshogs dang yul gyi nges pa'i tshig tu brjod pa sna tshogs shes pa ni gsang sngags kyi chos nyid de dzin dzin la sogs pa'i tshig rnam pa du ma dang / dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i skad du smra ba rnam pa du ma'i mchan mar bkod de ston zhes pa'o // dbyangs sna tshogs su go ba rnams su byin gyis brlabs te zhes pa ni aa ai la sogs pa'i gug skyed kyi tshul rnam pa du ma'am /
translated: some desire the middling, and so on.üîΩThe knowledge of various words, various letters, and various expressions in the definitive terms of the country is the reality of mantra.üîΩIt is explained that the various aspects of the words such as jina jina and so on and the various aspects of the expressions in the language of the stainless and so on are set forth as the explanation.

original: sa 'dzin la sogs pa'i dbyangs sna tshogs su ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'dzin la sogs pa'i dbyangs sna tshogs su ston zhes pa'o //
translated: Blessing them as the understanding of various melodies means that the various aspects of the way of the hooks such as a ai and so on or the various melodies such as sa and so on are explained.

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsang sngags kyi tshul yig 'bru dag tu byin gyis rlob ce na zhes pa nas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi cho ga yang dag par ston to zhes pa'i bar gyis ni gsang sngags kyi chos nyid
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsang sngags kyi tshul yig 'bru dag tu byin gyis rlob ce na zhes pa nas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi cho ga yang dag par ston to zhes pa'i bar gyis ni gsang sngags kyi chos nyid
translated: How do the tathagatas bless the way of secret mantra as syllables?

original: yig 'bru la sogs par byin gyis brlabs te ston pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa de dag sngags kyi yig 'brur byin gyis brlabs nas ston par @337b bshad de /
analyzed: yig 'bru la sogs par byin gyis brlabs te ston pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa de dag sngags kyi yig 'brur byin gyis brlabs nas ston par @337b bshad de /
translated: This explains that the tathagatas bless the nature of secret mantra as syllables and so on and teach it.

original: tshig dang yig 'bru rnams su byin gyis rlob pa yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig dang yig 'bru rnams su byin gyis rlob pa yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Blessing the words and syllables should be known as twofold: conventional and ultimate.

original: de la kun rdzob tu ston pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams tshig dang yig 'bru la sogs par byin gyis brlabs te ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu ston pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams tshig dang yig 'bru la sogs par byin gyis brlabs te ston pa'o //
translated: Conventional teaching is blessing powers, fearlessnesses and so on as words, syllables and so forth and teaching it.

original: don dam par ston pa ni chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes ma byung ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yi ge la sogs pa'i 'brur ston pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ston pa ni chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes ma byung ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yi ge la sogs pa'i 'brur ston pa ste /
translated: The ultimate teacher is the nature of emptiness, the primordial non-arising and non-occurrence of all phenomena, taught in the syllables and so forth.

original: de bas na bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bden pa'i tshig gang yin pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bden pa'i tshig gang yin pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe words of truth that have been perfectly accomplished for many quintillions of eons, and the four noble truths, and so forth.‚Äù

original: bskal pa bye pa khrag khrig brgya stong du ma zhes pa ni mang po'i mtshon byed de 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bye pa khrag khrig brgya stong du ma zhes pa ni mang po'i mtshon byed de 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMany quintillions of eons‚Äù indicates plurality, and should be applied to all, such as the four noble truths and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa du mar bden pa'i tshig bsags pa de sngags kyi yig 'bru byin gyis brlabs pas na su bsgrub par 'dod pa des bden pa'i tshig rjes su bsrung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa du mar bden pa'i tshig bsags pa de sngags kyi yig 'bru byin gyis brlabs pas na su bsgrub par 'dod pa des bden pa'i tshig rjes su bsrung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Since the syllables of the mantra are blessed by the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs accumulation of words of truth over many eons, one who wishes to accomplish [the mantra] should understand the protection of the words of truth.

original: brdzun du smra bas sngags rnams mi 'grub po //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas sngags rnams mi 'grub po //
translated: Through lying, mantras are not accomplished.

original: zhes rgyud gzhan las kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rgyud gzhan las kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: This is also stated in other tantras.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che bdun dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che bdun dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang /
translated: The four noble truths, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four legs of supernatural power, the ten powers of the Tathagata, the six perfections, the seven precious branches of enlightenment, the four divine abodes,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang dag yin pa rnams ni gzhung gzhan las grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang dag yin pa rnams ni gzhung gzhan las grags pa nyid do //
translated: and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are well-known in other scriptures.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs dang sngon gyi smon lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang chos kyi dbyings
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs dang sngon gyi smon lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang chos kyi dbyings
translated: Lord of Secrets, in brief, all the omniscient wisdom of the Tathagatas is due to the power of the Tathagatas' own merit and wisdom, the power of their past aspirations, and the power of their knowledge of the

original: kyi byin rlabs kyi stobs kyi byin gyis brlabs nas sems can rnams la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi cho ga yang dag par ston to zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi mthu rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs nas yig 'bru rnamsüîΩsu ston pa ste /
analyzed: kyi byin rlabs kyi stobs kyi byin gyis brlabs nas sems can rnams la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi cho ga yang dag par ston to zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi mthu rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs nas yig 'bru rnams su ston pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the syllables through the blessing of the powers of the qualities of the Tathagata.

original: nyid kyi bsod nams dang ye shes stobs zhes pa ni bsod nams kyi stobs ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod @338a * //üîΩpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi bsod nams dang ye shes stobs zhes pa ni bsod nams kyi stobs ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod @338a * // pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The power of one's own merit and wisdom refers to the power of merit, which is the practice of the perfections of generosity, morality, and patience.

original: ye shes kyi stobs ni shes rab dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi stobs ni shes rab dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa ste /
translated: The power of wisdom is the practice of the perfections of wisdom and concentration.

original: stobs ni de dag gi mthu thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stobs ni de dag gi mthu thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Power is the unobstructed might of those.

original: sngon gyi smon lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang zhes pa sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis gsang sngags rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba ji bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang zhes pa sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis gsang sngags rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba ji bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The power of knowing former aspirations refers to the realization of the nature of the mantras just as it is through the force of former aspirations.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings la gnas nas zhes pa ste chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i mthu des sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi chos nyid yi ge'i 'bru la sogs par ston to
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings la gnas nas zhes pa ste chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i mthu des sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsang sngags kyi chos nyid yi ge'i 'bru la sogs par ston to
translated: The ‚Äúblessing of the dharma-dhƒÅtu‚Äù is ‚Äúabiding in the dharma-dhƒÅtu,‚Äù and by the power of abiding in the dharma-dhƒÅtu, the reality of the mantra is taught in the form of syllables and so on, in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: zhes pa'o // skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa ni ji ltar snod du 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa ni ji ltar snod du 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn accordance with their fortune‚Äù means to sentient beings who are suitable vessels.

original: gsang sngags kyi cho ga de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi cho ga de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that rite of the mantra?

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: ‚ÄúA is the door of all dharmas because of primordial non-arising‚Äù up to ‚ÄúLord of Secrets,

original: nga dang nya dang na dang na ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: nga dang nya dang na dang na ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúKa, kha, ga, gha, ·πÖa control all meditative stabilizations.

original: mthu thams cad dang ldan pa rab tu myur bar dgos pa'i don thams cad rab tu sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes pa'i bar gyis /
analyzed: mthu thams cad dang ldan pa rab tu myur bar dgos pa'i don thams cad rab tu sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes pa'i bar gyis /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with all powers, they accomplish all required aims very quickly.‚Äù

original: gsang sngags rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: gsang sngags rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of the secret mantra

original: tshig dang ming dang brda yis mtshan //
analyzed: tshig dang ming dang brda yis mtshan //
translated: are characterized by words, names, and symbols.üîΩThe Blessed One explained those very [mantras] as the doors of meditative concentration,

original: zhes bshad pa de dag nyid yi ge'i 'bru dang tshig rnams su bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa de rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa 'chad de /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de dag nyid yi ge'i 'bru dang tshig rnams su bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa de rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa 'chad de /
translated: [mantras] that are syllables and words.

original: tshig dang yi ge 'bru re re las ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa de yang don rnam pa gnyis ston te kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge 'bru re re las ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa de yang don rnam pa gnyis ston te kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
translated: That door of meditative concentration, which is in each syllable and word, also teaches two kinds of meanings: conventional and ultimate.

original: de la kun rdzob tu ston pa ni yig 'bru dang tshig rnams las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu ston pa ni yig 'bru dang tshig rnams las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: Among them, the conventional teaching is that from syllables and words, the qualities of the Blessed Buddha, such as the powers and fearlessnesses, are taught.

original: don dam pa ston pa ni yi ge de nyid kyi sgo nas chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa nyid du ston pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ston pa ni yi ge de nyid kyi sgo nas chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa nyid du ston pa ste /
translated: The ultimate teaching is that through those very syllables, all phenomena are taught as primordially unborn emptiness.

original: de bas na yig 'bru dang tshig gi sgo nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid phyag rgyal sogs pa'i sgo nas tshig dang ming dang brda yis mtshan par bstan te yig 'bru dang tshig rnams su
analyzed: de bas na yig 'bru dang tshig gi sgo nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid phyag rgyal sogs pa'i sgo nas tshig dang ming dang brda yis mtshan par bstan te yig 'bru dang tshig rnams su
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the meaning of the conventional and the ultimate through letters and words, the BhagavƒÅn taught the characteristics of secret mantra through the door of mudrƒÅ-s and so forth, and taught them through the signs of words, names, and symbols.

original: byin gyis brlabs te bstan to //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs te bstan to //
translated: He taught them by blessing the letters and words.üîΩTherefore, here I will explain the teaching that all phenomena are emptiness by way of the letters such as the letter A.

original: de bas na nga 'dir yi ge aa la sogs pa'i yig 'bru rnams kyi sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid rang bzhin du bstan par bshad de de yang yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams stong pa nyid kyi ting nge @338büîΩ'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa ste /üîΩde rnams las kyang kha cig ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston /
analyzed: de bas na nga 'dir yi ge aa la sogs pa'i yig 'bru rnams kyi sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid rang bzhin du bstan par bshad de de yang yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams stong pa nyid kyi ting nge @338b 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa ste / de rnams las kyang kha cig ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston /
translated: Moreover, the thirty-two letters beginning with ka are the door to the samƒÅdhi of emptiness.üîΩSome of them teach that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: kha cig ni phyogs gcig stong pa nyid du ston /
analyzed: kha cig ni phyogs gcig stong pa nyid du ston /
translated: Some teach one-sided emptiness.

original: kha cig ni stong par 'jug pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa ji ltar rigs par blta'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni stong par 'jug pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa ji ltar rigs par blta'o //
translated: Some are doors to the concentration of emptiness, in that they lead to emptiness.üîΩThey should be seen as appropriate.

original: de la yi ge aa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa las lhag par yi ge gzhan rnams kyis stong pa nyid du ston pa med de /
analyzed: de la yi ge aa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa las lhag par yi ge gzhan rnams kyis stong pa nyid du ston pa med de /
translated: In this regard, there is no other letter that teaches emptiness more than any other letter, such as a, that teaches all as empty.

original: gang yi ge aa la sogs pas bstan pa de nyid yi ge gzhan rnams kyis kyang ston pas stong pa nyid du ston par gcig ste /
analyzed: gang yi ge aa la sogs pas bstan pa de nyid yi ge gzhan rnams kyis kyang ston pas stong pa nyid du ston par gcig ste /
translated: Since that which is taught by the letter a, etc. is also taught by other letters, they are the same in teaching emptiness.

original: yi ge aa'i sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs na yi ge gzhan ci dgos she na /
analyzed: yi ge aa'i sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs na yi ge gzhan ci dgos she na /
translated: If all dharmas are realized as empty by means of the letter a, what need is there for other letters?

original: stong par ston pa ni yi ge gcig gis kyang chog mod kyi /
analyzed: stong par ston pa ni yi ge gcig gis kyang chog mod kyi /
translated: It is quite sufficient to teach emptiness by means of one letter.

original: yig 'bru dang tshig rnams las sngags su bstan te sngags de'i sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston par dgongs pa'i phyir yi ge thams cad smos so //
analyzed: yig 'bru dang tshig rnams las sngags su bstan te sngags de'i sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston par dgongs pa'i phyir yi ge thams cad smos so //
translated: However, all letters are mentioned because it is intended that all dharmas be taught as empty by means of that mantra, which is taught as a mantra from among the syllables and words.

original: de bas na sngags thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes rgyud gzhan las gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sngags thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes rgyud gzhan las gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the nature of all mantras is the Thought of Enlightenment.üîΩA is the door of all dharmas because of non-production from the beginning.

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pas stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pas stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata is the realization of the emptiness of all dharmas through their non-production from the beginning.

original: de bas na yi ge aa de stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur par byin gyis brlabs shing gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge aa de stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur par byin gyis brlabs shing gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that letter A is empowered and established as the door of the samadhi which realizes emptiness.

original: de bas na yi ge aa'i sgo nas chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes shing ma byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge aa'i sgo nas chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes shing ma byung bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, through the door of the letter A, all dharmas are shown to be non-produced and non-arisen from the beginning.

original: dgos pa dang bral ba'i phyir ka ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rgya gar skad du dgos pa la kar ya zhes bya la /
analyzed: dgos pa dang bral ba'i phyir ka ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rgya gar skad du dgos pa la kar ya zhes bya la /
translated: Ka is the door of all dharmas because of the absence of purpose.

original: yi ge ka de chos thams cad stong pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pas yi ge ka'i sgo nas chos thams cad dgos pa med par shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge ka de chos thams cad stong pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pas yi ge ka'i sgo nas chos thams cad dgos pa med par shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that letter ka is the door to the meditative absorption of the emptiness of all phenomena, it is said that through the door of the letter ka one should know that all phenomena are without purpose.

original: dgos pa zhes pa ni 'bras bu ste //
analyzed: dgos pa zhes pa ni 'bras bu ste //
translated: Purpose means effect.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin na //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin na //
translated: If it does not produce,

original: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: causality is not tenable.

original: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
translated: If causality is not tenable,

original: 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur //
translated: whose effect would it be?

original: zhes 'byung bas 'bras bu rgyus ma skyes pas med kyi /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas 'bras bu rgyus ma skyes pas med kyi /
translated: Thus, since the effect is not produced by the cause, it does not exist.

original: rgyu de 'bras bu skyes pa'i rang bzhin du yod mod ce na /
analyzed: rgyu de 'bras bu skyes pa'i rang bzhin du yod mod ce na /
translated: But the cause itself exists in the nature of the produced effect.

original: rgyu nyid 'bras bu las gyur pa ste de bas na chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'bras bu las gyur pa ste de bas na chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all phenomena should be known to be unborn and unproduced.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dmigs su med pa'i phyir kha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la rgya gar skad du kha sa ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dmigs su med pa'i phyir kha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la rgya gar skad du kha sa ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is like space, it is not apprehended. Therefore, ka is the door of all phenomena.

original: yi ge kha de chos thams cad stong par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin @339a * //
analyzed: yi ge kha de chos thams cad stong par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin @339a * //
translated: The letter kha is the door of meditative stabilization that shows all phenomena as empty.

original: gyi sgor zhugs te thams cad nam mkha' lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pas yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gyi sgor zhugs te thams cad nam mkha' lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pas yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since everything has the nature of space, it does not exist.

original: 'gro ba thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ga ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni ga ti zhes pa 'gro ba la yang bya /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ga ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni ga ti zhes pa 'gro ba la yang bya /
translated: Since all beings are not observed, ga is the door of all phenomena.

original: rgyud la yang bya /
analyzed: rgyud la yang bya /
translated: Ga is also used for ‚Äúgoing,‚Äù ‚Äúcontinuum,‚Äù and ‚Äúrealization.‚ÄùüîΩThe letter ga is the door of meditative stabilization that shows all phenomena as emptiness.

original: rtogs pa la yang bya ste yi ge ga ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste gyur pa yin pas 'gro bar drang na ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa la yang bya ste yi ge ga ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste gyur pa yin pas 'gro bar drang na ni /
translated: Since it is a transformation, if one draws it as going,

original: shar dang nub la sogs par 'gro bar bya ba dang 'gro bar byed pa dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: shar dang nub la sogs par 'gro bar bya ba dang 'gro bar byed pa dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: the going and the goer are not observed in the east, west, and so on.

original: rgyud du drang na ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'i rgyud drug dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud du drang na ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'i rgyud drug dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: If one draws it as a continuum, the six continuums of humans, gods, and so on are not observed.

original: rtogs par drang na ni chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po dang rtogs par byed pa la dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par drang na ni chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po dang rtogs par byed pa la dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: If it is to be interpreted, then it is to be realized that all things are primordially unborn, and there is no object of realization and no realizer.üîΩSince there is no object of reference that is a single entity, bha is the door of all dharmas.

original: gcig tu 'phungs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir gha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'i zhes pa ni gcig tu 'phungs pa la rgya gar skad du bha ga zhes bya la //
analyzed: gcig tu 'phungs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir gha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'i zhes pa ni gcig tu 'phungs pa la rgya gar skad du bha ga zhes bya la //
translated: The Indian word for bha is bhaga, which means cavity.

original: yi ge bha ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste rdul phra mo rnams gcig 'phungs pa'i dngos po dmigs su med ces pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge bha ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste rdul phra mo rnams gcig 'phungs pa'i dngos po dmigs su med ces pa'o //
translated: The syllable bha is the door of the samadhi that reveals all dharmas as emptiness, which means that the particles are not observed as a single entity.üîΩSince it is free from all death and transmigration, ca is the door of all dharmas.

original: 'chi 'pho thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir tsa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'chi 'pho la rgya gar skad du tsyu ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir tsa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'chi 'pho la rgya gar skad du tsyu ti zhes bya ste /
translated: The Indian word for death and transmigration is cyuti.

original: yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad stong par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo yin pas chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir 'chi 'pho yang dmigs su med ces pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad stong par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo yin pas chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir 'chi 'pho yang dmigs su med ces pa'o //
translated: The letter tsa is the door of meditative absorption that shows all phenomena to be empty. Therefore, since all phenomena are unborn, death and transmigration are also unobservable.

original: grib ma dang mtshungs pa'i phyir tsha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni grib ma la tsha ya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: grib ma dang mtshungs pa'i phyir tsha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni grib ma la tsha ya zhes bya ste /
translated: Tsa is the door of all phenomena because it is like a shadow.

original: tsha de chos thams cad stong par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste de la grib ma de lus las gzhan yin na ni lus med kyang grib ma 'byung bar rigs la /
analyzed: tsha de chos thams cad stong par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste de la grib ma de lus las gzhan yin na ni lus med kyang grib ma 'byung bar rigs la /
translated: Tsa is the door of meditative absorption that shows all phenomena to be empty. If that shadow were different from the body, it would be reasonable for the shadow to appear even when there is no body.

original: lus las gzhan ma yin na grib ma logs shig tu 'byung ba yang mi rigs pa las de lta bu 'byung bas na yang dag pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'am sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus las gzhan ma yin na grib ma logs shig tu 'byung ba yang mi rigs pa las de lta bu 'byung bas na yang dag pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'am sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: If it were not different from the body, it would be unreasonable for the shadow to appear separately. Since it does appear in that way, it is not real, but is like a delusion or an illusion.

original: 'khrul pa 'am sgyu ma ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te chos thams cad kyang grib ma de dang 'dra bas stong pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa 'am sgyu ma ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te chos thams cad kyang grib ma de dang 'dra bas stong pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: A delusion or an illusion is not an existent thing. Since all phenomena are like that shadow, they are emptiness.

original: skye ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir dza ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni skye ba la dz'a ti zhes bya ste skye bar bya ba'am skye bzhin pa'i dngos po med pas skye ba dmigs su med pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir dza ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni skye ba la dz'a ti zhes bya ste skye bar bya ba'am skye bzhin pa'i dngos po med pas skye ba dmigs su med pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Ja is the gate of all dharmas because birth is not apprehended.  Birth is called jƒÅti. Since there is no entity to be born or in the process of being born, birth is said to be not apprehended.

original: dra mi dmigs su med pa'i phyir dzha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni dri ma la dzha ma ra zhes bya ste dri mar gyur pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: dra mi dmigs su med pa'i phyir dzha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni dri ma la dzha ma ra zhes bya ste dri mar gyur pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Dha is the gate of all dharmas because stains are not apprehended.  Stains are called dharmas that are stained. They are said to be not apprehended.

original: nga rgyal dmigs su med pa'i phyir ta ni chos thams cad @339b kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni nga rgyal la da k'a r'a zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dmigs su med pa'i phyir ta ni chos thams cad @339b kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni nga rgyal la da k'a r'a zhes bya ste /
translated: Ta is the gate of all dharmas because pride is not apprehended.  Pride is called ƒÅdhikara·πáa.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid pas nga rgyal gyi dngos po med ces pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid pas nga rgyal gyi dngos po med ces pa'o //
translated: Since all dharmas are emptiness, there is no entity of pride.

original: bskyed pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa la bi t'a pa na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa la bi t'a pa na zhes bya ste /
translated: Na is the gate of all dharmas because generation is not apprehended.  Generation is called vitti.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid pas bskyed pa'i dngos po dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid pas bskyed pa'i dngos po dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are emptiness, the entity that is generated is not observed.

original: 'khrug pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir da ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'khrug pa la da ma ra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir da ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'khrug pa la da ma ra zhes bya ste /
translated: Since agitation is not observed, dha is the gateway of all phenomena.

original: 'khrug par bya ba'i dngos po rnams med pas 'khrug par byed pa'i dngos po yang dmigs su med pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug par bya ba'i dngos po rnams med pas 'khrug par byed pa'i dngos po yang dmigs su med pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Agitation is called dama in Sanskrit. Since entities that are agitated do not exist, entities that agitate are also not observed.üîΩSince deception is not observed, dha is the gateway of all phenomena.

original: slu ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir dha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni slu ba la dham ga zhes bya ste chos rnams stong pa nyid yin pas slu ba'i dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: slu ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir dha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni slu ba la dham ga zhes bya ste chos rnams stong pa nyid yin pas slu ba'i dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Deception is called dhama in Sanskrit. Since phenomena are emptiness, deceptive entities do not exist.

original: de bzhin nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ta ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid la ta tha t'a zhes bya ste de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid ces pa ni gcig gi rnam grangs te de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du dmigs su med pa'o //üîΩgnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir tha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni gnas la sth'a na zhes bya ste snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gyi gnas sam chos rnams skad cig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mi gnas pa'i phyir gnas dmigs su med ces
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ta ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid la ta tha t'a zhes bya ste de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid ces pa ni gcig gi rnam grangs te de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du dmigs su med pa'o // gnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir tha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni gnas la sth'a na zhes bya ste snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gyi gnas sam chos rnams skad cig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mi gnas pa'i phyir gnas dmigs su med ces
translated: Because suchness is not perceived, ta is the door of all dharmas. Suchness is called tathata, the limit of reality, and emptiness are synonyms. Because the nature of suchness is not perceived.üîΩBecause the abode is not perceived, tha is the door of all dharmas. The abode is called sthana, the nature of the world of the vessel. Because dharmas have the characteristic of momentariness, they do not abide, so the abode is said to be not perceived.

original: pa'o // 'dul ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir da ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'dul ba la dman zhes bya ba ste 'dul ba'i dngos po'am gdul bar bya ba dmigs su med ces pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'dul ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir da ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'dul ba la dman zhes bya ba ste 'dul ba'i dngos po'am gdul bar bya ba dmigs su med ces pa'o //
translated: Because the discipline is not perceived, da is the door of all dharmas. The discipline is called damana, the entity of discipline or the object of discipline is not perceived.

original: khams dmigs su med pa'i phyir dha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni khams la dh'a tu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams dmigs su med pa'i phyir dha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni khams la dh'a tu zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable dha is the gateway of all phenomena because the elements are non-apprehensible.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams la sogs pa dmigs su med ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams la sogs pa dmigs su med ces pa'o //
translated: The elements such as the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm are said to be non-apprehensible.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni don dam pa la par m'artha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni don dam pa la par m'artha zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable ba is the gateway of all phenomena because ultimate truth is non-apprehensible.

original: yi ge pa ni de don dam pa'i rang bzhin du yang dmigs su med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge pa ni de don dam pa'i rang bzhin du yang dmigs su med par bstan pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is called paramƒÅrtha, and the syllable ba indicates that even the nature of the ultimate is taught to be non-apprehensible.üîΩThe syllable pha is the gateway of all phenomena because they are insubstantial like foam.

original: dbu ba dang 'dra bar snying po med pa'i phyir pha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni dbu ba la phe na zhes bya ste phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams dbu ba dang 'dra bar snying po med par bshig pa de yang snying po medüîΩpar yi ge pha'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: dbu ba dang 'dra bar snying po med pa'i phyir pha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni dbu ba la phe na zhes bya ste phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams dbu ba dang 'dra bar snying po med par bshig pa de yang snying po medüîΩpar yi ge pha'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The phenomena such as the aggregates are explained to be insubstantial like foam, and that too is taught to be insubstantial through the syllable pha.

original: ngag gi lam dang bral ba'i @340a * //
analyzed: ngag gi lam dang bral ba'i @340a * //
translated: Because it is free from the path of speech,üîΩbha is the gate of all dharmas.

original: phying ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni ngag gi lam la b'akba tha zhes bya ste rnam par ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig tu mi smra'i /
analyzed: phying ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni ngag gi lam la b'akba tha zhes bya ste rnam par ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig tu mi smra'i /
translated: The path of speech is called vƒÅkpatha. Without examining or investigating, one does not speak verbally.

original: brtag par bya ba dang rtog par byed pas tshag tu smra ba yang dmigs su med pa yig ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba dang rtog par byed pas tshag tu smra ba yang dmigs su med pa yig ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing to examine and no examiner, even verbal expression is not observed. This is taught by the syllable bha.üîΩBecause all existences are unobservable, bha is the gate of all dharmas.

original: srid pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir bha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes ba ni srid pa la bha ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir bha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes ba ni srid pa la bha ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Existence is called bhava.

original: de yang 'dod ba'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'byung bas na srid pa zhes bya ste phung po lnga nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod ba'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'byung bas na srid pa zhes bya ste phung po lnga nyid la bya'o //
translated: Since it arises in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, it is called existence. It should be understood as the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga po de dag dmigs su med par yi ge bha'i sgo nas ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag dmigs su med par yi ge bha'i sgo nas ston to //
translated: Those five aggregates are taught to be unobservable by the syllable bha.

original: 'chib dmigs su med pa'i phyir ma ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'chi ba la par na zhes bya ste chos rnams ma skyes par 'chi ba yang dmigs su med par yi ge ma'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'chib dmigs su med pa'i phyir ma ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni 'chi ba la par na zhes bya ste chos rnams ma skyes par 'chi ba yang dmigs su med par yi ge ma'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The syllable ma is the door of all dharmas because death is not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ya is the door of all dharmas because all vehicles are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ra is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable la is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable va is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.

original: theg pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ya ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni theg pa la y'a na zhes bya ste chos rnams kyi don shes na chos kyang gzings dang 'dra bar bor bas na chos rnams stong par rtogs pas na theg paüîΩgang la zhugs te rtogs pa'i theg pa de nyid kyang dmigs su med par yi ge ya'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ya ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni theg pa la y'a na zhes bya ste chos rnams kyi don shes na chos kyang gzings dang 'dra bar bor bas na chos rnams stong par rtogs pas na theg paüîΩgang la zhugs te rtogs pa'i theg pa de nyid kyang dmigs su med par yi ge ya'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The syllable ≈õa is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ·π£a is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable sa is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ha is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable k·π£a is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable a is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ƒÅ is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable o is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable au is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable·πÉ is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable·∏• is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ka is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable kha is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ga is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable gha is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ·πÖa is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ca is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable cha is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable ja is the door of all dharmas because all dharmas are not apprehended.üîΩThe syllable jha is

original: rdul thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ra ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rdul la ra dza zhes bya ste rdul zhes bya brdul phra mo rnams la yang bya la nyon mongs pa rnams la yang bya ste de gnyis gang yang rung ba dmigs su
analyzed: rdul thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ra ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rdul la ra dza zhes bya ste rdul zhes bya brdul phra mo rnams la yang bya la nyon mongs pa rnams la yang bya ste de gnyis gang yang rung ba dmigs su
translated: Ra is called rajas, which means ‚Äúparticle.‚Äù It refers to both subtle particles and afflictions.

original: med par yi ge ra'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med par yi ge ra'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: Either of those two is indicated by the syllable ra.üîΩLa is the gateway of all phenomena because characteristics are not observed.

original: mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir la ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni mtshan nyid la la ksha na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir la ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni mtshan nyid la la ksha na zhes bya ste /
translated: Characteristics are called lakshana.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dmigs su med par yi ge la'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dmigs su med par yi ge la'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The nonobservation of the characteristics of the compounded and the uncompounded is indicated by the syllable la.üîΩSha is the gateway of all phenomena because they are naturally peaceful.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i phyir sha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba la pra krita sh'anti na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i phyir sha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba la pra krita sh'anti na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally peaceful‚Äù is prakrti-shanti.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yi ge sha'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yi ge sha'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The door of all phenomena is emptiness and natural peace, as indicated by the syllable ≈õa.

original: rang bzhin gyi bems po'i phyir sha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni bems po la shata zhes bya ste mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang pos zin pa'i chos rnams ni yang dag par na zin pa yin te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bems po'i phyir sha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni bems po la shata zhes bya ste mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang pos zin pa'i chos rnams ni yang dag par na zin pa yin te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po
translated: Because of being naturally inanimate, ≈õa is the door of all phenomena. ≈öa is called inanimate matter, and phenomena that are possessed by the sense faculties such as the eyes and ears are, in reality, possessed.

original: rnams blun pas tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de @340b dag gis zin pa'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin par sha'i sgo nas ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnams blun pas tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de @340b dag gis zin pa'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin par sha'i sgo nas ston pa'o //
translated: Because the sense faculties such as the eyes are stupid and are not valid cognitions, the phenomena that they possess do not exist. This is indicated by the syllable ≈õa.

original: sha da'i sgor ba tang ba ni da dang sha gnyis gnas gcig nas byung ba dang da'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sha da'i sgor ba tang ba ni da dang sha gnyis gnas gcig nas byung ba dang da'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The syllable ≈õa is called the door because it arises from the same place as the syllable da and it performs the function of da.

original: bden pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir sa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni bden pa la sa tya zhes bya ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dmigs su med par yi ge sa'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: bden pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir sa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni bden pa la sa tya zhes bya ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dmigs su med par yi ge sa'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: Since all truths are unobservable, sa is the door of all phenomena.üîΩSince causes are unobservable, ha is the door of all phenomena.

original: rgyu dmigs su med pa'i phyir ha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rgyu la he tu zhes bya ste chos thams cad kyi rgyu dmigs su med par yi ge ha'i sgo nas bstan pa ste mdor na yi ge de rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi
analyzed: rgyu dmigs su med pa'i phyir ha ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni rgyu la he tu zhes bya ste chos thams cad kyi rgyu dmigs su med par yi ge ha'i sgo nas bstan pa ste mdor na yi ge de rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi
translated: In brief, one should understand that those syllables

original: ting 'dzin rnams kyi sgo ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rnams kyi sgo ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: indicate the doors of the meditative stabilizations of emptiness.üîΩLord of the Secret Ones, nga, da, na, and na are the masters of all meditative stabilizations.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po nga dang nya dang na dang na ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba ste zhes pa ni yi ge de rnams la klad kor gyi 'khor btags pas stong ba nyid kyi mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir nga ni ka la sogs
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po nga dang nya dang na dang na ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba ste zhes pa ni yi ge de rnams la klad kor gyi 'khor btags pas stong ba nyid kyi mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir nga ni ka la sogs
translated: Since those syllables are the signs of emptiness when the circle of the anusvƒÅra is attached to them, nga is the master of the meditative stabilizations of the ka group.

original: pa'i 'khor kun dbang ngo //
analyzed: pa'i 'khor kun dbang ngo //
translated: The retinue of pa is all the vowels.

original: nya ni tsal  sogs pa'i 'khor kun du gtogs so //üîΩna ni da la sogs pa'i 'khor kun du gtogs so //
analyzed: nya ni tsal  sogs pa'i 'khor kun du gtogs so // na ni da la sogs pa'i 'khor kun du gtogs so //
translated: The retinue of nya is all the consonants.üîΩThe retinue of na is all the consonants.

original: na ni ta la sogs pa'i 'khor kun du gtogs so //
analyzed: na ni ta la sogs pa'i 'khor kun du gtogs so //
translated: The retinue of na is all the consonants.

original: de bzhin du yi ge de rnams ya ral sogs pa'i stong par gtogs te stong pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin pas mthu thams cad dang ldan la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge de rnams ya ral sogs pa'i stong par gtogs te stong pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin pas mthu thams cad dang ldan la /
translated: In the same way, those letters belong to the emptiness of ya, ra, and so forth, and since they are the characteristics of all emptinesses, they possess all powers.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub pa'i dgos pa rnams kyang myur du 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub pa'i dgos pa rnams kyang myur du 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And also the purposes of the relative are quickly accomplished.

original: de bas na mthu thams cad dang ldan pa rab tu myur bar dgos pa'i don thams cad rab tu sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mthu thams cad dang ldan pa rab tu myur bar dgos pa'i don thams cad rab tu sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they possess all powers and quickly accomplish all the purposes of the goal.

original: gsang pa pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: gsang pa pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: It is said that the Lord of Secrets

original: gsang sngags kyi tshul nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshul nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di ni zhes pa nas /
translated: is the door of meditative concentration of this way of mantra.

original: sngags pas yid la sems na ni //
analyzed: sngags pas yid la sems na ni //
translated: If the mantrin keeps it in mind,

original: 'chi 'pho med pa'i gnas 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med pa'i gnas 'thob bo //
translated: he will attain the state of no death and no transmigration.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis sngags kyi tshul ka la sogs pa'i yig 'bru de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur par bshad pa rnams kyi rjes su bsngags pa dang rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis sngags kyi tshul ka la sogs pa'i yig 'bru de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur par bshad pa rnams kyi rjes su bsngags pa dang rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains the praise and nature of the mantra system, which is the door of meditative stabilization observing the suchness of the letters ka and so on.

original: de yang 'jug pa'i yon tan dang gnas pa'i yon tan dang sdang ba'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //üîΩde la re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa ni de bzhin @341a //
analyzed: de yang 'jug pa'i yon tan dang gnas pa'i yon tan dang sdang ba'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o // de la re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa ni de bzhin @341a //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the qualities of engagement, the qualities of abiding and the nature of wrath are explained.

original: gshegs pa'i rgyu'i yon tan dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa las gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i rgyu'i yon tan dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa las gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: With regard to this, the phrase ‚Äúthe inconceivable fruitional effect of all tathƒÅgatas, which fulfills all hopes‚Äù refers to the qualities of the cause of the tathƒÅgatas, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa gsang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi don nges pa zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa gsang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi don nges pa zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe ascertainment of the meaning of the reality of the secret mantra, which possesses the supreme of all aspects‚Äù refers to the nature of engagement.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes pa ni yi ge aa dang ka la sogs pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa'i chog rnams dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes pa ni yi ge aa dang ka la sogs pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa'i chog rnams dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the supreme of all aspects means endowed with the syllables a, ka, and so on, which are the doors of meditative concentration that engage the suchness of the object.

original: gsang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi don nges pa zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pas rigs pa dang lung gis sun phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi don nges pa zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pas rigs pa dang lung gis sun phyin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the reality of mantra is ascertained means that it is refuted by reasoning and scripture that are nonerroneous.

original: dus gsum dus las shin tu 'das //
analyzed: dus gsum dus las shin tu 'das //
translated: Totally beyond the three times,

original: mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ste //
analyzed: mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ste //
translated: like space, stainless,

original: bsam yas sems kyi sa la gnas //
analyzed: bsam yas sems kyi sa la gnas //
translated: abiding on the inconceivable mental stage.

original: zhes pa ni gnas pa'i rang bzhin de dus gsum las shin tu 'das pa ni 'das pa dang lnga ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de yang phung po lnga la bya bas na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnas pa'i rang bzhin de dus gsum las shin tu 'das pa ni 'das pa dang lnga ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de yang phung po lnga la bya bas na /
translated: This is the nature of abiding. Totally beyond the three times means that the past, future, and present times are also the five aggregates,

original: phung po lnga las shin tu 'das //
analyzed: phung po lnga las shin tu 'das //
translated: so it is said, ‚ÄúTotally beyond the five aggregates.‚Äù

original: zhes pa'o // mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ste //
translated: Like space, stainless,

original: zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral ba zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the freedom from the stains of the obscurations of the knowable and of the afflictions.

original: bsam yas sems kyi sa la gnas //
analyzed: bsam yas sems kyi sa la gnas //
translated: Abiding in the inconceivable stage of mind,

original: zhes pa ni bsam pa med pa las sems kyis la gnas pas te so so rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsam pa med pa las sems kyis la gnas pas te so so rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'o //
translated: This is abiding in the stage of mind that is beyond imagination. It is the nature of individual self-awareness.

original: las dang bya ba dag las byung //
analyzed: las dang bya ba dag las byung //
translated: Arising from action and activity,

original: spyad pa'i sa ni rjes thob nas //
analyzed: spyad pa'i sa ni rjes thob nas //
translated: Having attained the stage of practice,

original: bsam yas 'bras bu sbyin par byed //
analyzed: bsam yas 'bras bu sbyin par byed //
translated: It grants the inconceivable result.

original: ces pa ni langs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ces pa ni langs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: This is the nature of arising.

original: las dang bya ba dag las byung //
analyzed: las dang bya ba dag las byung //
translated: Arising from action and activity,

original: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid las langs nas sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid las langs nas sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having arisen from emptiness, in order to benefit sentient beings,

original: kun du bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi las rnams kyang ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi las rnams kyang ston zhes pa'o //
translated: It also displays the actions of body and speech, such as the four aspects of universal activity.

original: spyad pa'i sa ni rjes thob nas //
analyzed: spyad pa'i sa ni rjes thob nas //
translated: Having attained the stage of practice,

original: bsam yas 'bras bu sbyin par byed //
analyzed: bsam yas 'bras bu sbyin par byed //
translated: It grants the inconceivable result.

original: ces pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pa rnams bag kyis spyad na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa sbyin par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pa rnams bag kyis spyad na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa sbyin par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: If one practices the perfections of giving and so on with ease, it gives inconceivable high status and definite goodness.

original: 'di ni de nyid dam pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni de nyid dam pa ste //
translated: This is the highest reality,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bstan //
translated: taught by the Buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni gong du bshad pa rnams bsdus pa'i tshig ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bshad pa rnams bsdus pa'i tshig ste //
translated: This is a summarizing verse of what was explained above.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bstan //
translated: Taught by the Buddhas.

original: zhes pa'o // gsang sngags cho ga 'di shes na //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gsang sngags cho ga 'di shes na //
translated: If one knows this ritual of the mantra,

original: sngags pa dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngags pa dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
translated: the mantrin will attain power.

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi rang bzhin stong pa @341b nyid byang chub kyi sems sgom pa zhes pa dang sngags kyi yi ge las lha'i gzugs su sbyar zhing yan lag bzhi pa'i bzlas pa la sogs pa'i cho ga shes na grub pa thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi rang bzhin stong pa @341b nyid byang chub kyi sems sgom pa zhes pa dang sngags kyi yi ge las lha'i gzugs su sbyar zhing yan lag bzhi pa'i bzlas pa la sogs pa'i cho ga shes na grub pa thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that if one knows the nature of the mantra, which is the meditation on emptiness, the thought of awakening, and the union of the mantra syllables with the form of the deity, and the ritual of the four-branched recitation and so on, one will attain power.

original: sgra zhes bya ba de nyid mchog / gsang sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags mtshan //
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba de nyid mchog / gsang sngags rnams kyi gsang sngags mtshan //
translated: That which is called sound is the supreme, the mantra of mantras.

original: sngags pas yid la sems na ni //
analyzed: sngags pas yid la sems na ni //
translated: If the mantrin keeps it in mind,

original: 'chi 'pho med pa'i gnas 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med pa'i gnas 'thob bo //
translated: he attains the state of no death and no transmigration.

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi yi ge'i sgra'i sgo nas bstan pa'i don de bzlas pa la sogs pa la mi ltos par bsgoms pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'chi 'pho med pa'i gnas 'thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi yi ge'i sgra'i sgo nas bstan pa'i don de bzlas pa la sogs pa la mi ltos par bsgoms pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'chi 'pho med pa'i gnas 'thob ces pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning taught through the sound of the mantra syllables. Without depending on repetition and so forth, by meditating, one attains the state of nirvana, which is the state of no death and no transmigration.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: Then again, the Lord of Secrets Vajrapani made a request to the bhagavat, saying...

original: thun mong ma lags pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar gyis gong du bshad pa'i don rnams phyag na rdo rjes go bar bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams spro ba skyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad bshad pa'i lhag ma rnams bshad par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma lags pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar gyis gong du bshad pa'i don rnams phyag na rdo rjes go bar bstan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams spro ba skyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad bshad pa'i lhag ma rnams bshad par gsol ba'o //
translated: ...he will possess the uncommon qualities. This shows that Vajrapani understood the meaning explained above, it encourages beings of the future, and it requests the explanation of the remaining mandala articles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar lags so zhes pa ni yi ga ka la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de dag gi don bsam du
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar lags so zhes pa ni yi ga ka la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de dag gi don bsam du
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has taught the Dharma discourse of the inconceivable method of the characteristics of secret mantra. BhagavƒÅn, it is amazing.

original: med pa de bdag gis go ste ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa'o //üîΩde ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags te zhes pa ni nyan thos gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa tsam dang rang sangs rgyas rgyu dang 'bras bu bshig nas ngag dgag pa tsam yin pas de bzhin nyid pa dmigs
analyzed: med pa de bdag gis go ste ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa'o // de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags te zhes pa ni nyan thos gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa tsam dang rang sangs rgyas rgyu dang 'bras bu bshig nas ngag dgag pa tsam yin pas de bzhin nyid pa dmigs
translated: I understand the meaning of those samƒÅdhis of emptiness, such as the syllable ka and so on, to be inconceivable. It is amazing.üîΩThat is not shared with all ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul can ma yin zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul can ma yin zhes pa'o ;
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas merely realize the selflessness of persons, and the pratyekabuddhas, having destroyed cause and effect, merely stop speech. Therefore, that is not the object of the samƒÅdhi that focuses on suchness.

original: / gang dag gsang sngags kyi tshul 'di la dad pa'i sems can de dag kyang thun mong ma lags pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams spro ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: / gang dag gsang sngags kyi tshul 'di la dad pa'i sems can de dag kyang thun mong ma lags pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams spro ba skyed pa'o //
translated: Those sentient beings who have faith in this way of the secret mantra will also come to possess uncommon good qualities. These [verses] inspire the beings of the future.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad kyi cho ga bshad du gsol zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bris zin nas mchod pa la sogs pa bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad kyi cho ga bshad du gsol zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bris zin nas mchod pa la sogs pa bya bar rigs te /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, please explain the ritual of the materials for the ma·πá·∏çala. Once the ma·πá·∏çala is drawn, it is suitable to perform the offerings and so forth.

original: de bas na mchod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang yid kyi mchod pa dang thal mo sbyar ba'i mchod pa dang / byams pa dang snying rje'i mchod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pas te /üîΩmchod pa rnam pa bzhi po de dang dkyil 'khor @342a * //
analyzed: de bas na mchod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang yid kyi mchod pa dang thal mo sbyar ba'i mchod pa dang / byams pa dang snying rje'i mchod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pas te / mchod pa rnam pa bzhi po de dang dkyil 'khor @342a * //
translated: Therefore, the samƒÅdhi of offering, mental offering, the offering of palms joined, the offering of love and compassion, and the offering of worldly incense, flowers, and so forth,üîΩthose four kinds of offerings, and the protection of the ma·πá·∏çala, and the request to the ma·πá·∏çala deities to remain,

original: bsrung ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams bzhugs su gsol ba rnams bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams bzhugs su gsol ba rnams bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: [all] that should be explained.

original: de rnams las kyang ma la ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs nas 'byung /
analyzed: de rnams las kyang ma la ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs nas 'byung /
translated: Among those, the great compassion for the mother arises in the context of the mandala of the origin of great compassion.

original: la la ni yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs nas 'byung //
analyzed: la la ni yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs nas 'byung //
translated: Some arise in the context of the mandala of the wheel of letters.
