original: la la ni gsang ba pa'i dkyil 'khor las 'byung ste /üîΩ'di nas mi 'byung ba 'og ma gnyis kyi skabs nas 'byung ba de yang skabs 'dir sbyar bar bya la /
analyzed: la la ni gsang ba pa'i dkyil 'khor las 'byung ste / 'di nas mi 'byung ba 'og ma gnyis kyi skabs nas 'byung ba de yang skabs 'dir sbyar bar bya la /
translated: Some arise in the context of the secret mandala.üîΩThat which does not arise here but arises in the context of the two below should be applied here.

original: 'di nas 'byung la 'og ma gnyis kyi nang nas mi 'byung ba de yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nas 'byung la 'og ma gnyis kyi nang nas mi 'byung ba de yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That which arises here but does not arise in the context of the two below should be applied in the same way.

original: de dag gi rim pa yang lha rnams dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlab pa la spyan drang mi dgos pa'i rigs pa la sogs pa bsdus pa'i don gyi nang dub shad pas 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa yang lha rnams dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlab pa la spyan drang mi dgos pa'i rigs pa la sogs pa bsdus pa'i don gyi nang dub shad pas 'dir ma smos so //
translated: The sequence of those is explained in the inner meaning of the summary, such as the logic that the deities do not need to be invited in the consecration of the mandala, and so on.

original: de nas sngags pa de yis su //
analyzed: de nas sngags pa de yis su //
translated: Then, the mantra practitionerüîΩ...

original: zhes pa nas /üîΩsems dpa' chen po phal rnams la //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / sems dpa' chen po phal rnams la //
translated: and so on, up to:üîΩThe great beings who are ordinary beings,üîΩüîΩand so on.

original: ya re dbul bar rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: ya re dbul bar rab tu bsgrags //
translated: is well known to be offered to the majority of the great beings.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis dri la sogs pa phyi'i mchod pa rnams bshad pa ste phyi'i mchod pa de rnams kyang sngags pa dmigs pa can gyis tshul bzhin ma byas na 'phags pa'i lha rnams 'khrug pa rim 'gyur na yang de'i 'khor phal pa rnams 'khrugs par 'gyur te
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis dri la sogs pa phyi'i mchod pa rnams bshad pa ste phyi'i mchod pa de rnams kyang sngags pa dmigs pa can gyis tshul bzhin ma byas na 'phags pa'i lha rnams 'khrug pa rim 'gyur na yang de'i 'khor phal pa rnams 'khrugs par 'gyur te
translated: If the mantric adept does not perform these outer offerings properly, the ordinary retinue of the noble deities will become disturbed, even though the deities themselves will not.üîΩAlthough they will not harm you immediately, they will not accomplish your intended purpose and will not be helpful.

original: 'phral du gnod mi byed kyang ji ltar bsams pa'i don rnams 'grub par mi byed cing phan 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes rgyud gzhan las 'byung bas mchod pa de rnams nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: 'phral du gnod mi byed kyang ji ltar bsams pa'i don rnams 'grub par mi byed cing phan 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes rgyud gzhan las 'byung bas mchod pa de rnams nan tan du bya'o //
translated: Since this is stated in other tantras, you should make these offerings with great care.

original: slob dpon zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas kyang gtso bor yid kyi mchod pa bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas kyang gtso bor yid kyi mchod pa bya ste /
translated: The master who is devoted to the profound and vast should primarily make mental offerings.

original: slob ma dmigs pa can rnams kyi yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir phyi'i mchod pa 'di rnams kyang ma chags pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma dmigs pa can rnams kyi yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir phyi'i mchod pa 'di rnams kyang ma chags pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: In order to accommodate the minds of the disciples who are the objects of your practice, you should also make these outer offerings without attachment.

original: mchod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang yid kyi mchod pa de dag ni yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor dang gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dag tu blta'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang yid kyi mchod pa de dag ni yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor dang gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dag tu blta'o //
translated: Those meditative stabilizations and mental offerings of worship should be seen in the ma·πá·∏çalas of the wheel of syllables and the secret ma·πá·∏çala.

original: me tog ser po dkar po dmar //üîΩyid du 'ong bas nan tan du //
analyzed: me tog ser po dkar po dmar // yid du 'ong bas nan tan du //
translated: Yellow, white, and red flowersüîΩare pleasing and should be offered

original: lha nams la ni mchod par bya //
analyzed: lha nams la ni mchod par bya //
translated: to the deities.

original: zhes pa nas /üîΩyid du 'ong zhing blta na sdug / bkra shis pa la sngags pa yis //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / yid du 'ong zhing blta na sdug / bkra shis pa la sngags pa yis //
translated: Up to:üîΩThe wise should make offerings with pleasing, beautiful,

original: mkhas pas nan tan mchod par bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas nan tan mchod par bya //
translated: auspicious flowers.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis me tog gi mchod pa rnams bshad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis me tog gi mchod pa rnams bshad de /
translated: This explains the offerings of flowers.

original: me tog ser po dkar po dmar //
analyzed: me tog ser po dkar po dmar //
translated: Yellow, white, and red flowers

original: zhes pa ni me tog gi rigs spyir smos pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni me tog gi rigs spyir smos pa yin la /
translated: are a general reference to the types of flowers.

original: padma'am yang na autpala //
analyzed: padma'am yang na autpala //
translated: Lotus and also utpala

original: zhes pa la sogs pa @342b ni spyir smos pa de dag nyid las so so'i ming smos pa'o //üîΩyid du 'ong zhing ni dri zhim pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa @342b ni spyir smos pa de dag nyid las so so'i ming smos pa'o // yid du 'ong zhing ni dri zhim pa'o //
translated: and so on are the individual names of those general references.üîΩPleasing means fragrant.

original: blta na sdug ces pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: blta na sdug ces pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs mdzes pa'o //
translated: Beautiful means beautiful color and shape.

original: bkra shis pa ni lha rnams mchod pa dang mi 'gal ba ste 'dir ni mdo tsam du smos kyi ming gis smos pa las gzhan pa yang yid du 'ong zhing bkra shis pas mchod par bya'o //üîΩtsandan na ta ka ra zhes pa nas //üîΩsna tshogs yid du 'ong ba 'bul //
analyzed: bkra shis pa ni lha rnams mchod pa dang mi 'gal ba ste 'dir ni mdo tsam du smos kyi ming gis smos pa las gzhan pa yang yid du 'ong zhing bkra shis pas mchod par bya'o // tsandan na ta ka ra zhes pa nas // sna tshogs yid du 'ong ba 'bul //
translated: Auspiciousness is not in conflict with the worship of the gods. Here, it is mentioned only briefly, but in addition to what is mentioned by name, one should worship with whatever is pleasing and auspicious.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis dri chab kyi mchod pa rnams te yid 'ong zhes pa ni 'dir ming gis smos pa las gzhan yang yid du 'ong ba dri zhim pa'i dri'i rigs rnams gang yang rung ba dbul lo zhes pa ste de rnams las kyang la la ni gcig
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis dri chab kyi mchod pa rnams te yid 'ong zhes pa ni 'dir ming gis smos pa las gzhan yang yid du 'ong ba dri zhim pa'i dri'i rigs rnams gang yang rung ba dbul lo zhes pa ste de rnams las kyang la la ni gcig
translated: From sandalwood, nut-meg, etc. up to various pleasing offerings are the offerings of perfume.  Pleasing means that in addition to what is mentioned by name here, one should offer whatever kind of pleasing, fragrant perfume one has.

original: pu sbyar / la la ni bsdus te sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pu sbyar / la la ni bsdus te sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: From among those, one should understand that some are to be applied singly, and some are to be applied in combination.

original: dri'i mchod pa dbul ba'i sngon du yang me tog gi mchod pa rnams dbul bar bya'o //üîΩaa ga ru'am sgron shing ngam //üîΩzhes pa nas /
analyzed: dri'i mchod pa dbul ba'i sngon du yang me tog gi mchod pa rnams dbul bar bya'o // aa ga ru'am sgron shing ngam // zhes pa nas /
translated: Also, before making the offering of perfume, one should make the offerings of flowers.

original: gzhan yang bdug spos sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdug spos sna tshogs pa //
translated: From agaru, or pine resin up to various pleasing offerings are the offerings of incense.  Pleasing means that in addition to what is mentioned by name here, one should offer whatever kind of pleasing, fragrant incense one has.

original: bkra shis 'jig rten rnam par grags //
analyzed: bkra shis 'jig rten rnam par grags //
translated: Auspicious, renowned in the world,

original: yid 'ong sngags pas cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: yid 'ong sngags pas cho ga bzhin //
translated: The mantra practitioner, pleasing, in accordance with the rite,

original: lha rnams la ni 'bul bar bya //
analyzed: lha rnams la ni 'bul bar bya //
translated: Should offer to the deities.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis bdug pa'i mchod pa rnams bshad de /üîΩde rnams kyang la la ni gcig pu sbyar /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis bdug pa'i mchod pa rnams bshad de / de rnams kyang la la ni gcig pu sbyar /
translated: This explains the incense offerings.üîΩSome of these are to be applied individually,

original: la la ni bsdus te sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: la la ni bsdus te sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: and some are to be applied in combination.

original: gzhan yang bdug spos sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdug spos sna tshogs pa //
translated: Moreover, various kinds of incense,

original: bkra shis 'jig rten rnam par grags //
analyzed: bkra shis 'jig rten rnam par grags //
translated: Auspicious, renowned in the world,

original: yid 'ong sngags pas cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: yid 'ong sngags pas cho ga bzhin //
translated: The mantra practitioner, pleasing, in accordance with the rite,

original: lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya //
analyzed: lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya //
translated: Should offer to the deities.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir ming gis smos pa las gzhan yang 'jig rten du grags pa'i bdug pa sna tshogs pa lha rnams mchod pa dang mi 'gal zhing rung ba yang dbul bar bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir ming gis smos pa las gzhan yang 'jig rten du grags pa'i bdug pa sna tshogs pa lha rnams mchod pa dang mi 'gal zhing rung ba yang dbul bar bya zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that in addition to those mentioned by name, one should also offer other kinds of incense renowned in the world, which are suitable and not prohibited for offering to the deities.

original: de nas gzhan yang sems dpa' che //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang sems dpa' che //
translated: Next, the great being

original: lha bshos las kyi cho ga nyon //
analyzed: lha bshos las kyi cho ga nyon //
translated: Should listen to the rite of the food offering.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: From there,

analyzed: zho dang 'o ma rgyas par dbul //
translated: One should offer curd, milk, and so forth extensively.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis lha bshos kyi mchod pa rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis lha bshos kyi mchod pa rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: The above passage explains the offering of sacrificial cakes.

original: de rnams kyang zas dang bza' ba dang bca' ba dang btung ba'i dngos por shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang zas dang bza' ba dang bca' ba dang btung ba'i dngos por shes par bya ste /

analyzed: de la zas ni 'o thug dang 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, eatables are rice gruel, boiled rice, and so on.

analyzed: bza' ba ni la du la sogs pa'o // bca' ba ni shing thog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Eatables are lentils and so on.üîΩEdibles are fruits and so on.

analyzed: btung ba ni zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Drinkables are curd, milk, and so on.

analyzed: rgyas par zhes pa ni de rnams bzang zhing mang du dbul ba'o //
translated: Extensive means that they are offered well and in abundance.üîΩThe offering of lamps is explained in the passage from

translated: Up to

analyzed: phyogs su gdugs dang ba dan rnams //

analyzed: ngos bzhi dang grva bzhi'i phyogs so sor kha dog dang mthun pa'i ba dan rnams nga sgreng bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should erect banners of corresponding colors in the four directions and four corners.

translated: Also, the excellent archways

original: zhes pa nas /üîΩmgrin pa ras kyis bcings pa rnams //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / mgrin pa ras kyis bcings pa rnams //
translated: and so on, up to:üîΩThose whose necks are bound with clothüîΩ

original: mkhas pas rnam par dgod par bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas rnam par dgod par bya //
translated: The wise should set them forth.üîΩ

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis bum pa rnams dbul ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis bum pa rnams dbul ba ste /
translated: With this verse, offer the vases.üîΩ

original: nag po la sogs pa'i skyon med cing gzhung las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams dbul lo //
analyzed: nag po la sogs pa'i skyon med cing gzhung las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams dbul lo //
translated: Offer those that are free of faults such as being black and that possess the characteristics mentioned in the scriptures.üîΩ

original: de rnams gsang ba spyi'i rgyud las 'byung ba bzhin du lha rnams so so la bsngos par mi bya bar spyir dgod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyis btab ste slob ma rnams dbang bskur ba'i tshe blugs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams gsang ba spyi'i rgyud las 'byung ba bzhin du lha rnams so so la bsngos par mi bya bar spyir dgod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyis btab ste slob ma rnams dbang bskur ba'i tshe blugs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These are to be set out generally, not assigned to each deity individually, as they occur in the General Tantra of the Guhyas, in order to consecrate the disciples with the mantra of the Bodhisattvas when they are sprinkled with the water from the vase at the time of the initiation.

original: lha yi gtso bo rnams la ni //
analyzed: lha yi gtso bo rnams la ni //
translated: To the chief deities

original: ras ni zung ra rung re dbul //
analyzed: ras ni zung ra rung re dbul //
translated: one should offer a pair of cloths.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rim pa gsum char gyi sgo khyud rnams kyi nang na bzhugs pa'i gtso bo rnams dang dbus na bdun pa zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la ras zung re re dbul lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rim pa gsum char gyi sgo khyud rnams kyi nang na bzhugs pa'i gtso bo rnams dang dbus na bdun pa zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la ras zung re re dbul lo zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that one should offer a pair of cloths to the chief deities who reside in the interior of the archways of all three ma·πá·∏çala levels, and to the Bhagavat Vairocana who resides in the center of the seventh ma·πá·∏çala.

original: thams cad la zung re mi 'byor na spyir zung gcig dbul bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zung re mi 'byor na spyir zung gcig dbul bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If one cannot afford a pair for each, one should understand that one pair is to be offered in general.

original: sems dpa' chen po phal rnams la //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po phal rnams la //
translated: To the other great beings

original: ya re dbul bar rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: ya re dbul bar rab tu bsgrags //
translated: one should offer a single cloth.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha phal pa rnams la ya re re dbul zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha phal pa rnams la ya re re dbul zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that one should offer a ya to each of the deities of the mandala.

original: thams cad la ya re ma 'byor na spyir ya gcig dbul bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la ya re ma 'byor na spyir ya gcig dbul bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If one does not have a ya for each, one should understand that one ya is offered in general.

original: de rnams kyang bum pa'i mgrin pa dkri ba ma gtogs pa'i ras gzhan yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bum pa'i mgrin pa dkri ba ma gtogs pa'i ras gzhan yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Those should be understood as being other than the cloth that is wrapped around the neck of the vase.

original: slob ma dkyil 'khor drung bkug ste //
analyzed: slob ma dkyil 'khor drung bkug ste //
translated: Having summoned the disciples in front of the mandala,

original: sngags pas chu yi bsang gtong byas //
analyzed: sngags pas chu yi bsang gtong byas //
translated: the mantrin should perform the water-pouring purification.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: slob ma sdig dang brla ba kun //
analyzed: slob ma sdig dang brla ba kun //
translated: All the disciples are purified of all sins and obscurations.

original: de ltar legs par btsud nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar legs par btsud nas ni //
translated: Having thus properly admitted them,

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du gzung ba'i chog shad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du gzung ba'i chog shad de /
translated: This passage explains the rite of accepting the disciples into the mandala.

original: de yang sngar mchod pa'i tshe slob dpon las kyi rdo rje sems @343b dpar bsgyur ba las slob ma dkyil 'khor du 'dzud pa'i tshe 'og nas 'byung ba'i slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin du bsgyur te /
analyzed: de yang sngar mchod pa'i tshe slob dpon las kyi rdo rje sems @343b dpar bsgyur ba las slob ma dkyil 'khor du 'dzud pa'i tshe 'og nas 'byung ba'i slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin du bsgyur te /
translated: Moreover, when previously offering, the master transforms into Karma-Vajrasattva. When admitting the disciples into the mandala, one transforms into the master‚Äôs concentration that will be explained below.

original: thog ma nyid du dkyil 'khor gyi phyir ra'i sgor slob ma rnams kyi bgegs bsal ba'i phyir khams gsum rnam par rgyal bas bsngags pa'i bum pa'i chus gtor te /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du dkyil 'khor gyi phyir ra'i sgor slob ma rnams kyi bgegs bsal ba'i phyir khams gsum rnam par rgyal bas bsngags pa'i bum pa'i chus gtor te /
translated: First, in order to remove the obstacles of the disciples outside the mandala, sprinkle them with the water of the vase praised by the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: slob ma rnams kyi gdong g-yogs kyi ras la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings nas dam tshig gsum gyi sngags lan gsum bzlas pas slob ma'i gdong g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyi gdong g-yogs kyi ras la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings nas dam tshig gsum gyi sngags lan gsum bzlas pas slob ma'i gdong g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: Then, having formed the seal of the three vows on the cloth blindfold of the disciples, the disciples should be blindfolded by reciting the three-o·πÉ mantra three times.

original: de nas slob ma'i lag par dri dang me tog byin la byang chub kyi sems bskyed de /üîΩde nas chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis rlob bo /
analyzed: de nas slob ma'i lag par dri dang me tog byin la byang chub kyi sems bskyed de / de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis rlob bo /
translated: Then, having given them scent and flowers, arouse the mind of awakening in them.üîΩThen, consecrate the realm of phenomena with the seal and mantra of the realm of phenomena.

original: de nas chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya dang sngags dang rdo rje go cha'i sngags kyis slob ma de rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de nas chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya dang sngags dang rdo rje go cha'i sngags kyis slob ma de rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Then, having blessed that disciple as Vajrasattva with the seal and mantra of the wheel of Dharma and the mantra of the vajra armor,

original: spyi bor chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ram kha dog dkar po klad kor dang bcas pa 'bar ba can bsams te /
analyzed: spyi bor chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ram kha dog dkar po klad kor dang bcas pa 'bar ba can bsams te /
translated: On the crown of his head he should imagine the letter ra·πÉ of the sphere of phenomena, white in color and blazing with a dot.

original: de nas dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings nas de'i sngags zlos su bcug la me tog 'dor du gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings nas de'i sngags zlos su bcug la me tog 'dor du gzhug go //
translated: Then, having formed the seal of the three sacred commitments, he should make him recite the mantra and throw the flower.

original: de nas me tog gang du bab pa'i lha de sngags pas slob ma de la sbyin te /
analyzed: de nas me tog gang du bab pa'i lha de sngags pas slob ma de la sbyin te /
translated: Then, the deity on which the flower falls, that deity the mantrin should give to that disciple.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor lan gsum du bskor du gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor lan gsum du bskor du gzhug go //
translated: Then, he should make him circumambulate the ma·πá·∏çala three times.

original: de rnams ni dkyil 'khor du gzud pa'i cho ga'i rim pa mdor bshad pa'o ;
analyzed: de rnams ni dkyil 'khor du gzud pa'i cho ga'i rim pa mdor bshad pa'o ;
translated: Those are the steps of the rite of inducting into the ma·πá·∏çala, explained in brief.

original: / yan lag so sor bshad pa ni /
analyzed: / yan lag so sor bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the individual branches:

original: byang chub sems kyang 'dzin du gzhug / ces pa ston pa byang chub kyi sems 'dzin du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyang 'dzin du gzhug / ces pa ston pa byang chub kyi sems 'dzin du gzhug pa'o //
translated: He should also cause him to take up the thought of awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dran byas nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dran byas nas //
translated: Having recalled the TathƒÅgata,

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag la dgongs su gsol zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag la dgongs su gsol zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: he should say, ‚ÄúMay the buddhas and bodhisattvas pay attention to me!‚Äù

original: smon pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /üîΩbdag med 'di zhes bgyi bas dus 'di nas bzung ste nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam
analyzed: smon pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol / bdag med 'di zhes bgyi bas dus 'di nas bzung ste nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me.üîΩFrom now until I reach the essence of enlightenment, just as the blessed buddhas and bodhisattvas generated the thought of awakening, which is emptiness by nature, in enlightenment, having abandoned the aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: par spangs pa rang gi sems gdong ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: par spangs pa rang gi sems gdong ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: so too I also will generate the thought of awakening.

original: de nas @344a * //
analyzed: de nas @344a * //
translated: Then,

original: rgyal ba'i rigs dge la //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i rigs dge la //
translated: in the virtuous lineage of the victors,

original: thams cad rab tu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad rab tu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: all will be fully generated.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar smon pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas sa bon btab pa'i sgo nas rgyal ba'i rigs dge bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar smon pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas sa bon btab pa'i sgo nas rgyal ba'i rigs dge bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by generating the aspiration thought of enlightenment, one plants the seed and is born into the virtuous family of the Victorious One.

original: rgyal ba'i rigs zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i rigs zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The family of the Victorious One is endowed with method and wisdom.

original: de la shes rab ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Of these, wisdom is the perfection of wisdom, the mother of all dharmas, the nature of emptiness.

original: thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: Method is the perfections of generosity and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de las byung bas na de ni rgyal ba'i rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de las byung bas na de ni rgyal ba'i rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the Tathagatas also arise from that, it is called the family of the Victorious One.

original: chos kyi dbyings las byung ba yi //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las byung ba yi //
translated: The seal of those who arise from the dharmadhatu

original: phyag rgya de dag rnams la bcing //
analyzed: phyag rgya de dag rnams la bcing //
translated: is impressed upon them.

original: zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: This is the generation of the entering thought of enlightenment and the abiding thought of enlightenment.

original: chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya des slob ma de stong pa nyid du byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya des slob ma de stong pa nyid du byin gyis brlab po //
translated: By that mantra and seal of the emptiness of the dharma-element, the disciple is consecrated in emptiness.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo 'ang bcings nas ni //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo 'ang bcings nas ni //
translated: Having bound the dharma-wheel,

original: rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab //
translated: one is consecrated as Vajrasattva.

original: ces pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs nas slar kun rdzob kyis go nas sems can rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo'i sngags dang phyag rgyas rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs nas slar kun rdzob kyis go nas sems can rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo'i sngags dang phyag rgyas rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur ro //
translated: Having thus realized the nature of emptiness, one again becomes aware of the conventional, and in order to turn the wheel of the Dharma for the sake of sentient beings, one transforms into the body of Vajrasattva by means of the mantra and seal of the dharma-wheel.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni rang gi sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar brtan pa cis kyang zil gyis mi non pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni rang gi sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar brtan pa cis kyang zil gyis mi non pa ste /
translated: Vajrasattva is one's own mind, firm like a vajra, not overcome by anything.

original: de yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa dbu rgyan dang ldan zhing rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa dbu rgyan dang ldan zhing rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i sku'o //
translated: Moreover, it is seated in the middle of a moon-disk, and the moon-disk is endowed with a halo, and the body is adorned with a crown and various ornaments.

original: de'i snying gar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin can bsam par bya'o //üîΩde nas sangs rgyas kun gyi ni //
analyzed: de'i snying gar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin can bsam par bya'o // de nas sangs rgyas kun gyi ni //
translated: At his heart one should imagine a five-pronged vajra standing on a moon-disk, having the nature of the five gnoses.

original: dam tshig sdom brtson can gyis bcing //
analyzed: dam tshig sdom brtson can gyis bcing //
translated: Then, the one who is diligent in the vow of the pledge of all the BuddhasüîΩshould bind it.

original: de nas sngags kyi cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: de nas sngags kyi cho ga bzhin //
translated: Then, according to the rite of the mantra,

original: ras la lan gsum gdab par bya //
analyzed: ras la lan gsum gdab par bya //
translated: one should sprinkle the cloth with water three times.

original: zhes pa ni slob dpon gyis gdong dgab pa'i ras la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis gdab ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon gyis gdong dgab pa'i ras la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya dang sngags kyis gdab ste /
translated: This is the master sprinkling the cloth that covers the face with the seal and mantra of the three pledges.

original: de yang skabs 'dir bshad mod kyi las 'di rnams dang por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang skabs 'dir bshad mod kyi las 'di rnams dang por shes par bya'o //
translated: Although this is explained in this context, one should know these rites at the beginning.

original: de dag gi gdong yang dag pa //
analyzed: de dag gi gdong yang dag pa //
translated: Their faces are well-covered

original: ces pa ni dam tshig gis btab pa'i ras des slob ma de rnams kyi gdong dag par bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni dam tshig gis btab pa'i ras des slob ma de rnams kyi gdong dag par bya ste /
translated: with that cloth sealed by the pledge.

original: gdong dgab pa de yang de dag sngar tha mal gyi mig tu 'dug pa las dam tshig gi sngags dang @344b phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs pas bkag nas ye shes kyi mig tu bsgyur bar gyur te ye shes kyi mig de phye nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku
analyzed: gdong dgab pa de yang de dag sngar tha mal gyi mig tu 'dug pa las dam tshig gi sngags dang @344b phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs pas bkag nas ye shes kyi mig tu bsgyur bar gyur te ye shes kyi mig de phye nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku
translated: Having opened the eye of pristine awareness, the body of the Bhagavat

original: mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is revealed to them, the mandala of the inexhaustible vajra ornament.

original: snying rjer gyur pa'i yid kyis su //
analyzed: snying rjer gyur pa'i yid kyis su //
translated: With a mind full of compassion

original: zhes pa ni snying rje dang ldan pas bya ba yin gyis de khe dang bkur sti'i phyir ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying rje dang ldan pas bya ba yin gyis de khe dang bkur sti'i phyir ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is to be done with compassion, not for the sake of profit and honor.

original: dam tshig lan gsum bzlas nas ni //
analyzed: dam tshig lan gsum bzlas nas ni //
translated: Having repeated the pledge three times

original: zhes pa ni me tog 'dor du gzhug ces pa dang sbyar te dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings pa sngags kyang lan gsum bzlas te me tog 'dor du gzhug go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me tog 'dor du gzhug ces pa dang sbyar te dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings pa sngags kyang lan gsum bzlas te me tog 'dor du gzhug go //
translated: This is to be applied with ‚Äúhaving cast the flower.‚Äù Having formed the seal of the three pledges and repeated the mantra three times, one should have them cast the flower.

original: dam tshig gsum zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa dang gsung mi zad pa dang thugs mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: dam tshig gsum zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi zad pa dang gsung mi zad pa dang thugs mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The three pledges are the mandala of the ornament of the inexhaustible body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat.

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs su gyur pa ni dam tshig gi sngags dang phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs su gyur pa ni dam tshig gi sngags dang phyag rgya ste /
translated: The pledge mantra and seal are the blessing of that.

original: phyag rgya bcings shing de'i sngags lan gsum bzlas na sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya bcings shing de'i sngags lan gsum bzlas na sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one binds the seal and recites the mantra three times, one will see the inexhaustible ornament of the vajra body and so forth.

original: de bas na sngags pa rtag tu zlos pa la sogs pa byed pa'i tshe yang dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcing ba de'i phyir du yin la /
analyzed: de bas na sngags pa rtag tu zlos pa la sogs pa byed pa'i tshe yang dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcing ba de'i phyir du yin la /
translated: Therefore, when the mantrin always recites and so forth, he binds the seal of the three pledges for that purpose.

original: dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings te sngags lan gsum du bzlas na dam tshig nyams pa la sgos pa slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya bcings te sngags lan gsum du bzlas na dam tshig nyams pa la sgos pa slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one binds the seal of the three pledges and recites the mantra three times, one will revive the pledge that has been damaged.

original: spyi bor yi ge ra zhes pa /
analyzed: spyi bor yi ge ra zhes pa /
translated: The syllable ra is on the crown,

original: klad kyi 'khor bcas brjid dang ldan //
analyzed: klad kyi 'khor bcas brjid dang ldan //
translated: with the surrounding brain, majestic,

original: 'bar ba'i phreng ba rnam par 'phro //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng ba rnam par 'phro //
translated: radiating a garland of flames.

original: zla ba 'char ka lta bu yi //
analyzed: zla ba 'char ka lta bu yi //
translated: One should place the white syllable

original: kha dog dkar po gzhag par bya //
analyzed: kha dog dkar po gzhag par bya //
translated: like the rising moon.

original: zhes pa ni slob ma'i spyi bor yi ge ra chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes bsam ste ra ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma'i spyi bor yi ge ra chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes bsam ste ra ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The syllable ra is the nature free from the obscurations of knowables and afflictions.

original: klad kor gzhag pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: klad kor gzhag pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The dot is the nature of emptiness.

original: 'bar ba'i phreng ba dang bcas pa ni rgyu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng ba dang bcas pa ni rgyu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The garland of flames is the nature of the causal gnosis.

original: zla ba 'char ka lta bu ni zla ba 'char ba'i tshe rang bzhin dkar ba la cung zad rtsa dmar bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba 'char ka lta bu ni zla ba 'char ba'i tshe rang bzhin dkar ba la cung zad rtsa dmar bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Like the rising moon, when the moon rises, its nature is white with a slight red tinge.

original: dkar ba ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: dkar ba ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
translated: White is natural purity.

original: rtsa dmar ba ni sems cang yi don la chags pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa dmar ba ni sems cang yi don la chags pa'o //
translated: The red tinge is attachment to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: skyob pa kun gyi spyan sngar ni //
analyzed: skyob pa kun gyi spyan sngar ni //
translated: In the presence of all the protectors,

original: de nas me tog 'dor du gzhug / me tog gang la bab pa de //
analyzed: de nas me tog 'dor du gzhug / me tog gang la bab pa de //
translated: then one should make them cast the flower.

original: sngags pas de la sbyin par bya //
analyzed: sngags pas de la sbyin par bya //
translated: The mantra practitioner should give it to the oneüîΩon whom the flower falls.

original: zhes pa ni sngon dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs shing lha ma mnos pa'am /üîΩdkyil 'khor du zhugs shing lham mnos sam /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs shing lha ma mnos pa'am / dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing lham mnos sam /
translated: This is for those who have not previously entered the ma·πá·∏çala and have not received the deity,üîΩor for those who have entered the ma·πá·∏çala and received the deity,

original: lha mnos te btang ba rnams gdod lha mnos @345a * //
analyzed: lha mnos te btang ba rnams gdod lha mnos @345a * //
translated: or for those who have received the deity but have been dismissed.

original: par bya na me tog gdod de ltar dor bar bya la /
analyzed: par bya na me tog gdod de ltar dor bar bya la /
translated: If they are to receive the deity now, the flower should be cast in that way.

original: de ltar lha mnos zin te gdod nod mi dgos na gdong g-yogs bkrol la me tog de dag gi lha'am bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la bul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lha mnos zin te gdod nod mi dgos na gdong g-yogs bkrol la me tog de dag gi lha'am bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la bul bar bya ste /
translated: If they have already received the deity and do not need to receive it again, the blindfold should be removed and those flowers should be offered to the deity or to BhagavƒÅn Vairocana.

original: de dag kyang zhib tu ni bsdus pa'i don du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhib tu ni bsdus pa'i don du bshad zin to //
translated: Those have been explained in detail in the Condensed Meaning.

original: me tog dor nas lha gang la bab pa de'i cha brtag pa yang gsang ba spyi'i rgyud kyi nang du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dor nas lha gang la bab pa de'i cha brtag pa yang gsang ba spyi'i rgyud kyi nang du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The examination of the portion of the deity upon whom the flower falls should be done according to the General Tantra of Secrets.

original: dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo drung du //üîΩsgo khyud kyi ni dbus kyi cha //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo drung du // sgo khyud kyi ni dbus kyi cha //
translated: In front of the door of the first ma·πá·∏çala,üîΩin the center of the door frame,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni sgo gnyis kyi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni sgo gnyis kyi //
translated: between the two doors of the ma·πá·∏çala,

original: bar du slob ma gzung bar bya //
analyzed: bar du slob ma gzung bar bya //
translated: the disciple should be seized.üîΩAll the rites are performed

original: der gnas pa la cho ga kun //
analyzed: der gnas pa la cho ga kun //
translated: for one who abides there.

original: rim pa bzhin du legs par bya //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du legs par bya //
translated: One should do them in order.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gsum pa'i sgo khyud kyi dbus su slob ma der gzung de der gnas nas gong du smos pa'i las thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gsum pa'i sgo khyud kyi dbus su slob ma der gzung de der gnas nas gong du smos pa'i las thams cad bya ste /
translated: This is in the center of the door-threshold of the third mandala. The disciple is held there, and while remaining there, one should do all the actions mentioned above.

original: sgo khar slob ma la chus gdab pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sgo khar slob ma la chus gdab pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for sprinkling the disciple with water at the door,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi nang du ma zhugs par sgo gnas las de rnams bya ba dang lha rnams la me tog 'dor ba yang sgo nas bor ba na nang du 'bab par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi nang du ma zhugs par sgo gnas las de rnams bya ba dang lha rnams la me tog 'dor ba yang sgo nas bor ba na nang du 'bab par 'gyur gyi /
translated: one should do those actions while standing at the door, without entering the mandala. Also, when one throws flowers to the deities, if one throws them from the door, they will fall inside.

original: nang du zhugs te bor na lha kha cig rgyab tu las par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nang du zhugs te bor na lha kha cig rgyab tu las par 'gyur la /
translated: If one enters inside and throws them, some deities will be behind one.

original: bdag dbus su zhugs te bor na me tog phyi rol du bab par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dbus su zhugs te bor na me tog phyi rol du bab par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if one enters in the center and throws them, the flowers will fall outside.

original: gnyis su na gong du /
analyzed: gnyis su na gong du /
translated: On the other hand, above it says,

original: skyob pa kun gyi spyan sngar ni //
analyzed: skyob pa kun gyi spyan sngar ni //
translated: In the presence of all the protectors.

original: zhes kyang 'byung bas bdag nang du zhugs nas kha cig gi spyan sngar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes kyang 'byung bas bdag nang du zhugs nas kha cig gi spyan sngar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: So if one enters inside, some deities will not be present.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams kha cig la rgyab kyis blta ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams kha cig la rgyab kyis blta ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be inappropriate for some of those bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas to turn their backs.

original: gsum du na 'di ni chos kyir gyal po'i 'khor yin pas thog ma nas nang du zhugs na ko long du 'gyur te rgyal chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum du na 'di ni chos kyir gyal po'i 'khor yin pas thog ma nas nang du zhugs na ko long du 'gyur te rgyal chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Third, since this is the retinue of the king of the Dharma, if they were to enter from the beginning, it would be offensive, because it would contradict the king's Dharma.

original: slob ma sdig dang bral ba kun //
analyzed: slob ma sdig dang bral ba kun //
translated: All disciples free from negativity

original: de ltar legs par btsun nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar legs par btsun nas ni //
translated: Having thus properly invited them,

original: de dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: for the sake of pacifying them,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: sbyin sreg rjes la sngags pa yis //
analyzed: sbyin sreg rjes la sngags pa yis //
translated: after the fire offering, the mantrin

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis dkyil 'khor du btsud pa'i slob ma de dag zhi bar bya ba'i sbyin sreg bya ste slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas sdig pa rnams byang zhing rgyud dag pa des bcom ldan 'das kyis ku mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan la sogs
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis dkyil 'khor du btsud pa'i slob ma de dag zhi bar bya ba'i sbyin sreg bya ste slob ma rnams dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas sdig pa rnams byang zhing rgyud dag pa des bcom ldan 'das kyis ku mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan la sogs
translated: This passage explains that the disciples who have entered the ma·πá·∏çala should perform the fire offering for pacification. By the disciples entering the ma·πá·∏çala, their negativities are purified and their continuums become pure. By that, the Blessed One's inexhaustible vajra ornaments and so forth

original: pa la sbyin sreg gi sgo nas yon phul na bsod nams 'phel te sdig pa 'byang bas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la sbyin sreg gi sgo nas yon phul na bsod nams 'phel te sdig pa 'byang bas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers a gift by way of a burnt offering, merit increases and sin is purified, so it will be pacified.

original: de'i rim pa yang thog mar snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun rol /
analyzed: de'i rim pa yang thog mar snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun rol /
translated: The procedure for that is as follows: First, in front of the mandala of the essence,

original: dkyil 'khor bar ma'i sgo'i phyi rim /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bar ma'i sgo'i phyi rim /
translated: outside the door of the middle mandala,

original: @345b gsum pa'i nang rol du me thab khru gang ba bya'o //
analyzed: @345b gsum pa'i nang rol du me thab khru gang ba bya'o //
translated: inside the third, one should make a hearth one cubit in size.

original: de ste dkyil 'khor chung nas nang du mi shong na dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rim gyi sgo gar bya'o //
analyzed: de ste dkyil 'khor chung nas nang du mi shong na dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rim gyi sgo gar bya'o //
translated: If the mandala is small and it will not fit inside, then it should be outside the door of the mandala.

original: khang thog la sogs par brkor mi rung na tshon dmar pos thab bri bar bya la /
analyzed: khang thog la sogs par brkor mi rung na tshon dmar pos thab bri bar bya la /
translated: If it is not suitable to dig into the roof of the house, and so on, one should draw the hearth with red dye.

original: de nas thab de'i tha mar lho phyogs nas brtsams te ku sha g-yas skor du dgras zhing gcig gi rtsa bas gcig gi rtse mo non par byas te bskor ro //
analyzed: de nas thab de'i tha mar lho phyogs nas brtsams te ku sha g-yas skor du dgras zhing gcig gi rtsa bas gcig gi rtse mo non par byas te bskor ro //
translated: Then, beginning from the south, one should arrange the ku≈õa grass in a clockwise circle around the edge of the hearth, with the tip of each blade overlapping the base of the next.

original: de nas khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i sngags kyis btab pa'i dri'i chu gtor la /
analyzed: de nas khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i sngags kyis btab pa'i dri'i chu gtor la /
translated: Then, having sprinkled water perfumed with the fragrance, enchanted with the mantra of Trailokyavijaya,

original: de nas thab der 'jig rten pa'i mi mri ta zhes bya ba las thams cad byed pa mgrin pa ring la spu can kha dog kham par 'dug pa me tog gcig thab der bor la me de byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thab der 'jig rten pa'i mi mri ta zhes bya ba las thams cad byed pa mgrin pa ring la spu can kha dog kham par 'dug pa me tog gcig thab der bor la me de byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then, in that hearth, one should consecrate the fire of the worldly fire god called Manmatha, who does all the work, has a long neck, is hairy, and is the color of a pigeon, by throwing a flower into that hearth.

original: de nas me lha de la zhal bsil dang gang ba'i sbyin sreg gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du byin nas de nyid du 'dar ba'i rang bzhin dub zhag la /
analyzed: de nas me lha de la zhal bsil dang gang ba'i sbyin sreg gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du byin nas de nyid du 'dar ba'i rang bzhin dub zhag la /
translated: Then, having offered the water for the face and the filling oblation to that fire god as it is in the scripture, one should rest for a day in that very place with a nature of trembling.

original: de nas thab der me tog gcig bor nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi ba'i mer byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de nas thab der me tog gcig bor nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi ba'i mer byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Then, having thrown a flower into that hearth, one should consecrate it as the supramundane fire of peace.

original: zhal bsil dang gang ba'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du byas nas slob ma re re'i phyir yang sbyin sreg lan nyi shu rtsag cig re slob ma'i lag pa g-yas pa'i mthe bon nas slob dpon gyi lag pa g-yon pas bzung ste bya'o //
analyzed: zhal bsil dang gang ba'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du byas nas slob ma re re'i phyir yang sbyin sreg lan nyi shu rtsag cig re slob ma'i lag pa g-yas pa'i mthe bon nas slob dpon gyi lag pa g-yon pas bzung ste bya'o //
translated: Having performed the water for the face, the filling oblation, and so forth as before, one should perform twenty-one oblations for each disciple, holding the right thumb of the disciple with the left hand of the master.

original: 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the concise meaning.

original: yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste sdig dang bral ba kun zhes pa ni slob ma de rnams dkyil 'khor du gzhug par rtsom pa na gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sgos pa dang / dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste sdig dang bral ba kun zhes pa ni slob ma de rnams dkyil 'khor du gzhug par rtsom pa na gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sgos pa dang / dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: The meaning of the branches should be explained. ‚ÄúAll those free from sin‚Äù means that when those disciples are about to enter the ma·πá·∏çala, they are made to go for refuge to the Three Jewels, and when they enter the ma·πá·∏çala, they generate the mind of awakening.

original: zhugs nas kyang phyis sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes gsum ga dge ste sdig pa dang bral ba'o //üîΩsbyin sreg cho ga bzhin du bya //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang phyis sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes gsum ga dge ste sdig pa dang bral ba'o // sbyin sreg cho ga bzhin du bya //
translated: Even after entering, when they later practice the conduct of mantra, they are virtuous in all three stages of the preliminaries, main part, and conclusion, being free from sin.

original: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi cho ga gzhung las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du bya ba ste 'og nas 'byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi cho ga gzhung las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du bya ba ste 'og nas 'byung bar blta'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should perform the homa ritual as prescribed‚Äù means that one should perform the homa ritual as taught in the scriptures, as will be explained below.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ni mdun //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi ni mdun //
translated: In front of the ma·πá·∏çala of the essence,

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i rgyab rol gyi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i rgyab rol gyi //
translated: behind the second ma·πá·∏çala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni dbus kyi char //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni dbus kyi char //
translated: in the center of the ma·πá·∏çala,

original: ma g-yengs pa yi sems kyis bya //
analyzed: ma g-yengs pa yi sems kyis bya //
translated: one should perform [the homa] with an undistracted mind.

original: me thab khru gang tsam gyi ni //
analyzed: me thab khru gang tsam gyi ni //
translated: The hearth should be one cubit in size,

original: tshad du rab tu bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: tshad du rab tu bsgrags pa yin //
translated: this is declared to be the measure.

original: zhes pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained above.

original: 'dir khru gang pa 'ba' zhig gsungs kyi zlum po'am gru bzhir bya ba ma smos kyang zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i thab ji ltar grags pa la bya ste /üîΩskabs 'dir ni zhi ba'i las yin @346a * //
analyzed: 'dir khru gang pa 'ba' zhig gsungs kyi zlum po'am gru bzhir bya ba ma smos kyang zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i thab ji ltar grags pa la bya ste / skabs 'dir ni zhi ba'i las yin @346a * //
translated: Here, only one cubit is mentioned, but although it is not stated whether it should be round or square, it should be done according to the known hearth for pacifying and increasing.

original: pas zlum por 'os so //
analyzed: pas zlum por 'os so //
translated: Here, since it is the rite of pacifying, it is suitable to be round.

original: yang na zhi ba dang rgyas pa gnyis ka'i bzhi mthun na gru bzhi yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang na zhi ba dang rgyas pa gnyis ka'i bzhi mthun na gru bzhi yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, if the four sides are equal in both pacifying and increasing, there is no fault in making it square.

original: kha ran so bzhi'i tshad dub ya //
analyzed: kha ran so bzhi'i tshad dub ya //
translated: The measure of the rim is one-fourth.

original: zhes pa ni thab gru bzhi'i ni kha ran yang gru bzhir bya la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thab gru bzhi'i ni kha ran yang gru bzhir bya la /
translated: This means that the rim of the square hearth should be square,

original: thab zlum po la kha ran yang zlum por bya'o //
analyzed: thab zlum po la kha ran yang zlum por bya'o //
translated: and the rim of the round hearth should be round.üîΩIn the middle, one should draw a vajra.

original: dbus su rdo rje rab tu brtag / ces pa ni ye shes lnga'i phyag rgyar gyur pa rdo rje rtse lnga pa bri'o //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje rab tu brtag / ces pa ni ye shes lnga'i phyag rgyar gyur pa rdo rje rtse lnga pa bri'o //
translated: This means that one should draw a five-pronged vajra, which is the seal of the five wisdoms.

original: de nas sngags pa'i g-yas logs su //
analyzed: de nas sngags pa'i g-yas logs su //
translated: Then, to the right of the mantra practitioner,

original: sbyin sreg gi nyo byad gzhag / g-yon gyi phyogs su slob ma rnams //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi nyo byad gzhag / g-yon gyi phyogs su slob ma rnams //
translated: one should place the articles for the fire offering, and to the left, the disciples.

original: zhes pa ni bsreg par bya ba'i rdzas rnams sngags pa'i g-yas su gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsreg par bya ba'i rdzas rnams sngags pa'i g-yas su gzhag go //
translated: This is the placement of the substances to be burned to the right of the mantrin.

original: g-yon du slob ma bkod pa na slob dpon slob ma'i g-yas su 'bab ste /
analyzed: g-yon du slob ma bkod pa na slob dpon slob ma'i g-yas su 'bab ste /
translated: When the disciple is placed to the left, the master falls to the right of the disciple.

original: slob dpon des slob ma la phan 'dogs pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon des slob ma la phan 'dogs pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in accordance with the benefitting of the disciple by the master.üîΩOne should cause them to sit in the squatting position.

original: tsog tsog por ni 'khod du gzhug / ces pa ni cho ga'i las rnams ma zin gyi bar du bag phag ste mi 'dug pa'am gus pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tsog tsog por ni 'khod du gzhug / ces pa ni cho ga'i las rnams ma zin gyi bar du bag phag ste mi 'dug pa'am gus pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching that one should not sit in a relaxed or disrespectful manner until the ritual actions are completed.

original: sdom brtson bdag nyid sa steng du //
analyzed: sdom brtson bdag nyid sa steng du //
translated: The one who is diligent in the vows should sit on a seatüîΩof ku≈õa grass spread on the ground.

original: ku sha bting ba'i stan la 'dug / ces pa ni slob dpon rtsva ku sha steng du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: ku sha bting ba'i stan la 'dug / ces pa ni slob dpon rtsva ku sha steng du 'dug pa'o //
translated: This is the master sitting on ku≈õa grass.

original: yang na tshon rtsi dmar po mchog / ces pa nas /
analyzed: yang na tshon rtsi dmar po mchog / ces pa nas /
translated: Or, the supreme red dye

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig sbyin sreg bya //
translated: is the twenty-one burnt offerings.

original: zhes pa'i bar ni go rims bzhin du gong dub shad zin la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar ni go rims bzhin du gong dub shad zin la /
translated: This is the sequence as previously explained.

original: yid ni mnyam par bzhag nas su //
analyzed: yid ni mnyam par bzhag nas su //
translated: With the mind in equipoise

original: zhes pa ni zhi ba'i las la byams pa'i dang tshul bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhi ba'i las la byams pa'i dang tshul bya'o //
translated: is the loving attitude for the pacifying activity.

original: sbyin sreg rjes la sngags pa yis //
analyzed: sbyin sreg rjes la sngags pa yis //
translated: After the fire sacrifice, the mantrin

original: slob ma rnams la yon bslang ba //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la yon bslang ba //
translated: should request gifts from the disciples.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: sangs rgyas bsngags pa'i dge 'dun la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsngags pa'i dge 'dun la //
translated: To the Sangha praised by the Buddha,

original: ci nus par ni mchod bstod bya //
analyzed: ci nus par ni mchod bstod bya //
translated: offer praise and worship as much as possible.

original: zhes pa'i bar ni sdig pa dang bral ba'i slob ma de dag slob dpon gyis bsod nams kyi zhing dam pa la sbyin pa byed du gzhug ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar ni sdig pa dang bral ba'i slob ma de dag slob dpon gyis bsod nams kyi zhing dam pa la sbyin pa byed du gzhug ste /
translated: This is urging the disciples who are free from sin to make offerings to the excellent field of merit by the master.

original: mchog tu phan 'dogs pa'i slob dpon de la slob ma rnams kyis gus par yon phul na bsod nams mchog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir gser dang dngul dang rin po che la sogs pa dbul bar bya'o zhes bskul ma btab bo //
analyzed: mchog tu phan 'dogs pa'i slob dpon de la slob ma rnams kyis gus par yon phul na bsod nams mchog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir gser dang dngul dang rin po che la sogs pa dbul bar bya'o zhes bskul ma btab bo //
translated: If the disciples respectfully offer gifts to the master who is extremely helpful, it becomes supreme merit, so they should offer gold, silver, jewels, and so on.

original: de ltar slob dpon la yon phul nas kyang 'phags pa'i dge 'dun ni sbyin pa'i gnas dam pa yin pas 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la yon 'bul ba dang chos ston gsol bar bya ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon la yon phul nas kyang 'phags pa'i dge 'dun ni sbyin pa'i gnas dam pa yin pas 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la yon 'bul ba dang chos ston gsol bar bya ba yang /
translated: Having offered gifts to the master in that way, since the noble Sangha is the excellent field of merit, they should offer gifts to the noble Sangha and request Dharma teachings.

original: 'di ni bsod nams zhig yin zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams zhig yin zhes //
translated: This is merit.

original: sems can kun gyi dong yi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dong yi phyir //
translated: For the sake of the welfare of all sentient beings,

original: skyob pa rnams ni nan gyis gsungs //
analyzed: skyob pa rnams ni nan gyis gsungs //
translated: the protectors have taught this forcefully.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs @346b pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs @346b pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag nar do rje la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag nar do rje la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the BhagavƒÅn Vairocana said to the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva VajrapƒÅ·πái:

original: sems dpa' chen po dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po dbang bskur ba //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat being, the empowerment

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa //
translated: was explained by the buddhas of the past.

original: rgyas pa ru ni bshad par bya //
analyzed: rgyas pa ru ni bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain it extensively.

original: yid gcig bsdus te legs par nyon //
analyzed: yid gcig bsdus te legs par nyon //
translated: Listen with a focused mind.üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: And so on, up to:

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun yang //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun yang //
translated: All those vajra holders

original: khyod la rnam pa kun du srung //
analyzed: khyod la rnam pa kun du srung //
translated: will always protect you.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis slob ma rnams dbang bskur ba'i skabs 'chad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis slob ma rnams dbang bskur ba'i skabs 'chad de /
translated: This explains the section on conferring empowerment on the disciples.

original: de la mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rgyan rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa'i spyan sngar rin po che la sogs pa'i bum pas chu blugs pas
analyzed: de la mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rgyan rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa'i spyan sngar rin po che la sogs pa'i bum pas chu blugs pas
translated: In the presence of that, the water is poured from the vase of jewels, and so on.

original: chu blugs pa ste mngon par blugs zhes pa'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: chu blugs pa ste mngon par blugs zhes pa'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The pouring of water is the meaning of the words empowerment and empowerment of the water.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya ste /üîΩdbang bskur ba'i ming ji lta bu yin pa dang / su la dbang bskur ba dang / ci'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya ste / dbang bskur ba'i ming ji lta bu yin pa dang / su la dbang bskur ba dang / ci'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: That is also to be analyzed in three topics:üîΩthe name of the empowerment, the one to whom the empowerment is conferred, and the reason for the empowerment.

original: de la dbang bskur ba'i ming ji lta bu yin pa ni spyir dbang bskur ba'i rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: de la dbang bskur ba'i ming ji lta bu yin pa ni spyir dbang bskur ba'i rnam pa mang ste /
translated: The name of the empowerment is generally the name of the empowerment.

original: sngags pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir rig pa sbyin pa dang / las kyi dbang bskur ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod kyi las bya ba'i phyir dang / gdon bsam pa la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: sngags pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir rig pa sbyin pa dang / las kyi dbang bskur ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod kyi las bya ba'i phyir dang / gdon bsam pa la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The knowledge empowerment is for the purpose of becoming a mantrin, and the action empowerment is for the purpose of performing pacifying, increasing, and wrathful actions and for the purpose of performing rites for the dead and so on.

original: de dag las skabs 'dir ni slob dpon du dbang bskur bag zhes bya ste de ni ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag las skabs 'dir ni slob dpon du dbang bskur bag zhes bya ste de ni ming ngo //
translated: Of those, in this context, it is the master empowerment that is conferred, and that is the name.

original: su la dbang bskur ba ni slob ma phal pa thams cad la dbang bskur bar bya ba ma yin gyi dam tshig can lnga'i skabs nas /
analyzed: su la dbang bskur ba ni slob ma phal pa thams cad la dbang bskur bar bya ba ma yin gyi dam tshig can lnga'i skabs nas /
translated: To whom is the empowerment conferred? It is not to be conferred on all ordinary disciples, but on those who have taken the five samayas,

original: dkyil 'khor dang ni phyag rgya mthong //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang ni phyag rgya mthong //
translated: who have seen the mandala and mudra,

original: las dang bya ba la yang sbyar //
analyzed: las dang bya ba la yang sbyar //
translated: and who are engaged in the activities and deeds.

original: zhes sngags kyi rgyud rnams thos shing dkyil 'khor la sogs pa 'dri bar nus pa khyad par can gyi slob ma dang / yongs su grub pa'i slob ma rnams la dbang bskur te /
analyzed: zhes sngags kyi rgyud rnams thos shing dkyil 'khor la sogs pa 'dri bar nus pa khyad par can gyi slob ma dang / yongs su grub pa'i slob ma rnams la dbang bskur te /
translated: The empowerment is conferred on special disciples who are able to listen to the tantras, draw mandalas, and so on, and on fully qualified disciples.

original: su la dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni de rnams la dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: su la dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni de rnams la dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Who is consecrated? They are consecrated.

original: ci'i phyir dbang bskur zhes pa ni chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang bskur zhes pa ni chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why are they consecrated? In order that the eye of the Dharma not be disturbed.

original: 'jig rten na yang 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag lung bstan pa dang rtog pa dang / sman la sog pa rnams kyang slob mas rdzogs pa rlobs nas slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba'i cho ga 'jig rten pa rnams la ji ltar srid pa bzhin du byas na bshad pa la sogs pa bya bar @347a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag lung bstan pa dang rtog pa dang / sman la sog pa rnams kyang slob mas rdzogs pa rlobs nas slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba'i cho ga 'jig rten pa rnams la ji ltar srid pa bzhin du byas na bshad pa la sogs pa bya bar @347a * //
translated: In the world, the eye of the Dharma, the eye of the treatises, the eye of the arts, the eye of medicine, etc., are consecrated by the master after the disciple has completed his studies.

original: slob ma la lung sbyin pa srid do //
analyzed: slob ma la lung sbyin pa srid do //
translated: The disciple is then able to explain the treatises, etc.

original: de dag kyang so so'i gtsug lag rdzogs par mi shes shing dbang ma bskur bar bshad pa la sogs pa byas na gtsug lag de dag ji lta ba bzhin du bshad mi nus pas de dag gis mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang so so'i gtsug lag rdzogs par mi shes shing dbang ma bskur bar bshad pa la sogs pa byas na gtsug lag de dag ji lta ba bzhin du bshad mi nus pas de dag gis mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one explains the treatises, etc., without having completed one‚Äôs studies and without having been consecrated, one will not be able to explain them well, and one will be disturbed.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang slob ma rnams rgyud la sogs pa rdzogs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang slob ma rnams rgyud la sogs pa rdzogs par shes par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, here also, the disciples should be made to understand the tantra completely.

original: de dag nyid slob dpon gyi mdo mngon sum du bzlas nas rgyud bshad pa dang dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par slob dpon nyid yid ches te /
analyzed: de dag nyid slob dpon gyi mdo mngon sum du bzlas nas rgyud bshad pa dang dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par slob dpon nyid yid ches te /
translated: The master himself should be confident that he understands the explanation of the tantra and the drawing of the mandala, etc., by repeating the sutra and the tantra in person.

original: sems can gyi don byed nus par gyur pa rnams la dbang bskur na chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed nus par gyur pa rnams la dbang bskur na chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he confers initiation on those who are able to benefit sentient beings, the eye of the doctrine will not be disturbed.

original: gnyis su na de ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i slob ma de slob dpon du gyur na 'jig rten pa rnams kyang khungs de lta bu las byung ba'i slob dpon de la yid ches shing btsun par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis su na de ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i slob ma de slob dpon du gyur na 'jig rten pa rnams kyang khungs de lta bu las byung ba'i slob dpon de la yid ches shing btsun par byed do //
translated: On the other hand, if the disciple who has been thus initiated becomes a master, then even worldly people will have confidence in and respect for that master who has arisen from such a source.

original: rim pa 'di lta bus dbang ma bskur la rgyud la sogs pa mi shes par btsan thabs su sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa 'chad cing dkyil 'khor 'drin ji lta ba nyid du mi shes te /
analyzed: rim pa 'di lta bus dbang ma bskur la rgyud la sogs pa mi shes par btsan thabs su sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa 'chad cing dkyil 'khor 'drin ji lta ba nyid du mi shes te /
translated: Without such a process, without initiation, without understanding the tantras, etc., one forcibly explains the tantras, etc., and draws the mandalas without understanding the reality.

original: don log par 'gyur pas sngags kyi lha la sogs pas kyang byin gyis mi rlob pa'i phyir ci bsams pa'i don mi 'grub la /
analyzed: don log par 'gyur pas sngags kyi lha la sogs pas kyang byin gyis mi rlob pa'i phyir ci bsams pa'i don mi 'grub la /
translated: Since the meaning is distorted, the mantras, etc., of the deities do not bless one, so the desired goal is not accomplished.

original: gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams yid mi ches shing mi phyogs pas chos kyi mig 'tshub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams yid mi ches shing mi phyogs pas chos kyi mig 'tshub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the disciples do not have confidence and are not inclined, the eye of the Dharma is obscured.

original: ci'i phyir dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it called initiation? It is for that reason.

original: de la dbang bskur ba yang ji ltar 'jig rten gyi rgyal po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi bka' khrims ston pa /
analyzed: de la dbang bskur ba yang ji ltar 'jig rten gyi rgyal po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi bka' khrims ston pa /
translated: Moreover, initiation is like the way the king of the world teaches the law of the path of the ten virtues

original: mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa de ji ltar rgyal thabs su dbang bskur bar bya ba de bzhin bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa de ji ltar rgyal thabs su dbang bskur bar bya ba de bzhin bya ba ste /
translated: and bestows the fruit of high status, just as he is to be initiated into kingship.

original: 'dir yang mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir yang mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Here, too, it is because he is consecrated as the king of the Dharma, which bestows the fruit of high status and definite goodness.

original: de yang rim pa 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rim pa 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is to be done in this way.

original: thog mar rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du bar khru dos bcad de der dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor rim pa gcig pa sgo gcig pa bris la /
analyzed: thog mar rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du bar khru dos bcad de der dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor rim pa gcig pa sgo gcig pa bris la /
translated: First, in front of the root ma·πá·∏çala, having measured with a cubit, one should draw there the consecration ma·πá·∏çala, which is one level and has one gate.

original: de'i nang du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris te /
analyzed: de'i nang du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris te /
translated: Inside that, one should draw an eight-petaled lotus.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bri zhing padma'i 'dab ma brgyad po la yang byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang phyag brnyan bzhi ste brgyad bri'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bri zhing padma'i 'dab ma brgyad po la yang byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang phyag brnyan bzhi ste brgyad bri'o //
translated: In the four corners of the ma·πá·∏çala, one should draw Vajradhara, and on the eight lotus petals, one should draw the four bodhisattvas and the four attendants, making eight.

original: padma'i dbus su chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ram bris la der slob ma bzhag ste /
analyzed: padma'i dbus su chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ram bris la der slob ma bzhag ste /
translated: In the center of the lotus, one should draw the syllable ra·πÉ of the dharmadhƒÅtu. Having placed the disciple there,

original: dri dang me tog la @347b sogs pa'i mchod pa dang / bkra shis pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / gleng gzhi rgya chen po snyan pa rnams bsgrags shing kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i sems dpa' rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rin po che bzhi'i bum pa dkyil 'khor chen po lan re bskor nas slob ma de'i spyi bo nas blugs so //
analyzed: dri dang me tog la @347b sogs pa'i mchod pa dang / bkra shis pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / gleng gzhi rgya chen po snyan pa rnams bsgrags shing kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i sems dpa' rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rin po che bzhi'i bum pa dkyil 'khor chen po lan re bskor nas slob ma de'i spyi bo nas blugs so //
translated: The offerings of perfume, flowers, and so forth, the verses of auspiciousness, and the pleasant extensive nidƒÅna are proclaimed. The consecration with the four precious vases blessed by the bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra and so forth is performed by circling the great ma·πá·∏çala once and pouring it on the head of the disciple.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dir dngos su ma smos kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtug tor dang spyan dang ljags dang go cha rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / sngags kyis kyang slob ma de la padma'i steng na 'dug pa nyid nas rim pa bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dir dngos su ma smos kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtug tor dang spyan dang ljags dang go cha rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / sngags kyis kyang slob ma de la padma'i steng na 'dug pa nyid nas rim pa bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: After that, although not mentioned here, the mudras of the TathƒÅgatas‚Äô crest, eyes, tongue, and armor, and also the mantras, should also be used to consecrate the disciple, who is seated upon the lotus, in order.

original: de nas gnas de bslab ste dkyil 'khor de'i nyi 'khor du dri bzang po gcig bzhag ste gos gsar pa brjes nas gos gsar pa phrugs cig gon nas khri'i steng du bzhag go //
analyzed: de nas gnas de bslab ste dkyil 'khor de'i nyi 'khor du dri bzang po gcig bzhag ste gos gsar pa brjes nas gos gsar pa phrugs cig gon nas khri'i steng du bzhag go //
translated: Then, having trained in that place, having placed a single fragrant substance in the ma·πá·∏çala of that place, having changed into new clothing, having put on a new set of clothes, [the disciple] sits on the throne.

original: dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod nas /
analyzed: dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod nas /
translated: Having made offerings with fragrance, flowers, and so on,

original: slob dpon nyid mig dbye ba'i thur ma thogs nas mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: slob dpon nyid mig dbye ba'i thur ma thogs nas mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: the master himself, holding the eye-opening scalpel, sits in front [of the disciple].

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bu khyod kyis mi shes pa'i rab rib rnams bsal to zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bu khyod kyis mi shes pa'i rab rib rnams bsal to zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig brjod do //
translated: [The master] utters the words, ‚ÄúThe tathƒÅgatas will remove the cataracts of ignorance, O child.‚Äù

original: de nas me long thogs la chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi tshul du sgoms shig ces pa'i tshig brjod do //
analyzed: de nas me long thogs la chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi tshul du sgoms shig ces pa'i tshig brjod do //
translated: Then, holding up a mirror, [the master] utters the words, ‚ÄúMeditate on the mode of emptiness, the absence of intrinsic existence, like a reflection.‚Äù

original: de nas de ltar bdag gi don yongs su rdzogs nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir rkang pa'i 'og tu gser gyi 'khor lo bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas de ltar bdag gi don yongs su rdzogs nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir rkang pa'i 'og tu gser gyi 'khor lo bzhag ste /
translated: Then, having completely perfected one‚Äôs own aim, in order to perfect the aims of others, having placed a golden wheel under [the disciple‚Äôs] feet,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo skor cig ces bsgrag go / de nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang sangs rgyas kyi gsung mchog 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grags par bskor bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo skor cig ces bsgrag go / de nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang sangs rgyas kyi gsung mchog 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grags par bskor bar bya ste /
translated: Then, that turning of the wheel of the Dharma should be turned in such a way that the supreme speech of the Buddha resounds in all world systems.

original: gsung mchog de'i phyag rgyar gyur pa dung bzang po cig lag pa g-yas par byin la /
analyzed: gsung mchog de'i phyag rgyar gyur pa dung bzang po cig lag pa g-yas par byin la /
translated: Then, having given a fine conch shell, which is the seal of that supreme speech, in the right hand,

original: khyod kyi chos kyi dung bus shig / ces brjod do //
analyzed: khyod kyi chos kyi dung bus shig / ces brjod do //
translated: one should say, ‚ÄúBlow the conch of the Dharma!‚Äù

original: de ltar sems can gyi don byas nas sangs rgyas rnams la byas pa gzo ba la sogs pa'i tshig de'i 'og tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi don byas nas sangs rgyas rnams la byas pa gzo ba la sogs pa'i tshig de'i 'og tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having thus benefited sentient beings, one should then say the words of gratitude to the Buddhas, and so forth.

original: de rnams ni las su bya ba'i rim pa bsdus te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni las su bya ba'i rim pa bsdus te bshad pa'o //
translated: Those are the steps of the ritual practice, explained in brief.

original: yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the branches.

original: sems dpa' chan po dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: sems dpa' chan po dbang bskur ba //
translated: The great being is consecrated,

original: rgyas pa ru ni bshad par byas //
analyzed: rgyas pa ru ni bshad par byas //
translated: and is explained in the extensive [version].

original: yid gcig bsdus te legs par nyon //
analyzed: yid gcig bsdus te legs par nyon //
translated: Listen with a one-pointed mind!

original: zhes pa la dbang bskur ba'i tshig gi don gong du bshad zin la /
analyzed: zhes pa la dbang bskur ba'i tshig gi don gong du bshad zin la /
translated: The meaning of the words of consecration has been explained above.

original: rgyas pa ru ni bshad par byas //üîΩzhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i cho ga @348a * //
analyzed: rgyas pa ru ni bshad par byas // zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i cho ga @348a * //
translated: I will explain it in detail.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang ldan par 'chad pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang ldan par 'chad pas shes pa'o //
translated: This is understood by the explanation that is endowed with the rites of consecration that will occur below.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis bshad ces pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas bya ba gcig du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis bshad ces pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas bya ba gcig du bstan pa'o //
