translated: The phrase explained by the buddhas of the past is taught as a single activity because all buddhas are the same.üîΩThe master, the lord of the secret, having gone beyond one cubit in front of the root ma·πá·∏çala, should draw the second ma·πá·∏çala on the outer ground, square, with one door.

original: gsang ba'i pa'i bdag po slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du bar khru do bor nas phyi rol gyi sa la dkyil 'khor gnyis pa gru bzhi la sgo gcig pa bri bar bya'i zhes pa la don gzhan ni sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i pa'i bdag po slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du bar khru do bor nas phyi rol gyi sa la dkyil 'khor gnyis pa gru bzhi la sgo gcig pa bri bar bya'i zhes pa la don gzhan ni sngar bshad zin te /
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained above.

original: 'dir dngos su ma smos kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid ltar byas na nang gi dkyil 'khor gyis shar phyogs su gzhol na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su bri bar bya /
analyzed: 'dir dngos su ma smos kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid ltar byas na nang gi dkyil 'khor gyis shar phyogs su gzhol na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su bri bar bya /
translated: Although not explicitly mentioned here, if one follows the general characteristics, if the inner ma·πá·∏çala faces east, the ma·πá·∏çala for conferring empowerment should be drawn in the north.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su gzhol na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor nub phyogs su bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su gzhol na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor nub phyogs su bri bar bya ste /
translated: If the inner ma·πá·∏çala slopes to the north, the ma·πá·∏çala for conferring initiation should be drawn to the west.

original: 'dir ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba mtha' gcig tu gsungs pas nang gi dkyil 'khor la dbang bskur ba'i tshu mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa byang phyogs su gzhol bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bri ba mtha' gcig tu gsungs pas nang gi dkyil 'khor la dbang bskur ba'i tshu mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa byang phyogs su gzhol bar bya'o //
translated: Here, since it is said that the ma·πá·∏çala for conferring initiation is drawn in front of the inner ma·πá·∏çala, in order to prevent the ma·πá·∏çala for conferring initiation from being higher than the inner ma·πá·∏çala, the ground of the inner ma·πá·∏çala should slope to the north.

original: 'on te shar phyogs su gzhol na yang bar sa rgal gyis bcad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te shar phyogs su gzhol na yang bar sa rgal gyis bcad par bya'o //
translated: If it slopes to the east, it should be cut with a level.

original: grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin sngar bzhin dgod de zhes pa ni /
analyzed: grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin sngar bzhin dgod de zhes pa ni /
translated: In the four corners, one should place the vajra-holders as before.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa de rnams dang 'og nas byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang phyag brnyan bzhi 'byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan las gyur pa ste de rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir spros pa med par gnas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa de rnams dang 'og nas byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang phyag brnyan bzhi 'byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan las gyur pa ste de rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir spros pa med par gnas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Those vajra-holders and the four bodhisattvas and four doormen that will appear below are born from the qualities of the tathƒÅgatas. Since they are free from conceptualization, they are said to abide without conceptual elaboration.

original: nam mkha' dri ma med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'o //üîΩdri ma med pa'i mig ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' dri ma med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'o // dri ma med pa'i mig ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The sky is stainless, the domain of emptiness, like the sky, free from the stains of the knowable and the afflictions.üîΩThe stainless eye is the wisdom that is free from the obscurations of the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes rab can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes rab can zhes pa'o //
translated: or the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: gos sna tshogs gyon pa ni ngo tshab sgrib par byed pas gos te /
analyzed: gos sna tshogs gyon pa ni ngo tshab sgrib par byed pas gos te /
translated: Wearing various garments means that one is clothed, as one is covered by shame.

original: gang zhig ngo tsha ba yod na mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa rnams byed pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa ste de lta bu'i ngo tsha dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ngo tsha ba yod na mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa rnams byed pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa ste de lta bu'i ngo tsha dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: One who has shame does not do what should not be done, does what should be done, and is praised by the holy ones.

original: dbus su padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa ze ba dang bcas pa gzhag pa ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbus su padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa ze ba dang bcas pa gzhag pa ste zhes pa ni /
translated: In the center, one should place a great eight-petaled lotus with a pistil.

original: ye shes brgyad kyi phyag rgyar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes brgyad kyi phyag rgyar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the seal of the eight wisdoms.

original: ze ba ni yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: ze ba ni yon tan rnams so //
translated: The pistil is the qualities.

original: 'dab ma bzhi la byang chub sems dpa' grogs su gyur pa sngon @348b gyi smon lam gyi mthu can du gyur pa bzhi bri bar bya ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi la byang chub sems dpa' grogs su gyur pa sngon @348b gyi smon lam gyi mthu can du gyur pa bzhi bri bar bya ste zhes pa ni /
translated: On the four petals, one should draw the four bodhisattvas who are friends, who have become so through the power of former vows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams de bzhin nyid kyi yon tan las gyur pa ste gnyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams de bzhin nyid kyi yon tan las gyur pa ste gnyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: These bodhisattvas are the result of the qualities of suchness. Two of them are the perfection of one's own aim,

original: gnyis ni gzhan gyi don du phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin te smon lam gyi dbang gis chos kyi rgyal por dbang skur ba de'i padma'i gdan gyi gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni gzhan gyi don du phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin te smon lam gyi dbang gis chos kyi rgyal por dbang skur ba de'i padma'i gdan gyi gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: and two are the perfection of the aim of others. By the power of their vows, they are anointed as Dharma kings, and they become the seat of the lotus throne of that [anointed one].

original: de la gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po zhes pa la gzungs ni shes rab ste de'i rgyal por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po zhes pa la gzungs ni shes rab ste de'i rgyal por gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, the one called DhƒÅra·πáƒ´≈õvara-rƒÅja is the king of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´, where dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is wisdom.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can ni shes rab de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin sems can rnams la rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin can ni shes rab de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin sems can rnams la rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: He is mindful and aware, and that wisdom, which is the nature of nonabiding nirvana, is uninterrupted for sentient beings.

original: phan pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa can rnams la phan par sems pa'o //üîΩsnying rje can ni snying rje'i dpang gis sems can rnams la phan par sems pa ste de gnyis ni /
analyzed: phan pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa can rnams la phan par sems pa'o // snying rje can ni snying rje'i dpang gis sems can rnams la phan par sems pa ste de gnyis ni /
translated: Benefit is the thought of benefit for those with superior intention.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Compassion is the thought of benefit for sentient beings through the power of compassion. These two are the nature of the perfection of others' aims.

original: snga ma gnyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The former two are the nature of the perfection of one's own aims.

original: 'dab ma gzhan rnams la ni phyag brgyan bzhi bris te zhes pa yang de bzhin nyid yon tan du shes par bya ste smon lam gyi dbang gis gyur pa ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dab ma gzhan rnams la ni phyag brgyan bzhi bris te zhes pa yang de bzhin nyid yon tan du shes par bya ste smon lam gyi dbang gis gyur pa ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: On the other petals, four ornaments are drawn. One should understand that these are also qualities of suchness, transformed by the power of aspiration, as before.

original: sems can gyi khyad par la spyod pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩ'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khyad par la spyod pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i rang bzhin no // 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Conduct in the distinctions of sentient beings is the nature of the knowledge of others' minds.

original: sems can rnams kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed par shes pa'o //
translated: Fulfilling wishes is the knowledge of fulfilling the hopes of sentient beings.

original: ma chags pa dang rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i yon tan te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni chags pa med pa yin la chags pa med pas na rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i yon tan te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni chags pa med pa yin la chags pa med pas na rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Non-attachment and liberation are the qualities of the result. The nature of emptiness is non-attachment, and because of non-attachment, there is liberation.

original: gong ma gnyis ni rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis ni rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The two above are the nature of the cause.

original: dbus su ni chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzugs gzhag go zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbus su ni chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzugs gzhag go zhes pa ni /
translated: In the center, one should place the form of the inconceivable realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ra kha dog dkar po padma'i snying po la gzhag go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ra kha dog dkar po padma'i snying po la gzhag go //
translated: The syllable ra of the realm of phenomena is placed in the center of the lotus, white in color.

original: rin po che'i bum pa bzhi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rin po che'i bum pa bzhi zhes pa ni /
translated: The four precious vases are

original: gser dang / dngul dang / padma r'a ga dang / ma ra ka ti'i bum pa gser dang / dbul la sogs pa de dag gis brgyan pa'i bum pa bya'o //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / padma r'a ga dang / ma ra ka ti'i bum pa gser dang / dbul la sogs pa de dag gis brgyan pa'i bum pa bya'o //
translated: golden, silver, ruby, and sapphire vases. Those vases are adorned with gold, silver, and so on.

original: de ltar yang ma 'byor na /üîΩde rnams kyi kha dog dang mthun pa'i sa'i bum pa bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma 'byor na / de rnams kyi kha dog dang mthun pa'i sa'i bum pa bya ste /
translated: If one cannot obtain them in that way,üîΩone should make vases of clay the color of those.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams @349a * //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams @349a * //
translated: One should prepare the articles such as those.

original: 'byor bzhin du ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin ma sbyar na /
analyzed: 'byor bzhin du ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin ma sbyar na /
translated: If one does not apply oneself as it is taught, even though one is able to,

original: 'jungs pa'i sems dang ldan te sems ma dag pas lha rnams kyang byin gyis mi rlob ces gzhung las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jungs pa'i sems dang ldan te sems ma dag pas lha rnams kyang byin gyis mi rlob ces gzhung las 'byung ngo //
translated: it is said in the scriptures that one has a stingy mind and an impure mind, and the gods do not bless one.

original: snying nas med kyang mi 'byor du mi rung snyam nas mi spobs te mi byed dam ;
analyzed: snying nas med kyang mi 'byor du mi rung snyam nas mi spobs te mi byed dam ;
translated: If one thinks that it is not right not to give even though one does not have it, and so does not give because one is not confident,

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / nad kyi rkyen sman gyi zong yang mi 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / nad kyi rkyen sman gyi zong yang mi 'jog par byed na /
translated: or if one does not set aside provisions for one's livelihood and medicine for illness,

original: yang dgongs pa'am cho ga mi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dgongs pa'am cho ga mi shes pa yin la /
translated: one does not know the intention or ritual.

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / nad kyi rkyen sman gyi zong du snyad btags nas lhag par yod pa gtong mi phod na gong du smos pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / nad kyi rkyen sman gyi zong du snyad btags nas lhag par yod pa gtong mi phod na gong du smos pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: If one does not give what one has in excess, pretending that it is provisions for one's livelihood or medicine for illness, it is the same as what was said above.

original: mdor na sems la sgyu med pa'i gtsang spra shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na sems la sgyu med pa'i gtsang spra shes par bya'o //
translated: In brief, one should know that purity is the absence of deceit in the mind.

original: kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bun gyis brlabs pa yang slob ma de ngan song spang bar bstan pa'i phyir thog ma nyid du ngan song thams cad spong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas bkru'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bun gyis brlabs pa yang slob ma de ngan song spang bar bstan pa'i phyir thog ma nyid du ngan song thams cad spong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas bkru'o //
translated: The disciples are consecrated with the water of the vase, which is empowered by the mantra of the Bodhisattva Sarvanivaranavishkambhin, in order to show that they will abandon the evil destinies.

original: ngan song spangs nas shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur cig pa'i don du /üîΩde nas sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i sngags kyis btab la bkru'o //
analyzed: ngan song spangs nas shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur cig pa'i don du / de nas sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i sngags kyis btab la bkru'o //
translated: After abandoning the evil destinies, they should be free from the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.üîΩTherefore, they are consecrated with the water of the vase, which is empowered by the mantra of the Bodhisattva Sarvanivaranavishkambhin.

original: de nas kun du bzang po'i sa thob par gyur cig pa'i don du kun du bzang po'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas bkru'o //
analyzed: de nas kun du bzang po'i sa thob par gyur cig pa'i don du kun du bzang po'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas bkru'o //
translated: Then, in order that they may attain the stage of Samantabhadra, they are consecrated with the water of the vase, which is empowered by the mantra of the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: de nas chos kyi rgyal tshab tu gyur cig pa'i don du byams pa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas bkru'o //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi rgyal tshab tu gyur cig pa'i don du byams pa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas bkru'o //
translated: Then, in order that they may become regents of the Dharma, they are consecrated with the water of the vase, which is empowered by the mantra of the Bodhisattva Maitreya.

original: padma dam pa de la ni //
analyzed: padma dam pa de la ni //
translated: On that excellent lotus

original: sngags pa dag gis de bzhag nas //
analyzed: sngags pa dag gis de bzhag nas //
translated: the mantra practitioner should place them

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: and so forth up to

original: spos dang me tog bzang po yis //
analyzed: spos dang me tog bzang po yis //
translated: With good incense and flowers,

original: de la yang ni mchod par bya //
analyzed: de la yang ni mchod par bya //
translated: one should worship him.

original: zhes pa'i bar du don gzhan ni gong du bshad zin la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du don gzhan ni gong du bshad zin la /
translated: Up to this point, the meaning has been explained above.

original: slob ma de dbang bskur bar bya ba'i tshe /
analyzed: slob ma de dbang bskur bar bya ba'i tshe /
translated: When that disciple is to be initiated,

original: 'dir dngos su ma gsungs kyang dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe na rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te /
analyzed: 'dir dngos su ma gsungs kyang dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe na rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te /
translated: although it is not actually stated here, at the time of entering the mandala, one should transform into the body of Vajrasattva.

original: de las gzhan pa'i skur bsgyur ba ma gsungs pas rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skur bsgyur ba ma gsungs pas rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is not stated that one should transform into any other body, one should be initiated into the body of Vajrasattva.

original: dbang bskur ba'i tshe padma'i gdan la bzhag pa yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'dug thabs su bzhag ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i tshe padma'i gdan la bzhag pa yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'dug thabs su bzhag ste /
translated: At the time of initiation, one should be placed on a lotus seat in the manner of sitting of a universal monarch.

original: rkang pa g-yon pa khri'i steng du bzhag la g-yas pa sa la @349b gzhag cing /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pa khri'i steng du bzhag la g-yas pa sa la @349b gzhag cing /
translated: Place the left foot on the throne and the right foot on the ground.

original: lag pa g-yon pa khri la brten la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa khri la brten la /
translated: Support the left hand on the throne.

original: g-yas pa pus mo la bzhag ste gdong yang mi mtho mi dma' bar drang por blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa pus mo la bzhag ste gdong yang mi mtho mi dma' bar drang por blta bar bya'o //
translated: Place the right hand on the knee, and the face should be straight, neither too high nor too low.

original: de nas gser gyi thur ma ni //
analyzed: de nas gser gyi thur ma ni //
translated: Then, with a golden scalpel,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: ling tog rgyal ba rnams kyis bsal //
analyzed: ling tog rgyal ba rnams kyis bsal //
translated: The Victorious Ones have removed the cataracts.

original: zhes pa'i bar du rim pa gzhan ni gong du bshad la //üîΩbu khyod kyis ni mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du rim pa gzhan ni gong du bshad la // bu khyod kyis ni mi shes pa'i //
translated: The other stages are explained above.üîΩSon, the Victorious Ones have removed

original: ling tog rgyal ba rnams kyis bsal //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: ling tog rgyal ba rnams kyis bsal // zhes pa ni /
translated: the cataracts of what you did not know.

original: sngon thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyis rgyud la sogs pa mi shes pa rgyal ba'i lung slob dpon gyis bshad pas mi shes pa bsal to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyis rgyud la sogs pa mi shes pa rgyal ba'i lung slob dpon gyis bshad pas mi shes pa bsal to zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the master's explanation of the Victorious Ones' scriptures has removed your ignorance of the tantras and so forth, which you did not know through the wisdom of listening and reflection.

original: sngon gyi mig mkhan rgyal po yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi mig mkhan rgyal po yis //
translated: Just as the king of eye doctors

original: 'jig rten ling tog bsal ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'jig rten ling tog bsal ba bzhin //
translated: removed the world's cataracts,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the example.

original: dpe ste / de ltar mig gi sman pa'i rgyal pos 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mig gi rab rib bsal te gzugs la sogs pa'i rang dngos ji lta ba nyid du 'dug pa mi mthong ba las mthong bar byas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dpe ste / de ltar mig gi sman pa'i rgyal pos 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mig gi rab rib bsal te gzugs la sogs pa'i rang dngos ji lta ba nyid du 'dug pa mi mthong ba las mthong bar byas pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the king of eye doctors removed the world's cataracts, and then they saw forms and so forth as they are in their own nature, which they had not seen before,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis kyang bu khyod kyi ma rig pa chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pa mi shes pa las shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis kyang bu khyod kyi ma rig pa chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pa mi shes pa las shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The victors also say, ‚ÄúSon, you should know that your mother does not know the characteristics of phenomena as they are.‚Äù

original: de nas me long blangs nas su //
analyzed: de nas me long blangs nas su //
translated: Then, having taken up the mirror,

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya //
translated: explain the characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste // zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPhenomena are like reflections.‚Äù

original: phung po dang / khams dang / sye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / sye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
translated: Phenomena such as the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres are like reflections.

original: bltar yang snang la yang dag par brtags na dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bltar yang snang la yang dag par brtags na dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: They appear to the view but, when examined, they are not real things.

original: dang zhing zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dang zhing zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù means

original: 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams phung po'i rang bzhin du dmigs su med pas dang ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams phung po'i rang bzhin du dmigs su med pas dang ba zhes pa'o //
translated: that phenomena such as the aggregates are not observed as the nature of the aggregates.

original: dag pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dag pa zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúPure‚Äù means

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: rnyog pa med pa'i sgrib pa dang de dag gi bag chags kyang med ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa'i sgrib pa dang de dag gi bag chags kyang med ces pa'o //
translated: And there is no obscuration that is not clear, nor any latent tendency to them.

original: gzung du med cing brjod du med //
analyzed: gzung du med cing brjod du med //
translated: It cannot be grasped and cannot be expressed.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This means that

original: de lta bu'i stong pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par shes pa drug gis gzung du med cing tshig gis brjod pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i stong pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par shes pa drug gis gzung du med cing tshig gis brjod pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: the nature of emptiness, which is like that, cannot be grasped by the six consciousnesses and is beyond verbal expression.

original: rgyu dang las las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang las las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from causes and actions.

original: zhes pa ni /üîΩphung @350a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni / phung @350a * //
translated: This means that

original: po la sogs pa'i chos rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: po la sogs pa'i chos rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
translated: the aggregates and so forth are not intrinsically existent natures.

original: rgyu dang las las byung ba sna gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang las las byung ba sna gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
translated: They arise from causes and actions and are like reflections.

original: yod pa ma yin pas brjod du med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gong ma rnams dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas brjod du med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gong ma rnams dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since they do not exist, they are connected with the previous words ‚Äúinexpressible‚Äù and so forth.

original: ngo bo nyid med gnas med pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med gnas med pa //
translated: It has no intrinsic reality and no location.

original: de ltar chos 'di shes nas su //
analyzed: de ltar chos 'di shes nas su //
translated: Having understood this Dharma in that way,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means that

original: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: since it is like a reflection, it has no intrinsic reality.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas skad cig ma'i char mi gnas par shes pas te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas skad cig ma'i char mi gnas par shes pas te /
translated: Because they arise from causes and conditions, they are momentary, and do not endure even for an instant.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid de ltar shes nas de lta bu'i tshul du sgom pa'i shes rab kyis sgoms shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid de ltar shes nas de lta bu'i tshul du sgom pa'i shes rab kyis sgoms shig ces pa'o //
translated: Having understood the characteristics of phenomena in this way, meditate in this manner with the wisdom of meditation.

original: sems can don ni mnyam med byos //
analyzed: sems can don ni mnyam med byos //
translated: Act for the benefit of sentient beings without compare.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: chos kyi dung ba ni bla med pa //üîΩzhes pa'i bar ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dung ba ni bla med pa // zhes pa'i bar ni /
translated: The supreme Dharma conch.

original: de ltar bdag gi don phun sum tshogs nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byos shig ces pa ste gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi don phun sum tshogs nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byos shig ces pa ste gong du bshad zin to //
translated: Having thus perfected your own goal, you should perfect the goals of others.

original: sangs rgyas sras su skye zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras su skye zhes pa ni /
translated: You are born as a child of the buddhas.

original: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las skyes so zhes pa'o //üîΩsom nyi yid gnyis mi bya zhing //
analyzed: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las skyes so zhes pa'o // som nyi yid gnyis mi bya zhing //
translated: You are born from the wisdom of the tathagatas.üîΩDo not be doubtful or uncertain.

original: dog pa med pa'i sems kyis khyod //üîΩces pa ni /
analyzed: dog pa med pa'i sems kyis khyod //üîΩces pa ni /
translated: With an open mind,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing sems can gyi don bya ba de ltar yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom dang yid gnyis mi skye ba dang / 'khor rnams la bag tshab med par 'jig rten pa rnams la gsang sngags sprad pa'i tshul gyi chos rab tu sgrogs shig ces pa'o //üîΩde ltar byas na sangs rgyas la //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing sems can gyi don bya ba de ltar yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom dang yid gnyis mi skye ba dang / 'khor rnams la bag tshab med par 'jig rten pa rnams la gsang sngags sprad pa'i tshul gyi chos rab tu sgrogs shig ces pa'o // de ltar byas na sangs rgyas la //
translated: Without any hesitation, proclaim the Dharma to your retinue in the manner of bestowing Secret Mantra to worldly beings.üîΩThus, you will be known as

original: phan thogs byas pa gzo zhes bya //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: phan thogs byas pa gzo zhes bya // zhes pa ni /
translated: grateful to the buddhas for their help.

original: de ltar sems can gyi don byas na sangs rgyas rnams kyi bya ba byas pas byas pa dran zhing sangs rgyas la lan ldon par bshad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi don byas na sangs rgyas rnams kyi bya ba byas pas byas pa dran zhing sangs rgyas la lan ldon par bshad do zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that if you work for the benefit of sentient beings, you will be known as grateful to the buddhas for their help, since you will have done what they have done.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun yang //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun yang //
translated: All of those vajra holders

original: khyod la rnam pa kun du srung ;üîΩ/ zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khyod la rnam pa kun du srung ;üîΩ/ zhes pa ni /
translated: will always protect you.

original: dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi bkod pa dang / padma'i 'dab ma la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang las byas pa don yod do snyam nas srung bar byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi bkod pa dang / padma'i 'dab ma la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang las byas pa don yod do snyam nas srung bar byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: The four Vajradharas are placed in the four corners of the mandala of consecration, and those Bodhisattvas who are seated on the lotus petals also protect, thinking that the rite has been performed and is meaningful.

original: de nas slob ma de @350b bslangs la //
analyzed: de nas slob ma de @350b bslangs la //
translated: Then, having summoned that disciple,

original: sngags pa snying rjer gyur pa yi //
analyzed: sngags pa snying rjer gyur pa yi //
translated: the reciter, having become compassionate,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: up to

original: shin tu nges pa yid kyis ni //
analyzed: shin tu nges pa yid kyis ni //
translated: with a very definite mind

original: de dag thams cad khas blang ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad khas blang ngo //
translated: he should accept all of them.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis slob ma la dam tshig bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis slob ma la dam tshig bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the commitments to the disciple.

original: de yang sngon dam tshig mnos pa dang ma mnos pa gnyis ka la bstan no //
analyzed: de yang sngon dam tshig mnos pa dang ma mnos pa gnyis ka la bstan no //
translated: Moreover, it is taught to both those who have previously taken the commitments and those who have not.

original: de la slob dpon dam tshig bzhi dang lnga dag tu ldan la /
analyzed: de la slob dpon dam tshig bzhi dang lnga dag tu ldan la /
translated: Therein, the master is endowed with the four or five commitments,

original: las dang bya ba dag sbyar ba rgyud la sogs pa dang dam tshig shes shing mnos zin pa la bstan ci dgos she na /
analyzed: las dang bya ba dag sbyar ba rgyud la sogs pa dang dam tshig shes shing mnos zin pa la bstan ci dgos she na /
translated: and it is taught to one who has applied the rites and actions, who knows the tantras, etc., and who has taken the commitments. What need is there to teach one who has taken the commitments?

original: 'jig rten na rgyal por nams kyang rgyal chos su bya ba rnams snga nas kyang shes shing srung mod kyi ;
analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyal por nams kyang rgyal chos su bya ba rnams snga nas kyang shes shing srung mod kyi ;
translated: In the world, although the king always knows and protects the royal laws,

original: nam rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: nam rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i tshe na /
translated: when he is consecrated as king,

original: yang slob dpon la sogs pas bstan zhing gsol bar byed do //
analyzed: yang slob dpon la sogs pas bstan zhing gsol bar byed do //
translated: the master and so forth teach and remind him.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang snga nas kyang dam tshig 'di rnams srung mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang snga nas kyang dam tshig 'di rnams srung mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, here also, although one always protects these commitments,

original: chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i chos kyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i chos kyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: they are taught by the Dharma when one is consecrated as the king of Dharma.

original: gnyis su na yang dang yang du bstan na brtan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su na yang dang yang du bstan na brtan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is because they become firm when taught again and again.

original: de nas slob ma de bslangs la //
analyzed: de nas slob ma de bslangs la //
translated: Then, having raised up the disciple,üîΩthe compassionate

original: sngags pa snying rjer gyur pa yi //
analyzed: sngags pa snying rjer gyur pa yi //
translated: mantra practitioner

original: yid kyis nang du bcug nas ni //
analyzed: yid kyis nang du bcug nas ni //
translated: should cause him to enter inwardly

original: de la dam tshig bstan par bya //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la dam tshig bstan par bya //üîΩzhes pa ni /
translated: and teach him the commitments.

original: me long dang 'khor lo la sogs pa bstan pa'i gnas de nas slob ma de bslang ste slob dpon gyis slob ma'i gdugs bzung nas dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo khyud kyi nang du khyud kyi nang der bzhag nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i dam tshig rnams bstan par bya
analyzed: me long dang 'khor lo la sogs pa bstan pa'i gnas de nas slob ma de bslang ste slob dpon gyis slob ma'i gdugs bzung nas dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo khyud kyi nang du khyud kyi nang der bzhag nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i dam tshig rnams bstan par bya
translated: Then, having raised the disciple from the place where he was shown the mirror, wheel, and so forth, the master, holding the disciple's parasol, should place him inside the enclosure of the first mandala, and should teach the pledges that will be explained below.üîΩFrom today onward, child,

original: zhes pa'o // de ring phan chad bu khyod kyis ;
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ring phan chad bu khyod kyis ;
translated: you should not abandon

original: / dam pa'i chos dang byang chub sems //
analyzed: / dam pa'i chos dang byang chub sems //
translated: the true doctrine and the spirit of enlightenment

original: srog gi phyir yang da phyin chad //üîΩyongs su gtang bar mi bya'o //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang da phyin chad // yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o // zhes pa ni /
translated: even for the sake of your life.

original: dam pa'i chos btang ba yang rnam pa gsum gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos btang ba yang rnam pa gsum gyis 'gyur te /
translated: Abandoning the true doctrine occurs in three ways:

original: theg pa chen po las log par lta ba dang / chos smra ba la mngon du dbang za zhing skur pa 'debs pa dang / nyin re zhing dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang / 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las log par lta ba dang / chos smra ba la mngon du dbang za zhing skur pa 'debs pa dang / nyin re zhing dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang / 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang /
translated: (1) turning away from the Great Vehicle, (2) openly despising and denigrating those who teach the doctrine, and (3) not listening to, reflecting on, meditating on, asking about, reading, or explaining the true doctrine daily.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba las gang yang rung ba zhig ma byas na @351a * //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba las gang yang rung ba zhig ma byas na @351a * //
translated: If you do not perform any of the actions such as worship,

original: dam pa'i chos gtad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gtad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: then you have violated the entrustment of the holy Dharma.

original: de rnams khyod kyis srog gi phyir yang mi gtong ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams khyod kyis srog gi phyir yang mi gtong ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: You should not abandon them even for the sake of your life.

original: de nas gzhan yang byang chub kyi sems gtang bar mi bya'o zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang byang chub kyi sems gtang bar mi bya'o zhes sbyar te /
translated: Next, you should not abandon the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi las sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bdag sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces pa'i smon lam gyi sems dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtag tu bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i 'jug pa'i sems mi gtong ba la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi las sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bdag sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces pa'i smon lam gyi sems dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtag tu bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i 'jug pa'i sems mi gtong ba la bya'o //
translated: From among the four kinds of thought of awakening, you should not abandon the aspirational thought of awakening, which is the aspiration ‚ÄúMay I become a buddha in order to benefit sentient beings,‚Äù and the engaged thought of awakening, which is the cultivation of the emptiness of all phenomena.üîΩYou should not be stingy.

original: khyod kyis ser sna mi bya'o zhes sbyar te chos dang nor bdag la bdog cing gzhan la byin par rigs pa las mi sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis ser sna mi bya'o zhes sbyar te chos dang nor bdag la bdog cing gzhan la byin par rigs pa las mi sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not be stingy with the Dharma and wealth that are yours and that are suitable to give to others.

original: gang sems can la gnod pa mi bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: gang sems can la gnod pa mi bya'o zhes te /
translated: You should not harm sentient beings.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyi sgo nas sems can rnams la 'phral gyi gnod pa dang yun gyi gnod pa mi bya zhes pa'o //üîΩslob mas bla ma'i rkang pa la //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyi sgo nas sems can rnams la 'phral gyi gnod pa dang yun gyi gnod pa mi bya zhes pa'o // slob mas bla ma'i rkang pa la //
translated: Do not harm sentient beings in any way, either directly or indirectly, through body, speech, or mind.üîΩWith faith and respect, the disciple

original: dad cing gus par phyag byas nas //
analyzed: dad cing gus par phyag byas nas //
translated: should bow to the guru‚Äôs feet

original: shin tu nges pa'i yid kyi ni //
analyzed: shin tu nges pa'i yid kyi ni //
translated: and with a very definite mind

original: de dag thams cad khas blang ngo //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag thams cad khas blang ngo // zhes pa ni /
translated: accept all of those.

original: gong du slob dpon gyis dam tshig bsgo ba de rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyi sgo nas sgyu med par khas blang ngo zhes pa ste lus kyis /üîΩslob mas bla ma'i rkang pa la //
analyzed: gong du slob dpon gyis dam tshig bsgo ba de rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyi sgo nas sgyu med par khas blang ngo zhes pa ste lus kyis / slob mas bla ma'i rkang pa la //
translated: This means that the disciple should accept all of the pledges that the master has explained, without deception, through body, speech, and mind.

original: dad cing gus par phyag byas nas //
analyzed: dad cing gus par phyag byas nas //
translated: With faith and respect, the disciple should bow to the guru‚Äôs feet

original: zhes pa'o // ngag gis /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // ngag gis /
translated: means with the body.

original: de dag thams cad khas blang ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad khas blang ngo //
translated: Accept all of thoseüîΩmeans with speech.

original: zhes pa ste bkal stsal pa bzhin du bgyi'o zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste bkal stsal pa bzhin du bgyi'o zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: One should say, ‚ÄúI will do as instructed.‚ÄùüîΩWith a very definite mind

original: sems kyis / shin tu nges pa'i yid kyis ni //
analyzed: sems kyis / shin tu nges pa'i yid kyis ni //
translated: means with the mind.

original: zhes pa ste slob dpon gyi ngo tsam khas blang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ste slob dpon gyi ngo tsam khas blang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that one accepts only the master‚Äôs words.

original: sems thag pa nas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems thag pa nas so zhes pa'o //
translated: One should say, From the heart.

original: de yan chad kyis snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: de yan chad kyis snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Up to this point, the mandala ritual for the arising of great compassion is complete.
